K1NaTPEgfLOCnXooQvnt8A.text: This place is a mess: What a joke. The owner (the creepy guy with he fake teeth in an all white suit - looks like Ted Knight in Caddyshack) was a complete a-hole. Our waitress was rude, the hostess was rude. Drinks were bad. We called ahead to reserve a table outside for happy hour on the patio at a table to which they said you don't need one it's first come first serve. We get there and it's only at the bar and communal table so we have to sit inside at 4:30 when the entire patio is empty. We have eaten out there for HH before. Maybe this place is fun if you're senile but the cute fountain outside isn't worth the crappy attitudes and bad drinks. Apparently the food is terrible too but I didn't wait around to find out. Don't waste your money or your time.

sFt_eA1Jbo1MioMI5kHKBw.text: Excellent food great service the patio is amazing with the views! Truly enjoyed the ambiance of this place!

nHydp3p4f4wkRpMgIrw1Hg.text: We celebrated our son's 22nd birthday under the supermoon next to a lovely fireplace. Of course it's always fun to start a meal here with those yummy, gooey, sweet sticky buns, although they should finish with them as a dessert. I had the blue crab, ahi tuna & avocado stack with an orange reduction garnish for entree which was perfect in portion for me. The crab was tasty, however, there weren't many distinguishable chunks. Tuna was excellent. Bday boy's tequila jumbo shrimp were indeed enormous as advertised and delicious. Other entrees were standard fare-braised beef short ribs and a roasted pork loin. Lovely little white chocolate pyramid bday dessert with candle topped off a very nice dinner.

cj40fmijgPv_YVV1CZ2lrA.text: Just had the grapefruit basil smash. Best cocktail I have ever had. My husband had barrel aged old fashion and he thought it was phenomenal as well. We will definitely be back for brunch and dinner.  Ask for Ceasar...best bartender!

photos.caption: Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. Grapefruit Basil Smash

_P-oTMEvyFRJApZxwa1lpA.text: I was extremely disappointed with our brunch today. Our party of 6 was celebrating a couple birthdays at a restaurant that, in the past, we'd had nothing but praise. The dissatisfaction started with $6 valet parking in a parking lot that blocks off all paved parking for valet. In a town where people wear sandals year round, have to shake pebbles out of your shoes before entering the restaurant isn't fun. Upon being seated, our waitress took a few of our drink orders while the rest needed time to decide. Brought those drinks quickly, then disappeared for a while. Eventually returned to take our order. Decided to try the Tangerine Freeze, a very decent shake, with booze, that tastes just like an orange push-up. It would have been nice had the person that prepared the drinks, also wiped all the ice cream of the outside of the glass so you could pick it up without getting sticky fingers. One of our dining companions wanted the breakfast flat bread, but can't have cheese. This proved a problem because all the flatbreads, every single one in the kitchen, were already prepped with cheese. Fine, orders something else. The omelette special was a ribeye steak with grilled onions and peppers. Came out, and actually looking like an omelette, instead of over cooked unscrambled eggs, a plus, but was barely warm and the steak was completely over-cooked and leathery. The avocado BLT tasted ok, but the bacon was soggy, cold, and far removed from crisp. The biscuit and sausage gravy was very disappointing; biscuits dry and tough, gravy cold and stingy. Most of the breakfasts included an English muffin, which was cold, soaked in butter, and not really toasted much at all. The potatoes where giant chunks of potato that had been deep fried, while seasoned nicely, they also were not crispy, actually almost soggy, and not remotely cooked all the way through. As others have noted, server attentiveness seems to fall off as the meal progressed.   Overall, I don't expect any in our group to return. It's apparent that the remodel a few years ago, not only took away the homey essence, but removed the kitchen from any semblance of providing warm, let alone hot food. An ignoble end, to what was once a great restaurant with an awesome view, and turned it into a restaurant simply going through the motions and charging a premium for subpar food.

YwR4mN94Ga3nuKDYxhIjLw.text: El Chorro is a beautiful upscale restaurant in the heart of Paradise Valley. Generations have been coming there for anything from Sunday brunch to a drink at happy hour.  My family usually only goes there for Thanksgiving and Christmas. This Thanksgiving was another wonderful experience. Great food, great service and a beautiful setting.  Holiday lunch/dinner is a set menu with your choice of a beef, turkey or fish.  Since it was Thanksgiving I opted for the turkey dinner served with all the traditional accompaniments; mashed potatoes and gravy, stuffing, green beans and of course cranberry sauce. Also included to start out is a relish tray of mixed fresh veggies, a bowl of candied fruit and nuts, El Chorro's famous sticky buns and your choice of soup or salad. I chose the Waldorf salad to start.   Everything was fantastic!  There was also a choice of three desserts at the end but I just didn't have room so I took my pumpkin pie to go.    Ron was our server. What a nice guy! He made us feel so welcome, we didn't feel rushed (El Chorro is very busy) and he had a great sense of humor. We hope to get Ron again for our Christmas dinner.   Reservations are always a good idea at El Chorro and an absolute must for a holiday. I recommend making reservations at least two months in advance for Thanksgiving, Christmas and Easter.   Enjoy!

uk1k6yzfv0ERTKbKEldQEg.text: I found El Chorro to be a wonderful restaurant on all fronts. The service from valet to table service was excellent. It was polite, timely, and smooth. I did take off a star for their bizarre and annoying valet tagging system which was the only blip in my otherwise flawless experience. My appetizers came out quickly and were quite tasty. The main course followed after just the right amount of time. The turkey was juicy and flavorful with perfect sides of mashed potatoes. I followed with cheesecake for dessert which was equally wonderful. This is a pricey restaurant, but I think the food, ambiance, and service make it worth while.

ZI3AP9OpS4X4YUO6GQD7IA.text: We have gone to El Chorro 3 to 4 times in the last 2 years and each time, the service and food was excellent.  We like their menu and always find something different to eat that we like.  Last time, I had the Santa Barbara Mussels for an appetizer, which were excellent.  This time, we had the cheese and charcuterie plate.  For two people, it was more than enough.  I thought they were a bit skimpy with the charcuterie they offered and I was not impressed with the cheeses they offered - a blue cheese, cheddar, triple cream and perhaps manchego, which was the tastiest.  For dinner, I had the seafood pasta. Again, it was pretty tasty although they again were a bit skimpy with the seafood.  They only put three mussels in the seafood and clams were few in number as well.  The two other people in my party enjoyed the food more and enjoyed their fillet and rack of lamb..  When we go back next time, I will stick to the mussels for an appetizer and the fillet, and maybe one day, I will save room for desert.  Again great service and ambience on the patio is fantastic.

PVQo07WSLXbN0AnmTdcRZw.text: I can't remember ever writing a bad review but this place is horrible.  The service is horrendous.  We were extremely polite but the server was rude.  We asked if we could get a plain omelette and he said if it's not on the menu you aren't going to get it.  Who says that?  Every time he came back he had another rude comment.  It's not my fault you are a waiter at 45.... sorry bro...go to school like the rest of us.

FpIFQC_4ZYbg03hdpr_hbg.text: We had a lovely dinner on Saturday.  Our waiter, Jeff, was attentive, knowledgeable and made our night out memorable.

UyJL9UwCOyzOPlwpyXmxug.text: Never having been to El Chorro before I was excited when my work announced that we would be having our holiday party there this year. It turned out to be a great choice.  We are a decent sized company so we had a room to ourselves in the back of the property. It looked like it was a room that could be used for wedding receptions or any other kind of party. There were several large round tables set up and a full bar in the back. There was an outdoor area too but it was night and kinda chilly so everyone stayed inside for the most part. Another plus was that there was plenty of parking. It's not always easy to find ample parking for a group of 100+.  The evening started with passed hors d'oeuvres that were delish - prosciutto-wrapped scallops, crab-cakes and an onion tartlette of some kind. Whatever it was it tasted good! The staff was very friendly and accommodating to our group.  For dinner I had the shortribs which came with a side of beans and potatoes. It was really good. The meat was extremely tender (melt-in-your-mouth-type), cooked to perfection and juicy and flavorful. Shortribs are not a lean cut of beef but it was worth it. I enjoyed every bite.  One person at our table got a very tough tough piece of fish and they had no problem replacing her meal as quickly as possible without hassle.   Overall, we had a very nice time, the food was great and the staff friendly. I'd highly recommend El Chorro for a corporate party or reception.

H-4iMKjxH-NKAPktGvvTbQ.text: I have to say I was pretty disappointed with our brunch experience here.   Ok class, let's have a lesson. What makes a good, traditional, Eggs Benedict?   Easy question, you say?  Answer: Nice crispy, toasted English muffin, meat of your choosing (let's go with Canadian Bacon), creamy delicious Hollandaise.  What am I missing, class?  Ah yes, a beautiful poached egg, which bursts when pierced, spilling it's silky, golden yolk.   Ok so now that we've had our lesson, let's put it into practice. My eggs Benedict was served with three quartered tomatoes, very very very crunchy potatoes with no seasoning and two eggs Benedict. One was completely missing a yolk! Bummer. When our server came over, I told him and he brought out a new one, but the yolk was overcooked. Bummer, times two. My friend also had an overcooked egg on his plate.  For the prices they're charging, we should have had four perfectly cooked eggs and well seasoned potatoes. It's brunch, not brain surgery.   The space is beautiful, and the server was pleasant, but I won't come back. Too many other places to try for brunch.

YogxQStpJZXp4leXldHJoA.text: Had a group outing here. As usual everything was perfect (for the price it should be). What puts it over the top is the excellent staff to go along with great food.

qMkvan1HPxveKwjkw404DA.text: We were extremely disappointed today. We were seated at a very nice table and preparing to order. Prior to a server accepting an order, someone from the hostess podium came to our table and told us we would have to move; the table was reserved. I stated that we had a reservation. She stated that the particular table we occupied was reserved for some one else. We were then moved to an "ok" location in the restaurant. My husband is a cancer patient and being moved was a chore. No one cared. Food was good as was service. Guess certain patrons are more important than others. Very disappointed in the pretentiousness.

kfNgMkhi_fkpe5hk0UaHuQ.text: Excellent experience and ambience. Had a great time however 3 (out of 4) got very sick (likely food poisoning) the next day. Past experiences have been great and this is the first time this has happened but we got very sick and can only attribute it to our dinner at El Chorro.

mry1fbWkSkaHgNcEcxuZrA.text: I was in Scottsdale visiting my sister and was told to try this place out.  Very nice relaxing atmosphere.  Food was fabulous... didn't feel rushed at all.  Totally recommend sitting on the patio!

DvUeqCMGgsFvx09qxoyQUA.text: It doesn't get much more Arizona than El Chorro, and you can't replicate the experience.  The sticky buns are an AZ classic and a great twist on the normal dinner roll.  You can't go wrong with the steak, always delicious, but the more unique menu choices are also amazing!  Try the lamb or the Stroganoff!  El Chorro is full of charm, great service, and Arizona history!  Don't forget to take a look around and read the amazing history!  Always a favorite!

FJDLKCnQbvTwYLF5aVwyNg.text: Wow just wow. We were in town for spring training, this place is awesome. Just wonderful all around. I never thought we would be having Margaritas and Chateaubriand and their Sticky buns! The service was great our server was very knowledgeable of the menu and wine. It was gorgeous view.  It was crazy busy but we didn't expect any less.

X1cI0P-7gxllsO0ZLM0D6g.text: The husband and I originally came here for a Yelp Cocktail Society event and decided we should come back to try more of the menu since the appetizers were delicious. I received an email regarding their Christmas dinner, which included Lobster Bisque, so the husband was sold and reservations were made.   We sat inside, but the patio looked very pretty and inviting with the lights. However, just a tad too chilly! Our server was nice and helpful and while the restaurant didn't seem very busy, the service was a little slow. (People seated after us received their food before us and such. Not sure where the holdup was!)  The husband ordered the lobster bisque and I ordered the salad off the Christmas Prix Fixe Menu as our starters. The husband liked his bisque and my salad was good. Neither appetizer was spectacular but not bad. For our main course, both of us ordered the Roasted Beef Tenderloin with horseradish potatoes. The beef was tender and the potatoes were good. I liked them together, as the beef needed a little extra spice. The beef alone didn't have much flavor/spice otherwise. (The husband wasn't very impressed and had to order an extra side of horseradish.) For dessert, we both ordered the bread pudding - big mistake. Yes, the portion of bread pudding was huge but it was also bland. It wasn't like any other bread pudding I've had before, more like a thick sponge cut in half. I saw other diners order the red velvet cake and was immediately jealous. (I'm a huge desert person and barely ate this bread pudding.)  Overall, the dinner was okay, but definitely not my favorite. For the price, I feel like we could have gone somewhere else and received a better meal overall.   ***Not being factored into the review, but something I wanted to bring up: The husband and I received 2 gift cards from our Yelp Cocktail Event - completely free. This was a very generous offer from the establishment and much appreciated. We were very excited to come back and to use the gift cards. As we were paying for our meal, we had the waiter check the denomination as we were never told the amount on the cards. Unfortunately, one of the gift cards was blank. I understand that they were free gift cards, but anyone would expect them not to be blank. Just a tad disappointing and hope no one else received a blank card as well! Please note, this is not being factored into the review, as I am only basing the stars given on the food and service.***

cUYa_oe0wYxO1JKOOHORWw.text: Classic beef stroganoff. That right. The over played now a TV dinner dish. But here, the beef is filet mignon. Heavenly noodles and rich sauce. Yum! Try it!

4Ue_oW8sylCxkgJeRoNCDA.text: This is not going to be a good review. Why?  Because I have been there 3 times and spoke very highly of this place, and from the moment we entered it was a disappointment, not only to me and my husband, but our guests as well. First off it was summer, we normally are in Arizona in winter.  But it was a lovely evening for the patio.  The patio looked quite different, no tables set, no menus, no Ambiance at all.  The hostess was quite rude when we mentioned wanting to sit on the patio. And in her answer of Yes we can sit outside, but she would have to find a server.  That in itself sounded strange.  She could have shared, that to them it's summer and most people want to be inside, but no, she shared nothing but a poor attitude.  So then we decided we were not going to get good service outside and then chose to go in doors. Five o'clock starts Happy Hour, and we were there before 5.  So we sat down.  No one bothered to come to our table.  It's 10 after Five, 10 minutes went by and again, no one.  My husband stopped a busboy and asked if a waitress could come to our table?  When the waitress finally showed up, no apology, and a bit of an attitude AGAIN.  THEN A MANAGER came by and we let him know our feelings.  He came out with some Sticky Rolls as an apology. First off we ordered liquor drinks, Sticky rolls don't go with liquor.  Then we see he returned and gave the table near us the same thing, so no he really didn't care about us either.  The food we always ordered, was Just not good.  We ordered six appetizers to start, everything tasted like it was first frozen, just sad that a lovely place turned so bad in just a few months.  We had just been there in March of 2017 and this was Sept. 2017 was it under new management? New hostess new waitresses Something had to change because the Caring, was missing, big time, and so will we be....

o_P4N5bC80go_aRRXEeZYw.text: Your response simply confirms my original complaint that El Chorro does not accommodate diners with food allergies (re-read how you totally ignored my complaint).  At El Chorro, diners must apparently accommodate your chef not themselves.   I appreciate that you serve 400 people at once but you should do it one customer at a tine.  And when we were there, the dining room was only half full.  Apparently you disregarded my complaint with an odd offer to have us back.  We left Sunday because there was no one item on the menu that my daughter could have.  Not one thing. And you wouldn't even leave out cheese (which she is allergic to) from an omelette so she could find something to eat.   Because of your unnecessary inflexibility, anyone with or without a food allergy that would like to be in control of what they eat  should avoid El Charro.  It could be toxic.

4WAAeKxvvaW3OW-y3h32ng.text: El Chorro has become our family celebration venue and the place I go with out of towners. it is a lovely setting and usually excellent food. But I had the worst filet mignon I've ever had there our last visit. It was very overcooked and dry and extremely chewy (I ordered medium). When I say worst, it may be the worst I have ever had at any restaurant. So disappointing!  I will go there again but not sure I'll take visitors there -- and I definitely will not order a filet.

A7266sQTQfjzoAFoyz7k8Q.text: Worst server I've ever encountered. Extremely condescending to all four of us. Our out of town friends were excited to come to the restaurant, and definitely loved the setting. Waiter appeared to not want to do his job. He couldn't pronounce seafood of the day (Ono - said he didn't care and pronounced it Uno), was very unfriendly when it came to recommendations or answering basic questions. If I ever return, I'd demand another server.

sgVfEKxBcSCTrGGg8hY0CQ.text: Happy hour on Thursday was delightful. We sat outside at a group high top table. Everyone so friendly and happy to be there. Our waitress was so great, no rush, but drinks and food arrived quickly. The atmosphere and people watching was fun, too. Great french fries and sliders. Thanks for a fun night.

CxJrfbc3ndmRNCQWFIeJIQ.text: Great place for happy hour. Arrive as close to 4:00 as you can great selection of $5.00 appetizers and good wine. The Margaritas are tasty but small. Go with the wine. Yes they even have sticky buns on the happy hour menu

ay_8ZZKoWSJL_424dz2EDw.text: Not quite up to the standard I have come to expect for this restaurant. Perhaps because it was so cold the night we were there they were having a bad evening. But the service, hostess and food were all mediocre. One example: We ordered the sticky buns, used to come with the meal but I understand the need to be profitable and stay in business. The menu said 6 buns- we received 4. While I didn't need 2 more that is what the menu states and what we ordered. I hope it improves and goes back to the high standards it used to have.

s2Xcol-0ETOH1VjzJV7GIA.text: I totally agree with Amy R.  Took our mom there for a Mother's Day brunch, and we will go elsewhere next year. At $75 a pop, I expect a much better fare than what was presented.  It seemed that the chef staff has very little experience in what people want when it comes to a buffet.  No scrambled eggs, pancakes with what looked like thick gravy on them (actually some thick walnut sauce..great for those people with nut allergies)  NO waffle bar where you can dress your own, too much shrimp and shellfish, and the dessert table...SHAMEFUL! Also, just a word to the clueless staff that seats people.  When you see that a person has a wheelchair or walker, don't be stupid enough to make them go through an obstacle course of tables and chairs, and don't seat people with handicaps so far from the main entrance.  When someone calls for a reservation ASK if there are guests with physical limitations before you drag them all the way to Casa Palomares, or BFE.  I told the girl I made reservations with that mother was handicapped, and I guess that flew over her head.  Perhaps a call to the ADA would remedy that.   The banquet room was so small and it seems that not only were guests in each others way, but trying to manuever around tables was like making your way around a giant obstacle course. Next year..T. Cooks or Avanti's!

T6V_WCguFt_JZKTb4rfYjg.text: Beautiful grounds. Servers were pleasant and professional. Enjoyed a great meat and cheese platter. I had a shrimp risotto that was flavored well, unfortunately the risotto wasn't cooked properly. For the price, you would expect it to be done near perfect. It wasn't. Atmosphere was relaxing and had ole time upscale southwest charm and decor. Dessert sadly was disappointing, apple pie and fudge brownie. Overall may try again for date night.

9lijFfA-CDyy2vu-9pHOYw.text: such a blast from the past, i used to come here long ago as a child, when the previouse owner joe had the place, only the fondest memories here, the food was as always very good, from the fillet,to the desert and the amazing sticky buns, i have only been back a few times since the new ownership, happy to see them doing well. i remember every week friday night dinner for years was always at El chorro. lines always out the door a sense of family youd be waitting in line for a table when a friend sitting at another table would invite you to join them. fantastic memories, set in an amazing  surrounding, at this long standing favorite gem.

photos.caption: Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. tirimisu
Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. titos rocks orane twist
Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. nice and rare fillet

couZttkk9NRo48bZ5dDorA.text: Delicious classic food. Love coming here for family dinners, as their food is always made to perfection. The shrimp cocktail is a great appetizer and I typically go with the salmon. And don't forget the sticky rolls, they're to die for (the leftovers are also good for morning coffee :) ). They always have blankets for their guests too, which is great if you're anything like me and get cold easily- such a considerate thing and the hospitality goes a long way.

photos.caption: Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States
Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States

9uQ3p6Y8_Opzr3awi2ga7A.text: A classic, long time favorite worthy of 5 stars. The setting is terrific, the service over the top and the cuisine first class. It's perfect for everything from happy hour to a full blown dinner. While not inexpensive, it is worth every penny.

Yl0vops0BH3mTkYt4VfREg.text: Had dinner here on Thursday night, it wasn't that crowded. We got a table next to a nice fireplace outside it was around 50 degrees They brought us blankets and the overhead heater kept us warm.  We had a great meal and the service was excellent. Will definitely back next time we visit Scottsdale.

t0avgTvuTPeYj3r62nuQqA.text: We've been to El Chorro multiple times over the last 5-6 years & have never had a bad experience. Yesterday was terrible. We were told "no substitutions" on a couple requests. We were charged for extra bread basket refills. My sons's order of pancakes was totally forgotten & in the end, the waiter didn't apologize for a thing!! We spoke w/ the manager when we received our bill because on top of the awful service, there was a 20% gratuity included! The manager was very kind & took off the gratuity, the charge for the bread refill & the forgotten pancakes. I'm so sad this happened b/c El Chorro is always someplace I want to go when I visit Phoenix! Very disappointed.

tPOfChXidBlgOP6oUHHftg.text: Let's get one thing straight, the location and setting is wonderful. Most of the cuisine was cooked, seasoned, and presented well with satisfying portions.   (restaurant week menu) - Watermelon, Tomato, & Jicama Salad, Polenta & Vegetable Napoleon, and strawberry shortcake.  (regular menu) - Shrimp pepper pot and Beef Stroganoff   The highlights on the food include the Beef Stroganoff (the fresh pasta and the sauce was superb) and the Polenta & Vegetable Napoleon (beautiful dish and vegetables were cooked nicely). The sauce on the shrimp pepper pot was flavorful but felt there was way too much bread served and would have preferred if the shrimp tails would have been pulled off. In addition, the salad and the strawberry shortcake was nothing to rave about.   Now onto the service. It was hugely underwhelming. For a fine establishment to have their patrons push aside their finished plates (pre-bus) for the staff and not have one our water glasses refilled throughout the entire dining experience was a vast disappointment and inexcusable. Our plates were not picked up until the next course arrived. We do not blame our server since she was occupied with other tables (who all were sat at about the same time) but there were multiple staff members around who completely zoned us out. Why bother when it isn't your table right?   All in all, El Chorro had tremendous potential but we left dissatisfied with the experience and will keep El Chorro off our list of restaurants in Scottsdale. Plenty of other high-quality restaurants to spend $150+ in Scottsdale/Phoenix.

photos.caption: Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. Watermelon, Tomato &amp; Jicama Salad
Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. Beef Stroganoff
Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. Polenta &amp; Vegetable Napoleon

ra30ceaCVZDkecdDfk2_RQ.text: Dant, Dant, Dant, Daaaaaaa! Tada, my 500th review! Yeah and what a fabulous review it will be. This place has been around for years and has a fascinating history. El Chorro is historic staple in Paradise Valley set around gorgeous views of Camelback and Mummy mountain. I have been wanting to go here for 30 pus years but never seem to have gotten around to it for whatever varied reasons. Once upon a time they used to close during the summer. However, now I hear it is under new management and was recently remodeled. Well, for my 500 review I picked their Happy Hour. We all had a great time at my UYE. Sorry peeps for being so early but it goes until 6pm so let's do it again sometime.   it was a small gathering but thanks friends for coming out. The Happy Hour here we have decided is the best Happy Hour in town. The food was delicious and the drinks were a great deal. 3 dollar wine and 5 dollar beers. 5 dollar food plates. We could not believe it! The final bill was very reasonable and we left totally stuffed. Okay well, I did stop at Sweet Republic on the way home but only because I was mad that I forgot to order Chorro's famous sticky buns. Sigh! Oh well, just another reason a return trip is mandated.  We sat on the patio at the community table and met some cool folks from Connecticut with Long Island roots. The weather was great and the company was superb!  Although a bit windy and hot it was cool on the patio with the misters. And seriously, that view! It can't be beat.   For food we ordered a variety of plates off their Happy Hour menu, Chicken Livers ( Not me), vegetable Crudite with Hummus, shrimp ( My favorite), SW Poutine ( I finally tried Poutine), Sliders with fries, and more chicken livers.  (Again not for me-YUK!- lol) My friends claim the chicken livers were great if you like that sort of thing. (Again not for me)   The wine and beer selection is pretty good and great price! We liked the white.   The view is spectacular.   Many return trips seen in my future.

photos.caption: Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. Fun server and beautiful atmosphere.
Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. Chili SW Poutine
Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. YUMMY shrimp!

FjRSUFLziN_RqthNuLWZ6g.text: I really don't get the negative reviews, understand you can have a single bad experience at any restaurant, but if you frequent El Chorro you know it's outstanding.   Went last night for birthday dinner: Atmosphere: 5 Stars Service: 5 Stars Food: 4.5 Stars   Outdoor dining at its finest in Arizona, service was impeccable.  Knowledgeable server, outstanding assistance with wine selection, prompt curious and friendly.  Drinks never empty, food served promptly, and cleared immediately, but never rushed.  Day before they call to confirm reservation and preferred seating; day after they even follow-up with a phone call for your feedback on your dining experience.  Signature sticky buns served timely, warm and delicious.  Wine and bourbon old fashion were great, started with crab cakes which were made to perfection.  Shrimp and beef stroganoff entrees well seasoned, served piping hot and very good, tenderloin was melt in your mouth tender.  I indicted birthday on open table reservation, but did not say anything to wait staff or hostess when they called the day prior; however, we were served a free white chocolate desert complete with candle....nice touch.    If you haven't tried El Chorro, it rates as top 10 food destination in Phoenix, don't miss it!

7j-jqmhEwCVqOWItENr8iA.text: If you are looking for substandard food, that is tired and dated, made by cooks who have zero passion or idea what the dish was supposed to taste like, this is the spot for you. We were told this was a staple in Az, little did we know that was until they were bought out about a decade ago. If you have no taste buds left, or still like your food prepared in the most uncaringly sloppy way possible, this is your spot. My steak almost moped at me, even though I asked for a touch under medium. The bearnaise sauce was so flavorless and improperly prepared that I thought that they had gotten it wrong and put a different sauce on my steak. I don't think there was a highlight to the meal, even after making a complaint to the waiter, and sending the steak away basically uneaten he simply did nothing about it and offered us a desert that I tried to decline, and wish I had as it was just as boring and uninspired. Save your money and go to steak44 or somewhere with a pulse. This place is a complete waste

BetOsyvPDUSjjW4Xjzlb-w.text: This is a great place to entertain guests from out of town. It's centrally located and the views are beautiful. We had a party of 11 and they easily accommodated us. To start we had the Artisan Cheese & Charcuterie plate, flash fried lobster bites and the crab and tuna dynamite.  They were all great but the best bang for your buck will be the charcuterie plate which pairs well with their Slingshot Cabernet Sauvignon. I ordered the Lamb Loin Chops and they were pretty good but just a little dry.  I should have gone with my initial choice which was the braised short ribs.  My neighbor ordered those and they looked amazing!  The only strange part was that they brought out their famous sticky buns (their house cinnamon rolls) before our entree's. I don't know about you but I like to wait to eat the sweet stuff after I have had my savory entree.  I would recommend it if you are trying to entertain out of town guests and it's also a great place for work get togethers.

XxnENwOk3Zx4nbuUzf-rCA.text: We came in to enjoy the happy hour. Prices were great, and our server was amazing! She was quite attentive and accommodating, even going so far as to split the bill for the group. We arrived around 4:30, and the place was already packed, so definitely plan on arriving early if you come in for happy hour!

ayLi7yShHCgDvf_IjT9yIA.text: I went to El Chorro for the first time last Saturday night. When we arrived at 5pm, there were 3 separate weddings occurring on the property - along with the regular dinner guests. That was the first 'red flag.' In my opinion, a venue cannot feel intimate (especially for a wedding) with that many other people around you.  We sat at the bar to try the happy hour menu. We ordered the twisted deviled eggs, the fish tacos, the perfect storm and the truffle fries. And sadly, we were unimpressed. The deviled eggs were deep fried and the fish tacos were served with a cheap white fish. The calamari was decent, but could have been cooked a tad longer. Which left the truffle fries.. and those were actually good! But it's hard to mess up truffle fries.   I hear the main dinner menu is much better. And they are known for their infamous 'beer burro'. I would be willing to go back to El Chorro to try the main menu, the sticky buns and see the burro. But right now I don't think it's worth all the hype.

X_2gCYx5Vg5zTyd-8-h3Nw.text: Delicious restaurant in Scottsdale! The venue was stunning, from the blooming flowers, large water fountain and expansive outdoor seating, it made it very enjoyable. The Mountain View's from the table were also very special. Service was very good and the food was even better. The appetizers and entrees were very, very tasty. We also got dessert from their unique sweets menu and it was fantastic. The Beet Ginger Cake was nothing I've ever tasted and was scrumptious. Would definitely return soon!

pMsG-hbBVw00VkCV9u6bpQ.text: We had reservations for brunch at 10:30 and were seated immediately next to the cutest fireplace facing the mountains. Our server was fantastic and very attentive. He was very knowledgeable about the menu and gave great suggestions. I had the parfait with fruit and bread from the starters menu. The parfait was incredible. It had strawberries, blueberries, bananas, granola and fresh honey. That was my favorite. The fruit was nice with cantaloupe, grapes, pineapple and honeydew. The bread was ok but a bit dry. I preferred the roll basket they gave at the beginning with the sticky rolls, a scone, and a croissant.  The grounds and atmosphere were beautiful. We explored a bit after and found it was set up for a wedding. I had to share a picture of the cute getaway Jeep!

photos.caption: Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. Getaway Jeep
Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. Entrance
Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. Parfait

4k10wFqYDnPkQD_BUDXRsQ.text: We've been here SO many times and usually have a really good experience. We went last night and took a bunch of friends who had never been before and had the most horrible experience I have ever had - potentially at any restaurant. Because of the rain we had to sit at a community table inside near the bar for a group of eight.   The waitress was extremely annoyed and rude that we were ordering dinner at this table even though that is where the host set us up. One would think she'd be excited to have a big table of adults racking up drinks and ordering full dinners. We would have stayed for more drinks had the service not been so horrible.   Even though the food and drinks were great, the service was such a turn off that I will definitely rethink coming here again.

KDLrKL3pgr4pdZlR7I3Wjw.text: This place never fails! Took momma here for happy hour. The El Chorro Margarita is delicious $5. Just the right amount of alcohol with mix. We also ordered white wine- great pour, as well as amazing service. We ordered The Perfect Storm as an app $10- rock shrimp and calamari pan-fried with a well-flavored dipping sauce. We ate it before I remembered to take a picture. :) another plus was that it came out in less than 5 minutes. Hands down one of my favorite happy hours in the Valley!! View is incredible as well.

photos.caption: Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. Happy hour menu
Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. Bar area- amazing service
Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. El Chorro Margarita

UA84G43Amaqpu0bF1xMmeg.text: Back for a perfect date night inside the dining room.  Wonderful and attentive waiter who knew the menu and the extensive wine list.  Truly a fantastic restaurant.

Heo--oCppEfocNTd1j19xQ.text: Luck you, Phoenix. To have such a fabulous restaurant in driving distance!  Pulled up to valet, got out and sucked in my breath. This place is GORGEOUS. From palm trees to outdoor fireplaces this is one of the nicest restaurants I've ever seen. I really love how warm and inviting it is. There is an abundance of outdoor seating and with the heat lamps and fireplace it really does keep the temperature nice and toasty (it was a mild 55).   Went into the bar and sat down at high top tables and was greeted with a basket of nirvana in the form of sticky buns. They know they could sell these things, right? WTH? I have never in all of my life been greeted with something so delicious when I sat down at a restaurant table. Go away, Cinnabon, you've been replaced, and handily. Hasta.   Ordered a glass of mediocre wine, Bogle. You can buy this wine for $8 a bottle at Total Wine so I certainly wouldn't pay $9 for a glass, but I wasn't paying, so...it was decent if you're getting it for free!  Anyway, onto the bar menu, which the only thing I ate off of. Ordered the mini grilled cheese sandwiches with three artisan cheeses. One happened to be blue cheese which I despise and waited until the last one to eat it. I asked the waitress, fabulous Rachel, if I could replace this with the brie and she said of course! She then proceeded to bring me a WHOLE plate of sandwiches! For free! You have to love great service! A co-worker got the chicken enchiladas, and while they were delicious, they had a sting to them so be careful! Those were on the dinner menu, not bar menu, by the way.   As we were leaving I asked for some sticky buns to go and Rachel brought a nice sized to go box of them for us. Thank you!!!   I could see spending a lot of time here if I lived in this area. It's beautiful, the staff is friendly (especially Rachel!) and the food is delicious! I would definitely highly recommend and I'll be SO jealous if you go!

LewrgkVAtHXm-4YUwLXg0g.text: This place lives up to the hype. Classy and elegant old world ambiance. We came with a party of 7 for my friend's b day and the service was great. Sticky buns are on point. I ordered the beet salad and filet. I out the steak above the majority of leading steakhouses in the area due to the cut of meat and the fact that they don't drown it in butter. Definitely coming back.

IbqQeo_5VhGdTquqpcKPwg.text: We went for my birthday back in March and it was perfect! We sat on the patio with a beautiful view of camelback mountain and shared an incredible meal! The wine was delicious, the sticky buns are incredible! My boyfriend got the salad and I got soup before sharing the chateaubriand for two! Wow. I like med rare, Johnny likes medium, it came out perfect for both of us! Plus the veggies! Delicious. Then came the dessert and since it was my birthday we got two!  Everyone needs to try to save room for dessert! I promise you will not be disappointed!   Oh and keep those sticky buns coming!!!

eTsZ-RRoX67UkSCYQUACKg.text: The sticky buns are to die for! We sat outside during brunch and the atmosphere was amazing. The only thing I would have changed is having our server be a little more attentive, but we came during a busy time.

RgCtkrgBEUxb5eCYWPbJNg.text: The perfect place for out of town guests. If the weather is nice their outside seating is great. Really nice scenery and excellent food. I have tried different omelettes and enjoyed every one of them. The best part is that they give free baskets of their stick buns, which are amazing, to each table. I have never been to El Chorro for dinner, only brunch.   The price is definitely high, but if you dont mind paying you won't regret it.

photos.caption: Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. Brunch

kNK917ur5JNP00MuEpTRdA.text: I had not been to El Chorro for many years. I was a bit nervous when I read some of the negative reviews. I went with two friends, celebrating our 40 year friendship. The evening was absolutely perfect. The atmosphere was absolutely beautiful. The service was excellent, and the food was outstanding. The filet was cooked to perfection. I will be back.

SP0k_PPrOB52OhWe7FYbdQ.text: Beautiful restaurant with a wonderful front of the house staff and just average food that is overpriced for the quality.  The menu descriptions are enticing but the dishes themselves just lack flavor.  If they delivered the taste they described then the prices would make sense.

ZPsKmvscdblgwaatO1YZ2Q.text: Had a horrible experience there with a group of friends.  We were  told by the manager we couldn't save any seats next to us for our friends that were on their way from work.  When I said to him that if that's the case, we wouldn't be able to meet there again... He said "I really don't care.".  Extremely rude waitress, as well..automatic tipping, or she would not have been so well compensated. My husband and I have dinner there occasionally.  He's a Vice President of a Phoenix based corporation and will no longer be bringing guests and associates there.  After many years in the Valley, goodbye to El Chorro!

2YKO1qX8XR1VOTx2-uZoNw.text: Although being sat without being greeted by our server for the first 15 minutes was rather agitating, it was quickly camouflaged by the free mimosas we were offered by a manager for the inconvenience. The food is great and is surprisingly inexpensive (I've only tried the brunch menu). The location is just beautiful and the service aside from the mishap in the beginning, is acceptable. I will be back and I would recommend to anyone looking for brunch in a beautiful setting at an affordable cost.

iSt5PkmT7Ik5tnQuVFU8xQ.text: Five stars, however, El Chorro deserves more than just lowly stars.  El Chorro deserves a rating system of a different sort.   El Chorro, for all its perfection, deserves a rating system using little baby unicorns decked-out in jewels and adorned with splendid colorful pageantry.  The unicorns would smell heavenly too; a blend of newborn baby and warmed Ghirardelli chocolate. Under this rating system, I'd give El Chorro the highest rating possible.  From beginning to end, the El Chorro experience was impeccable.  Service, ambiance, food, and drink; all were flawless. I even liked the valet for Christ's sakes.  The duck breast was so delicious, each bite had me wishing ducks had more breasts, like dogs. If they did, I'd devour every last one of them. In fact, the preparation was so perfect with its melt in your mouth texture, I'd have no reservations about eating the bill, feathers, webbed feet, private parts, and quack. I've never sampled duck breast this delicious!  For appetizers, consider the tomato and burrata cheese plate. The cheese is velvety smooth and creamy. The balsamic, thick and sweet, likely from Modena and not Milwaukee. The tomatoes come from their garden; red, ripe and dripping with sweet juicy goodness. In concert, these flavors will excite your taste buds, giving them little tiny taste bud boners.   For dessert, try the strawberry shortcake. The chef prepares a wonderfully delicious shortbread cake, presenting it in a small pond of berry compote.  And in the berry pond, a plethora of fresh berries, feverishly swimming about in an ill-fated attempt to avoid my fork.  This is a dessert to behold and I strongly recommend you consume it at warp speed, this so you can steal shovelfuls from your dining partner's plate when she's not paying attention.  Probably the best reason to visit El Chorro, other than the aforementioned is the stunning view of Camelback mountain at sunset. Truly remarkable. I recommend patio seating for the best view.  The next time I visit, I'm bringing a toaster along so I can electrocute myself after taking my last bite. Mainly because I can't imagine life getting any better than this.

1y3ecg0Ebvh1DBbY2Cy2Zg.text: This is one of the most beautiful places in Scottsdale!!  They have indoor and outdoor seating with great views of Camelback mountain.  I went once and sit inside and it is fine dining and great service. We got the Hummus and veggie appetizer and all the veggies were so fresh!!  The second time we sat outside and it was a little chilly so they brought all the ladies blankets. How nice!  The food is always fantastic here! Very great pork.  This place is expensive, but well worth it for a celebration. It is great for showing out of town guests what Scottsdale is like. They have a beautiful section out back lined with trees where I think they hold events/weddings and such.    So beautiful! I'll be back again soon!

OKwgwbK33VvU_0v2gNK0wg.text: My boyfriend and I were enjoying a 2 night staycation for the 4th of July at the JW Marriott next door and saw this place when we were pulling in. After looking into it on yelp I was definitely looking forward to giving it a shot.   We walked up to a quaint spot tucked away with cute twinkle lights outside on the patio. Like most people stated in their reviews it's a cute southwest place to get a bite to eat. Kind of made me think of a grandma and grandpas ranch house.   As an appetizer we ordered the flash fried lobster tail. Note to self: if It says "market price" as what it is. Our appetizer was $48. Call us novices, but we didn't realize it would cost more than either of our entrees. The appetizer was good and the breeding very light, but if I'm being honest it was not $48 good.   He ordered the salmon with potatoes and veggies and I got the peppercorn filet. The salmon was glazed and pretty d'lish while the potatoes had some kind of chive sour cream in it. Sour cream in mashed potatoes was good but the chive was pretty overbearing. The peppercorn filet was cooked perfectly and it came with a sauce that I really had no use for because I liked the overall flavor of he steak. The sauce it came with was chilled and In a cute little thing to pour it from. My potatoes were more like a hash and they were DELICIOUS!  Oh and we ordered the sticky buns to go and popped them in the microwave later...yum!!  Overall it was good, but I didn't seem to be as taken back as everyone else. The atmosphere as I mentioned is southwest which can feel outdated and the crowd is a bit older. Being up in PV I think this is a bit to be expected.

WDmA2uVWg57WE9Oom9qHrg.text: Went to El Chorro tonight and while the the food was really good, the service was lackluster. Our waitress was not very attentive and disappeared for long stretches. Our initial drink order took forever and she didn't seem too interested  in our dining experience. One of the runners brought our charcuterie board appetizer and when I asked what was in it he had no idea, seriously?? Honestly I doubt we will be back with so many choices in the valley.

leLWcSmc0VOzNBd2R-bZgw.text: For some reason, the sticky buns were awful, dry and so hard and chewy they were difficult to cut with a knife. Disappointing since the sticky buns are the draw for me.

f_USp4XBmlCQ-tWS3ZhVGA.text: Sad to say our dining experience last night was below par to say the least. We love the venue and outdoor patio and views but our dinner was more like Outback Steakhouse with a 250.00 price tag attached   We order the fried lobster tail app that came out chewy! My wife ordered the jumbo prawn dinner with risotto n asparagus, first thing my wife noticed was one of her jumbo prawns on display on top of her entree was full of poop right on front street the chef couldn't use a pooper scooper??? My steak was a ribeye for 52bucks that was thin, chewy and over cooked. All of this with no comp of any of it to make us feel at least a little better, don't see us going back for a long time!

eMPEfZY1623IAMv6QWyCXQ.text: I wanted to love it--great ambiance.  The hostesses were charming and the food was delicious, but the service was so so at best :(.  The patio was beautiful.  But...the server was bland, not particularly helpful and he was slow to respond.

B0XJSI2WJ5-ur_QRpeGpDg.text: I have nothing negative to say about El Chorro.  They improved and the food is always good.  Over the years going there has been fun brunch with friends.  I have never had bad service here.  There has been ownership changes over the years and improvements to the property and food. Those darn Bloody Mary's are fantastic.   If you are from out of town and have not had the chance to stop in, please do. This along with Lon's Hermosa are two of my favorite brunch spots.  during cooler months when you can enjoy the outdoors, they have fantastic patio dining.

E7Na6C9foz9N2Z9ClHdeog.text: Gorgeous setting and atmosphere but the happy hour was sub par. The margarita (which didn't come in a margarita glass) was $5 and didn't taste good at all. Probably the worst margarita I have had in every way. I had the sticky buns (cinnamon buns) for $5 which were tasty and the best part of the experience. The $7 kobe beef sliders (only 2 for $7) were sad, there was very little meat and mainly just a bun with a tomato slice and pickle. Definitely not a good deal. They didn't come with fries either. $3 domestic bottled beers is nothing to write home about.  All in all I would not go back here for happy hour and probably won't give the full menu a shot.

QqA-kVns9ITe2rpQ5_acxA.text: I'm not one to write reviews... in fact the ONLY other yelp review I've written was for El Chorro a few years ago. But after yet another spectacular brunch today, I feel compelled to comment again. The food and atmosphere is much the same as I've always enjoyed, (phenomenal), but what made today really special was the service. Our server Nate went out of his way to make us feel welcome and catered to, and complied with each special request with good humor and quick action. Impressive, as he was also training a new employee, and tending to other tables during a busy Sunday morning. We'll be back to see him again!

kMF5gOA4VBTLI-on1vni6A.text: Beautiful location, very good service, food is just average besides the sticky buns served prior to your meal.Very pricey for meals. Great view of Camelback Mountain.

XdfP6bckNGmNStUoabsckg.text: We visit El Chorro every year as we must have their famous Sticky Buns. These things rock.  Anyhow we came for our 11:30 reservations on Super Bowl Sunday prepared for the crowds...nope place was less then half full. Strange, but nice for us.  Anywho, I ordered my usual here, the Huevos Rancheros.  For some reason it's completely different here each time. It was pretty good, not what I was expecting, but good. Wifey ordered the Bacon and Eggs, sadly had to be sent back because her over medium eggs were an under cooked runny mess. Our Server had the re cooked and came out great. We also decided to split a bowl of the Chili Verde. Glad we did since I poured it over my Rancheros to liven it up a bit.  The only other gripe I have about this place is the $5 charge for parking. Just odd since they are not in the middle of down town, but out in middle of no where.  I pull up and the Valet actually says "you wanna pay me 5 bucks now or when you come out?"  If it weren't for the sticky buns that are there, I would have told him to piss off and left. Just kinda tacky for an alleged high end brunch place.  But, maybe that's why they were less then half full on the biggest weekend of the year for the Valley.

photos.caption: Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States
Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. Eggs with Chorizo, or as they call it &#34;Huveos Rancheros&#34; not.
Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. Brunch menu

zXa_VGbnmflmFZbjezUNvw.text: Enjoyed dinner last night with local friends from Phoenix and such a lovely experience. The fish of the night was Sea Bass served on a parmesan risotto with lightly sauteed tomatoes with green beans....delicious. My husband had the Trout Almondine and still talking about it. The wine selection was impressive and our server Joseph was very attentive. This place was hopping with a full house and a wedding as well.  Timmy Moore was so very gracious checking on us throughout the evening.  The ambience lends itself for intimate conversation and truly a pleasurable dining experience.  If sitting outside, toss in a light sweater for comfort.

5IQaUUqSNKutcZd74w5tbw.text: Excellent and relaxing place for breakfast of brunch.  Often take people from out of town here and love the history and beautiful grounds.  The food is awesome too.  I always have the Cobb salad!!

2-3f90RvYkzwwxfNImYooQ.text: We had been here before though not recently and never for brunch.  We had a good experience.  Service was attentive enough then better as the patio thinned out.  Our waiter had some delays initially but soon was keeping a close eye on us. He refilled water without a need to request.  I had the huevos rancheros and was pleased though the recipe wasn't what I expected.  My wife had the avocado  BLT and was pleased. The martinis were good though a little overpriced. The wine by the glass was a good selection, a little overpriced.  The valet parking is an aggravation.  It feels like a way to extract a few extra dollars plus tip.  It would be nice to have handicapped places nearby the entrance. No other reason this was not a five star experience.

BA_HJ9x5P53Qh_pbJNusIg.text: Have been here twice now and both times have been a magical experience. Food was excellent, and the beautiful setting whether you sit inside or out is enjoyable. The staff was informative and helpful, and they discreetly take care of things. Some restaurants of this caliber have too many folks hovering if you know what I mean. Great experience all the way around and I highly recomme

rob8MNMP3B13aab9RoN49A.text: Always come here for special occasions- generally for the brunch. Morning views of Camelback are spectacular. The buns and bread basket are great. You get several choices of Eggs Benedict ( regular, veggie, smoked salmon, lobster or filet) very filling and delicious. The breakfast menu is diverse however with many choices   Reliable, delicious and well worth it!

TXafORn_QKgpFSRfd2tK0A.text: yes we came for the sticky buns.  We ordered drinks before dinner and almost forgot about the sticky buns, Our waiter clayton wasn't the best. while he was walking away i said excuse me and had to say it a few times and i finally stops almost out of the room and stands there looking at me. he finally walks back and i asked for the sticky buns. I guess you have to ask for them as they wont bring them to your table without asking for them. We rarely saw him and even the maitre d helped us out , she was great.  The sticky buns are as good as everybody says they are. I ended up ordering the pork loin only because it came with green chile risotto and butternut squash, The best thing on the dish was the green chile risotto. butternut squash was not what i expected and was bad and i didn't care for the pork tenderloin. i would never order this again. i would order the risotto.    sticky buns 5 star risotta 4.5 drink 4 pork tenderloin 3 butternut squash 2

ElEG5oXqzI0uVRLVLiM8qw.text: I have never been treated so badly or made to feel so unwelcome.  I can understand if they have rules regarding large groups but they could have been pleasant in the way we were informed that we could not save seats for even a short while and no separate checks allowed. Disappointed because  it is such a lovely place and I will not be taking friends or family there and will be telling them not to go there. I certainly wont be back.

msbgTo14wCzoFRlL9oxMWQ.text: A remarkable experience from top to bottom. In my twelve years of living in the valley, it was my first time dining at El Chorro and I certainly was not disappointed in any way. From the ease of making a reservation on Opentable to speaking to the hostess on the phone and to being warmly welcomed upon our arrival - it was only the beginning of a great experience.  It was a lovely day today sitting on the patio and we had a a great server (Christopher). We both ordered eggs benedict and they were splendid and prepared and delivered to the table in no time. The legendary sticky buns also accompanied our meal and they were beyond delicious but not  as sticky as I expected :-)  El Chorro also serves dinner which I was not aware of and the menu looked very appealing. I highly recommend El Chorro as a special venue for get togethers, birthdays, family celebrations or just simply as a getaway for Sunday brunch or dinner. Enjoy!

gwZVtXB0KsOC5whWMeFgRQ.text: Another one of my regular hang outs. Great location, beautiful setting, friendly and attentive staff. The sticky buns are excellent. Feels more like a house than a business, very unique location and set up. Five stars.

_X-z1QaMNMknmK8JUSSfrQ.text: Great outside dining and bar is outside but covered. Stickey buns are a tradition and a must! Great place to bring out of town guests.

D7sXdtH3b_hwFpCGrVbUbg.text: Much improved experience. Great food, incredible service from Brittany. A lovely evening. Much better than our last brunch experience.

EjHZ_GvYL0BtrsAi4BNH8Q.text: El Chorro has amazing views of Camelback Mountain, and is a solid restaurant with what I would call traditional American fare, but the one downside is the rather exorbitant prices, which I guess is to be expected in Paradise Valley.    I initially came into El Chorro for a drink with some friends, and I always like to browse the menu at restaurants whether I am eating or not...then I saw one of their 'classics' and had flashbacks to my mother's amazing homemade beef stroganoff.  Now days in the land of trendy, fusion, hip restaurants such things are not very typical to a menu, so I had to try it and see if it could even compare to my mother's version.  Most stroganoffs at restaurants tend to be on the very creamy side and my mother's is heavier on the au jus from the meat and flavor of the mushrooms, so I asked our amazing bartender if it could be modified (also because I am not a fan of ultra creamy sauces anyway); he obliged and informed me the Chef was in house that evening and he would go consult him.  The bartender came back with outstanding news that the chef would cook it up himself :)    While my meal was in the 'developmental stage' in the back, I finally made it around to deciding on a cocktail.  The bartender was pleasant and asked about my favorite kind of beverage.  I told him I was a big fan of gin, and he said he had the perfect cocktail for me to try: the French 75.  It was a lovely perfumey, bubbly drink that wasn't too sweet or strong (many gin drinks are heavy on the liquor).  For all you people that think gin tastes like pine needles, you need to try some Nolet's Gin; it is more like an English rose garden.  I wouldn't drink that drink regularly, but it was very delicious, flavorful and perfect for good conversation and sipping.  All of my friends tried it and thought it was amazing and couldn't believe there was gin in it haha!   Then my meal arrived and wow!! It looked and smelled amazing and amazingly like my mom's stroganoff.  My friends even said it smelled awesome and I was nice and shared!  It was a HUGE pasta plate full of yummy egg noodles with tender pieces of beef, and a nice thick caramelized brownish mushroom/onion au jus reduction sauce with a bit of cream...perfect for me!  It was garnished with fresh sugarsnap peas, carrots and one of their yummy rolls!  I ate it along with my friends and wiped up every last drop with the roll.  Definitely the best stroganoff I have ever had in a restaurant!    I will definitely be back for a drink here; the mixologists are wonderful (so good, I can't even call them bartenders).  The menu prices are steep, so I would probably only come here on a special occasion for the food.  But, I must say this would be a great date spot or a place for visitors from out of town because the views of Camelback Mountain and the surrounding neighborhood/architecture are beautiful.

ftEqsGSohc99jWb781c6Sg.text: Sticker buns before dinner?  Oh yes please.  Customer service was excellent, very attentive and friendly servers.  Beautiful space, beautiful view of the Camelback mountain available in some areas.  We had the Chateaubriand and for the price, it was well worth it, the meat was cooked perfectly and the veggies were nice and crunchy!  Plus it came with salad or soup and dessert.  Meat was tender and cooked to perfection.  If not for dinner, the brunch here is highly recommened.  El Chorro has been around since 1937 and has lots of history.  This is a must visit...

Qyy3k6AKeK6fSFJM025k9g.text: Had dinner there on Black Friday. Past experience was not good. This time the food for our party of 4 was excellent. Hostess was gracious and polite, our waiter was on the ball asking all the right question . Food was amazing, great presentation, taste and service. El Chorro is back on my radar as a fine Scottsdale and PV favorite.

C83G6qrg5o9sK6pIppjSBg.text: Ambiance was beautiful- we sat outside on the patio. There was a wedding going on so the entertainment was aplenty (ceremony was on an adjacent patio, separated by a low wall). We were disappointed to learn the Poutine was unavailable, but the adjacent table had truffle fries, so we got that instead- and they were amazing! The lobster bisque soup was delicious and abundant with flavor as well. I had the seafood pasta- the dish looked impressive, but the flavor was unexpectedly bland; I put a dash of salt and pepper on it which improved the taste, but I would not order that again. Their famous sticky buns (that come complementary with an entree) were phenomenal. Overall the experience was quite pleasant, and I will be returning to try some more of their menu.

photos.caption: Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States

wQXZR3RLQiR9fgMcGPO1Lg.text: Had a friend in town this past weekend and wanted to find a place with great food and great atmosphere on short notice.  I called around to several places, and on a saturday night, I was looking at 90 minutes or longer.    A different friend suggested El Chorro and I was able make a reservation for 8pm.  The atmosphere is sensational. We sat on the outdoor patio overlooking Camelback Mountain.  Our server Vicky (or Veronica?) was terrific and really made it a fun evening for us.  I highly recommend the Trout Almondine; it's one of their signature dishes and it is to die for!

0fdu35qTHI4kiMfnsbwINg.text: This place is so good. We had the salmon for an appetizer it was good but we filled up on sticky buns soooooo yummmy. I had the eggs Benedict for my BK & enjoyed grapefruit Mamosa. We sat on the patio & enjoyed the sound of the fountain, lushness of the gardens. I felt like I was on vacation even knowing I live in AZ. This is a must do for any special occasion Mother's Day comes to mind.

HDEK9e7AGAgIBJevivyHcA.text: The patio atmosphere and stars are beautiful. The short ribs were fantastic and the wedge salad too. The Prisoner Red wine blend was amazing along with the service from Trent.

2p19uvn6MvsVO_Qek9xrMQ.text: El Chorro was deemed one of the best places to eat in scottsdale. So when I was planning my trip I knew I had to add it to my itinerary, and boy was I not disappointed. We decided to go for happy hour on a tuesday night and they place was not busy at all, which is totally fine by me. The appetizers and happy hour drinks specials were so well priced we decided to try quite a few things on the menu. The fish tacos were quite possibly the best I had ever had, as well as the sliders. The tuna poke was also incredible. We did get the lightly battered and fried shrimp and calamari, the dipping sauce was good which helped the slightly chewy seafood. I'm picky when it comes to margaritas, and they margs here were spectacular! Our server, Christina seemed very experienced and natural. We ended getting the sticky buns to take home, but they were a little too sweet for me . Over all this place had a terrific ambiance. Be prepared that you may not get to enjoy the beautiful sunset view if you go for happy hour because they have specific seating for happy hour dining. Love!

photos.caption: Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. Even with specific happy hour seating our view was quite lovely

KFPRiHf6fo77nGW2hFTwcg.text: Although El Chorro advertises happy hour, I don't think they really want to offer one.  Things have changed.    Happy hour guests are now confined to one community table , which seats about 10, or the bar.  One cannot sit at the numerous tables on the patio, which the whole reason for coming here.  One can sit at the bar at any restaurant, so there is no reason to come here to do that.    We decided to leave El Chorro and go to The Vig, which has an excellent happy hour.  We enjoyed it!

tqTNCSwfHJzCPyphpz5Tyg.text: Easter Buffet, Desert was great , Service was the best we had Jennifer and she was awesome. Food was OK, Turkey was weird and fell apart  Veggie's were great, Breakfast food was good, Beef was fair and cold. Will not be returning for their price there are several others where the food is all great. No Easter egg hunt .

aau2aJalag71E3u7LXUZvg.text: Reserved  an outdoor table for 6 last Friday night, what a terrific place it never fails to produce not only great food but unequaled service all in one of the best outdoor settings in town. We'll be back that's for sure

dCyaTM9Fp0115fXyN5Iu8w.text: Meh...  I saw this place on Best Thing I Ever Ate and was excited to try it out. On cue, the free and delicious sticky buns showed up on the table shortly after we sat down. They did not disappoint!  Additionally, there was a little butter croissant in the basket which was also delicious.   Things went downhill from there. We ordered the banana pancakes and the huevos rancheros. The pancakes were standard issue. Nothing special. The huevos rancheros were trying to be fancy but fell flat. Also they had cilantro in them and I hate cilantro.   Also the table next to us tried to order the Denver omelet without the ham but were told "sorry no modifications". Really???!  Who does that?  That's just bad policy and customer service.   Won't be going back.

tsluQT8hvXlA3jf8F9TaVw.text: To start off I must say that our waitress was amazing. She was very knowledgeable, sweet and the best thing about El Chorro. That being said  EVERYTHING else was a major disappointment. This was our second time visiting El Chorro and this special event was for my sisters 40th birthday. The first time we ate here wasn't great, the food tasted a bit old and my husband was ill afterwards. But since it's such a pretty spot we thought we'd try again. BIG MISTAKE. The food arrived minutes after ordering and tasted like it had been sitting around and warmed up when we ordered it. Our reservation was for 8pm and by 10pm we could see the place was pretty empty. If it wasn't clear to us already we knew it was time to go when one of the staff "accidentally" propped the back door open right by our table. It was a very cold night and we all stood up immediately to put our coats on.  This was completely inappropriate and passive aggressive. To be rushed out of a restaurant after two and a half hours is despicable especially when El Chorro is supposed to be "fine dining". We will never support this restaurant again! Save your money and buy sticky buns from Trader Joe's instead!

vkn8Y22EOCFpAT6Bipc4JA.text: Wow, I always take a few moments to read other reviews before posting mine.  All I can say is, been twice in less than a week, and enjoyed the views, food and drinks both times. Service was very good as well.  No complaints here.   Daughter's wedding venue has been found!  Love El Chorro!

-0sSjIk59Gs5NJzn7Z90tA.text: Amazingly beautiful 11 acre grounds for special events.  Chateaubriand melts in your mouth. House made sticky buns very sweet, but yummy. Unique. Make a reservation... next I'll try their happy hour, it's poppin'...upscale

uhWX4U34DtRuHsrcVj-gog.text: My friend was having a Meetup here for over 20 people. It seems they cant accommodate that many people and become hostile towards large groups.  last night at the El Chorro was such a mess. I just cannot believe that they treated our group so bad.  Thanks to our friend Ana for getting us over to Hearth61 it was such better place and roomy as well. Hearth61 also didn't ask our group for one bill either, wont be coming back to El Crapo ever again.

z_UbiZA6-s4By5bP4kGgeA.text: We're going to meet a bunch of friends there for a meet up group ....apparently you guys didn't want us. I guess that's what "upscale" means.   The  front desk gal even told me it was being moved to Camelback which was not True   we went over to hearth 61  Kind of a shame it was my first time there and I really like the landscape and ambience ...drink prices were good would have liked to have stayed and enjoyed myself there

cPvUto13VbVmVfEegz3fPA.text: Love love love this restaurant. The food is delish and the ambiance is soooooooc Charming. The iconic mountain is the backdrop for a very inviting and meandering patio filled with pretty plants and assorted interesting decor. Service is well honed, food presented beautifully. The sticky buns are fresh and gooey, their specialty, as old as the mountain. If you've never been, the time is now before the Winter crowd blurs all the things that I find magical in this place.

ruUf-o_gSg6Qy0ZCkq6ZLw.text: Made reservations way in advance for Mother's Day for indoor seating.  When I made the reservation the representative told me where we would be seated and instructed me to park in the back near there. When we arrived on time for our reservation it took them over 25 minuets to sit us at an OUTSIDE table even after verifying it twice while waiting. To add to it they sat a group ahead of us who showed up 2 hours early for their reservation because it was all they could book online. Go figure. They got sat ahead of us. Plus we had only 4 people in our party and the gratuity was already added to our bill. Great food and it ends there unfortunately.  Update: I emailed the email address given below almost immediately. It has been almost 3 full days and I haven't received a reply...

VjWXCOHcQ1r90F5QkWtz1A.text: Tucked away in the beautiful Camelback Mountains, El Chorro has become somewhat of an institution and favorite of Paradise Valley residents. Operating as a restaurant since 1937, it's garnered a long-standing reputation for a spectacular atmosphere, high-end dining, and even a popular wedding ceremony location. And after reading many of their Yelp reviews, I expected nothing but great things.    My girlfriend and I were able to be squeezed in for a Saturday night reservation on three hours notice and were absolutely starving by the time we were promptly seated at 8:30pm. The patio itself is gorgeous. On this particularly chilly evening, we were seated directly next to a small gas-fire pit.  Honestly, I'm not entirely sure what went wrong. Maybe it was an off-night with the servers and kitchen staff. Perhaps we were just extending our current run of bad luck with new places. Or, dare I say, maybe this acclaimed little establishment isn't quite what it's all cracked up to be.  Our original (male) server asked us if this was our first time visiting, which we stated that it was. Not that it mattered. He rattled off the daily special and gave us time to decide. After having some time to decipher the menu, a new (female) server came to us and we placed our order.    We decided to start with their Tuscan kale and arugula salad, which was pretty decent. Containing dried cranberries, almonds, red onion, feta, and a lemon honey thyme vinaigrette, the combination worked quite well together. Unfortunately, it was the only thing brought to our table that was worth a damn.  I ordered a medium-cooked filet with bearnaise sauce, while my girlfriend opted for the fire roasted jumbo tequila shrimp. This is, more or less, when things quickly went downhill.    As soon as I bit into my steak, I was taken back by the fact that it was barely even warm. My scalloped potatoes and vegetables suffered the same fate, tasting as if they had been sitting on the counter for far too long. The bearnaise sauce, which was cold, did nothing to help my quest for hot food. I insisted my girlfriend taste my steak, in order to see if maybe I'm just nit-picking for the sake of nit-picking. Sadly, she wholeheartedly agreed with my impressions. As another reviewer points out, I've had better (and cheaper) steak at chain restaurants, which is quite embarrassing to actually admit to considering my intense hatred for chains.  My girlfriend's shrimp, which I also tried, was really no different. Barely passing as lukewarm, it was very hard to make a judgment about its flavor due to the fact that it was cold. I'm guessing the server, who rarely came by to check on us, was distracted and let our food sit out for far too long. What's funny is that in all of our restaurant adventures over the years, there are very few instances where cold food is an issue.  The question is: Do we say something? By this point, it was 9pm and we were both hungry and agitated. Do we really want to wait another 30 minutes for them to remake the food or take it back into the kitchen and nuke it? We decided to just keep quiet.  Looking over at tables next to me, I was a bit confused to see people receiving baskets of their famed sticky buns before being served their actual entrees. I assumed the sticky buns were something they'd bring us for dessert. Another table had a giant basket of bread to boot, so I'm not entirely sure how they pulled that one off.      My Diet Coke was never refilled, despite letting it sit at the edge of the table for a good thirty minutes. I'm guessing they're accustomed to people blowing money on self-serving bottles of wine and champagne. Not everyone drinks, you know?   When our server finally came back and inquired our interest about their two dessert options, I just said we'll just have the sticky buns. Seriously, people, I don't get it. They're basically just cinnamon rolls - no different than the rolls that you can acquire at any supermarket or bakery. It was only later, after reading reviews, that I discovered that sticky buns are supposed to be brought out BEFORE your meal - not at the end! It's kind of their trademark, as many reviewers mention that it's the very first thing they (unexpectedly) receive. What's sad is that, if I didn't say something, we would've gotten the snub. You'd think if they've had one procedure properly in place, it would be knowing when to serve the item that they're most acclaimed for.  I've said time and time again, if your food sucks and your service is lackluster, then your ambiance, no matter how much people may brag about it, suddenly becomes irrelevant.  Sorry, El Chorro. We know what it takes to operate a four/five star restaurant, and it takes a bit more than a pretty patio with mountain views to achieve that rating.  I see this place as nothing more than a waste of money and a waste of time. Not recommended.
