Kfa5X_7zRUtMC9qon16Dqg.text: Great night with great friends - menu was outstanding as usual - wine list was good, sommelier could have been a bit more helpful but very nice man - Ron, our server, was amazing - glad to have come back, and will be back again!

WhBTBFIKEuFDYk3Hf4xxFA.text: Unfortunately not overly impressed.  My friend and I went to El Chorro for a drink following a local concert in PV just down the road.  Arrived at the bar around 9:40 and it appeared that the bartenders were pretty much focused on closing out.  Drinks and appetizers were nice but the level of engagement from the staff was minimal at best.  Second visit for me with a first time experience that was somewhat disappointing as well for Mother's Day brunch.  The food was luke warm to cold for the special buffet set up for the holiday.

cmnieFlzNs_kNSp5ph9B-A.text: We went for Father's Date as this was my husband's favorite place to brunch.  He loves the atmosphere, the view, the sticky buns, and the Bloody Marys.  We went with our daughter, son in law, and grandson.  Unfortunately, we were not totally happy with the service and the waiter, or the food.  The waiter seemed to be "hung over" as he didn't have much of a personality and didn't seem to really want to be there.      My husband ordered the special $6 Bloody Mary but didn't really like it.  He loves the one with the giant prawn in it and if he was offered that option, he would have certainly had that.  There was no mention that the bloody mary would not have the prawn from the waiter, but we should have expected no prawn since the price was cheaper than normal.   I had a glass of Veuve Clicquot after asking for the champagne/wine menu.  The waiter brought it over but there were very few bubbles and seemed flat.  At $15 a glass, one would expect lots of bubbles.  It seemed the bottle was left over from the night below.  We sent that back and another glass of champagne was brought out which was more fitting.    My smoked salmon was tasty and wonderful, as usual.  Hubby and son in law got the special benedict with crab and filet tenderloin.  I didn't ask my son in law if he enjoyed his meal, but my husband said he should have order the regular eggs benefit as the beef was dry and tasteless.  Our daughter had a bagel with cream cheese and avocado which she was very happy with.  Maybe because it was Father's Day, the food, drinks, and waiter were "off".  Because we enjoy the El Chorro Lodge, we will be back, but probably not for any special occasion.  One positive was the woman who was refilling the water glasses (blonde, glasses).  She was very nice and personable and engaged our grandson in conversation.  We all agreed that we would have loved to have her as our wait person instead of the one we had.

NkkcubQ8IDwFG6e3wg2WqQ.text: We had a great dinner - we were in the main room with the amazing view of the mountains. It is one of our favorite places. Service and all the wait staff were very attentive and of course the sticky buns are to die for.

photos.caption: Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States

pzYOgvLDLKyfvSmoVAdghA.text: El Chorro is definitely a Paradise Valley staple. It's a great destination restaurant with great desert views.  I'm more impressed with the venue than with the food. Everything is cooked well and seasoned appropriately, but you should expect "old school" food. The menu is fairly dated, featuring things like beef stroganoff and pork tenderloin.  Watch out for the sticky buns. They are seriously delicious. I ate about 100 of them!!!

C1CzXJQCScopsepnFt2D-A.text: Attended an event here and everything was top notch. They have a beautiful venue at the back of the restaurant. Katerina and Amir took good care of us outside, prior to sitting down for diner. Susan was our server during dinner and she was great as well.

G20f0AD5NuakoWt_tu0dxQ.text: Excellent service! I'm vegetarian and dairy-free, which can trip up a place known for their scones and sticky buns. Nevertheless, I got many recommendations from my server on what I could do to customize certain dishes to my diet, and I ended up with a delicious meal of two eggs, potatoes, toast and some greens. Absolutely delicious! Also the view of the mountains is beautiful. Would definitely come here again, although I'm not sure if I would have lunch or dinner options.

photos.caption: Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States

kaWSiahl_D7nWN5Ir9AnIg.text: The best waiter, so personable and quick to do anything we asked. The ambience is perfection; beautiful outdoor seating area. I asked that the chef prepare a vegetarian pasta dish and he did not disappoint. The shrimp and grits were fantastic. The legendary stick buns were so yummy!

-5yRW75PYKBV4mvrwtdsMg.text: Some of the best food in the valley, I've eaten here many times. Recently I have noticed extremely poor service and it has continued after several other visits their. The quality of service is one aspect of running a restaurant and reflects upon the business. There are many restaurants in the valley that will treat you well. I have hopes that a realistic review will return the restaurant to a wonderful place to dine. Rather than a negative review.

W_DJmrkrnSJyWa-Izdh7DA.text: Dined at El Chorro for the first time on 3/9 and had a wonderful meal in an exquisite atmosphere. The only thing better than the sticky buns was the fantastic view of Camelback Mountain. Nate, our server, took excellent care of us and his advice on appetizers (Shrimp pot!) and cocktails was spot on. The Moscow Mule they served is also delicious! I'd absolutely recommend El Chorro for any group looking for a picturesque setting to accompany a quality dining experience.

wkCeepO7GfKKhEsLWX30CA.text: The place is lovely and the happy hour food is good BUT I have been here 3 times and I will  NOT come again! I am sick and tired of all their rules. We are only allowed to sit in certain places,  not allowed to push tables together, not allowed to move chairs to a table to accommodate more people at our table. The staff are rude and unhelpful. I was  not allowed to have salt on my skinny margherita. The mountain of rules leaves me cold and feeling as though I am a naughty child in school. Sad that they ruin a pretty place with lousy staff and ALL the rules!

E8GwGKxzKfCs1UmOGPZEwA.text: excellent food and great atmosphere.  We sat outside and the view was spectacular.  will go again when I'm in Phoenix again.

i7UM3sfTE8F9JjzAYiQC5g.text: Review is for brunch only.  The location of atmosphere at El Chorro is awesome, especially on a wonderful Sunday afternoon in the spring.  Decided to try out El Chorro for brunch and was pleasantly surprised by the awesome patio we were able to experience.  The weather was awesome, so it really added to the experience.  Thanks to a reservation, we were sat immediately.  Service was great, our waiter was friendly and helpful... so nothing to complain about there.  I had the tenderloin eggs benedict and the Hubs for the chicken enchilada with egg on top (basically huevos rancheros).  We both also partook in the mimosa.  I really enjoyed my eggs benedict and opted for the half portion.  This was just enough food for me, but I could see it being not enough for most people.  At $18 I really felt gipped.  The Hubs liked his meal, but decided at the end he really wasn't in the mood for what he ordered... would have preferred the enormous breakfast burrito we saw walk by.  At $60 bucks for our breakfast we both walked away feeling a bit disappointed.  The sticky bun is just as fabulous and people say it is, but that and the scenery don't make up for the expensive price tag in my book.  I'm really glad we experienced this gem of a location and of course the sticky bun, I only wish it wasn't so darn expensive...

V1lGot53UXqG0G-jcOM5qg.text: Two years later and the food experience is not improved.  Three of us, $250 And no one had even a decent meal.  My wife's trout was inedible with greasy potatoes,  my stroganoff had tons of noodles, almost no beef and was cold.  My draft beer was luke warm.  The space is a five,  the food is a minus five, so I guess a one is the only choice. Why would anyone waste this great place to serve such below average food? Get a chef who is not lazy and serve a better than average menu and fare. Also, at your prices, bring back the relish dish. By the way, we had an 8:00 reservation and were not seated til almost 8:30, Cooling our heels in the lobby.

MdEu-t6MtewlmdfuKlI6CQ.text: If you live in Phoenix or anywhere in central Arizona , I can't really see how you would end up at the place unless you were staying at the resort up here in lil ole paradise valley. This place is kind of on a island not much going around here but I will say the view. Building and location are beautiful. Of course if you come here everything on the menu is 30 to 40 dollars per item expected . They do ask you soup or salad so remember that extra add cost. But they do offer free sticky buns with every meal and they are very good. Now the salad of the day was , "fresh and wonderful" occurring to the table . I got the clam chowder but I'm to happy with the asking if there was no bacon and bingo there  is bacon. The staff did seem a little busy serving so maybe he was in a rush but I feel minus the bacon the soup was okay. Now on to the main course.  Seafood Pasta was okay just okay. I expected a little bit more but it came out pretty and sauce was good but the lobster was tough man. The chicken plate was just not my cup of tea but rib stack with cheese potato was amazing . Best thing on the table. I have to admit I was excited for the meal but if you have the ability to drive there are better pasta opinions but the ribs were worth the tasting . I would recommend the beef stack ribs , if I had that for my meal, I would be very pleased. If you are able to drive I wouldn't make the trip. But if you want a nice date or group area to relax and drink, this could be nice. It's quite the set up. O i forgot they gave my grandma a happy birthday desert which was a sweet for her but the rest of group that eats chocolate seem to of liked it.

photos.caption: Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. Look from the table

zzoLFpcO9IvQV_zIt7A1rA.text: came here for our department holiday party and this restaurant was amazing! the staff was great, the view of the surrounding mountains and citrus trees were amazing, their food was amazing. their Bloody Mary was pretty delicious, nice and spicy and comes with a jumbo shrimp! the sticky bun that comes out when you first arrive is to die for! super warm and gooey goodness!

yvf6yllsDQzrzKsBYCLL7w.text: Had really excellent food and service here. We were a big party of people but our server, Ron, was kicking butt and taking names all night. The bus boys and girls did a great job of keeping the waters and other beverages filled. Speaking of other beverages, the margaritas here are really delicious. Definitely recommended. There was a prix fixe menu for restaurant week which some partook of... the food sounded amazing but I wanted to eat light, so I got a salad instead, which was very tasty. The desserts looked awesome too, but again, didn't want an upset stomach on business travel, hah. I would probably come back here if I lived in the area, but I think if I am visiting again I'd want to try other places just to try them all out. Sitting outdoors was nice, btw, but I got chewed up by mosquitoes. D: (they have mosquitoes in Arizona?!) didn't help hearing about scorpions, snakes, and javelinas...I was turning around to look in the brush behind me the entire time to see if anything was going to jump out at me, Lmao!! Fun place to visit, though... and have not had as good a margarita back home!! But yeah desert wildlife, LOL.... not sure I'd be cut out for living the AZ life so to speak. But I digress!! Great meal, great place!!

tX81BAZtYZ9HbfKZgbJgzQ.text: I took my husband to El Chorro this past weekend for date night. This was our first time eating here. A co-worker of mine recommended it and I'm so thankful we tried it. The sticky buns were to die for. Thankfully we got an appetizer (sausage and pretzels) because the main course (pork tenderloin) was pretty small. I'll definitely be back though. We got some sticky buns to go too :)

Q3bNHxcDZIwSVZK1_e5haQ.text: El Chorro revels in location, location plus amazing views. However, flimsy plastic menus and glassware are easily outshined by crystal and service at the Stockyards. Hmm, sticky buns might be a tradition but the historic Wigwam had a basket of diverse muffins, with blue corn and jalepenos. Pardon the comparisons but the historic lodge only has a few peers in the valley. Kudos to the landscaping designers for the desert compacted soils for overflow parking; their commitment to a natural setting is also evident with the electric recharging stations!  More about the food: the vegetarian meal has great flavors and the salads are huge standouts: the heirloom tomatoes and hand pulled burrata salad are perfect.  Overall, the menu comes with large doses of carbs (scalloped potatoes, risotto.) Beau enjoyed the pork tenderloin.  Enjoy your drink at the bar with a nice oversized wine glass in lieu of a modest glass stem on the table. Dining room tables are a bit too tight to enjoy the desert view and ambience.   Recommendation: Check out bar & happy hour eats before committing to dinner.

7ecUAXp28CaYZeuyrUEjSw.text: El Chorro is a family favorite. The first time I went for my 19th birthday they had their band sing me happy birthday along with the rest of the restaurant. It was a memorable experience and since then I frequent at least once every few months! Service is great, food is great and they have an excellent happy hour!

photos.caption: Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. Bar dinning section
Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. Great bar

mHDkcIEoa4z-A8y_gGxDRQ.text: We had friends in from out of town on Fri 12/8 and one of our guests was celebrating his birthday. They had never been to AZ so we naturally thought of El Chorro. I had not been in several years so wanted to check out the renovations, menu, etc. We arrived at 4:30 and sat at a table on the patio. We didn't see a server so, after several minutes, I went to the bar and asked for one. When our server finally arrived, she didn't smile and welcome us, was very short when we asked questions, and just frankly had a very snooty attitude. When our drinks didn't arrive in a reasonable amount of time, I went back to the bar to cancel our order, but she was just getting ready to deliver them so we stayed. Again, no warmth or friendliness or apology for the wait. So we asked for the check and went to Sanctuary on Camelback Mountain. Had a wonderful night with outstanding service. Unfortunately, we won't be returning to El Chorro...too many other great options that will provide good service without an attitude.

SYgFrux2cME0fX7zkSlPIg.text: This place is amazing. It has gorgeous scenery, friendly and efficient service, good food, and a great happy hour. They must do a lot of weddings here because it's provides the beauty of the desert landscape and great space for a ceremony, cocktail, hour and reception, all with the privacy that you would not have getting married at one of the nearby resorts.   Their happy hour is awesome. $2.00 beers, killer tacos, a great burger. I think we spent $25 for the both of us to eat dinner and have a few drinks. It's a great place to take a date or have a romantic night. We are definitely going back.

W9SJ5JIWL4D1iV3_zuwwsA.text: I still love El Chorro but can't say it's quite what it used to be. Kind of pricey, which you would expect given the neighborhood, but not a lot of value even so. Very average service. I've been coming here for years and will probably keep doing so, I just hope they get some of their old charm back.

f3_piz4Tfr9Mecn8zKoVFw.text: Unfortunate, because we always liked this place.  It was bad from the start!  I tried to reserve the fireplace area below the TV on the back, inside patio for 15 people for happy hour, where we have sat before many times.  They said that was for dinner only.  How can you eat dinner without a table?  They said they don't take reservations for happy hour, and that is fine but they wouldn't even let us sit out there?  It was completely empty when looking at it when leaving.    We were lucky enough to get one table large enough for us all to sit at inside near the bar area.  The manager and waitress were very rude to our party and told us we cannot save the seats at our table for our group that was coming.  They sent others there to sit with us but when the others realized that we were all one group and had more people come in without a seat, they left and expressed their opinion on how management handled that, which wasn't good.  The manager told my friend that he didn't care if we all came back or not and the waitress told me, after we received one check for 16 people, including a 20% gratuity which wasn't deserved, that she didn't care how many other places accommodated us for separate checks, they don't!  Since when?  They always did.  It is unfortunate as I said because we all loved going here regularly, including Thanksgiving eve, and were always able to sit outside around the fireplace, and always received our own checks for what we separately ordered.  What happened to this place?  Is there a new owner, or new management?  Very unprofessional staff and not accommodating at all!

TBGolSxTHdxKt8Yp6kTuvQ.text: The setting, decor, and ambience of this restaurant is southwest picture perfect, but that's only a small part of what makes El Chorro rate 5 stars. Our reservation for 4 was honored promptly and we were seated in a lovely corner table near a glowing fireplace. Once we settled in, our waiter Phil let us know specials of the day and took drink orders. He then brought us fresh cinnamon rolls hot from the oven -which were so good they easily could have been dessert.   Upon looking at the menu we admit to thinking it was pretty boring. Wrong. The choices may have been somewhat traditional, but the presentation and taste were extraordinary.   Shared salads - wedge and Caesar - were ample and had their own twists to preparation. Each couple coincidentally ordered the same entrees, trout and salmon. It was so beautiful that I wish I had taken a photo of my salmon dish. The fish was perfectly cooked and served with a ginger soy sauce on a bed of black quinoa and braised baby bok choy. The trout was served with green beans almandine and roasted potatoes. We also ordered a side of lobster mac and cheese for the table. All dishes were phenomenal.   Then came dessert. We shared freshly baked apple pie a la mode and key lime pie, both fabulous.  However, as good as the meal was it was our waiter Phil who helped to take it over the top. Beyond his excellent and attentive service, he had the ability to let us leisurely enjoy our conversations, and know when to step in if we needed anything - and even absconding with the very last piece of key lime pie for us after being told it was sold out!   It's no wonder this place has a deserved stellar reputation.

g7WmYMNALMoj074lgoBW9g.text: This restaurant is beautiful. We live in PV and go all the time and will continue to do so.  The servers are amazing/very professional and I love the food. I'm only giving this star rating so that some consistent problem areas might get fixed:  The food runners at the bar just abruptly "drop" your food (sometimes you appetizer and dinner within within minutes) and, if you ask for something like a condiment, it's unlikely you'll get it from the food runner. It's also difficult to make eye contact with people behind the bar to ask for what you need, so we usually just figure "do we eat the food hot, or do we wait to get what we need and eat it cold."  Also, I don't know whey this happens, but the bar runners put trays of dirty dishes on the counters or just below the counters where you can see them while you are eating, and by  mid-evening, they are much more interested in inventory and closing up than seeing if you need anything. The bar has gotten much better than it was a few years ago, but still needs help, and it would be terrific if these issues were fixed.

3QjYD_WTg_IErCAWbLyNtw.text: Where do you start ? Great setting.Beautiful view.Wood fires,heaters for cool nights.Great bar and outdoor seating.Crowd is a great mix of older and younger. Awesome place to watch a game,but sound is off.Mix of snow birds,locals,and hotel/convention guests from the local Mega / Resorts all around this area.Wonderful service.

zEbjjbqt_i_UCqadOVNAHg.text: The place is beautiful even though we went in the evening would like to go in the daytime as well the lighting is nice the fireplace is a nice touch very clean classy place service was attentive which I'm keen on our food melted in our mouth sticky buns to take home yum!!!! A must for a romantic classy dinner my boyfriend and I were pleased

PmXykmfmrIBB37dvaRuckw.text: Last week our daughter had her wedding at El Chorro Lodge and the team at El Chorro, led by Lindsey Rendon, did a fantastic job.  The meal began with a crunchy salad and the famous sticky buns.  Guests had a choice of Center Cut Filet, Herb Roasted Chicken or a Polenta and Vegetable Napoleon - all were delicious.  The service was smooth and unobtrusive which was appreciated as there were speeches, songs and toasts.    One of the nicest touches was the care they gave to the bride and groom by assigning a staff member to take care of them from the time the service ended then throughout the evening.  This special person brought them drinks and appetizers while they took photos with friends and family and continued the great service through dinner and dancing.    The venue itself was beautiful.  The ceremony took place outside on the lawn overlooking Camelback Mountain, followed by a cocktail hour on the patio, then on to the reception room.    A very warm and sincere thank you to Linsey and the El Chorro team.  Signed a very happy MOB.

W5wj425Lv-PchZWvKj57JA.text: El Chorro is my favorite place in The Phoenix area. I have NEVER had a bad meal here and nothing but exceptional service. I love sitting out on the patio; gorgeous views! Anytime we have friends or family in town this is where we take them and the meal and experience always get praises. My favorite items here are the braised short ribs and also the beet salad. I highly recommend and definitely suggest you ask to sit on the patio!

photos.caption: Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States

e_TrqufmuUhQlalin13y5Q.text: I was at El Chorro for a wedding rehearsal dinner so my review is based on their private dining services and not the normal dining experience.  Upon driving up to the restaurant there is a professional valet that quickly and efficiently gets you out of your car and on your way to a culinary adventure.    Our wedding party had a large private room off to the left of the main restaurant.  While walking over (on a hot and humid day) I noticed several huge mobile air conditioning units to cool the customers on the patio.  I was impressed by them because it's a thoughtful gesture that I haven't seen in many places.  These weren't the cheap (worthless) models.  They were some serious industrial A.C. units and they felt great.  The area we had was pretty secluded and private (away from the regular restaurant).  It had a great patio for cocktail hour.  The service was friendly and professional.  They were quick with drinks and quick to clean up empty glasses.  The dinner itself was magnificent.  We had a party of ~ 40 people but the service and the food was that of a quaint 5 star dining experience.  The deserts were so good I feared a massive sugar buzz so I had to contain myself (see my uploaded photos).  Overall, it was a 5 star experience.  If anyone is considering having a private dinner here (wedding or otherwise) I'd highly recommend it.  Fantastic!

photos.caption: Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States
Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States
Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. Strawberry shortcake and chocolate torte

CA--6hPN_5r1YQfsB1zV6A.text: My husbandand I had a great experience last Tuesday night at El Chorro. A bit out of our usual stomping grounds but we had to be in the area for work so we decided to stop in. Our server Stephen was great... he helped point us in the right direction from start to finish. Our favorite's were the Shrimp Pepper Pot and the Trout Almandine. Also, the glass of Rombauer Chardonnay Stephen recommended paired perfectly. Great experience overall.

Ba4pNxWTUdUSPrjRTVbukw.text: I honestly have to say we were so looking forward to our dining experience at El Chorro. We had a special family/friends dinner planned for a few weeks now and couldn't think of a prettier locale this time of year than El Chorro  We started by ordering 2 glasses of wine a Cab and a Zin. The Zin tasted a little off and we asked to switch it to another glass of Cab.  For appetizers we ordered 1 Caesar salad to split, a Burrata Salad, 2 cups of lobster corn bisque and 1 bowl of lobster corn bisque.  The soups arrived lukewarm, the burrata salad advertised w/ crostini, it came with none  We asked for the waiter....no one came. I got up to find the manager who said she would send someone right over. She also offered us a free drink or dessert  We just wanted service. Not looking for a freebie.  The soups were taken away and brought back not much warmer than the start minus the soup spoons.  The side of crostini for the salad never came The entrees were now being served.... still no crostini after asking numerous times.  We ordered 1 more glass of Cab to share.... the new waiter didn't know which one we were drinking and took it upon himself to bring us a more expensive glass.  When the bill came we were charged for 4 glasses of Cab not 3 and for 2 Caesar Salads (not split) Brought this to the waiters attention.  He said he would correct the bill and split in 2  When he came back he brought us another parties bill... which was significantly less.  We pointed this out... and he brought us our bill. We gave him our  2 cc's   He brought the bills back charged to the wrong cc's  We finally had to get the manager involved again She offered us a discount and said she would have to adjust each bill. She was now at a point of frustration and taking it out on our party. One member of our party said we should have paid the 'cheaper' bill and left.  This mess is not our fault. The manager said to our guest 'I'm proud of you' That was incredibly rude. She became extremely unpleasant and accusatory   We weren't looking for a comp, a discount or a free dessert. We wanted a nice evening out. We wanted impeccable service   El Chorro was such a disappointment  We have been coming here since the 50's.  We understand progress, price increases. Etc  We don't understand rude, accusatory, nasty, and condescending.  It made for a very unpleasant evening.

B7wFDd5sfHOgD_wF1mxW1A.text: Ole!  Fun spot!  Remodel did not ruin the original feel for the place.  Go if you haven't been - and has a excellent happy hour.

photos.caption: Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States

lFB7h4Cj43tSA6EmuNBSqg.text: Great vibe and the place to be for a nice dinner out. The patio seating is beautiful on a nice evening. The food is ok but the price is a bit high for the quality. My shrimp were over cooked and the crab cakes were thin. Presentation was nice. Service was friendly and prompt, but I'm not sure if they knew their menu and wines well enough to make good recommendations. Big selection of California wines on the menu. I hear the bar seating and happy menu are great. That's probably where you'll get more bang for your buck.

ssWnWDATnzEPjO0bmN_pqw.text: Wow! Great meal on Saturday night. It is definately pricier than it used to be under old ownership - pre-remodel, but it is absolutely lovely, the food is above average (not the best for the prices imo) the view is stunning. The service is on point - just enough not too much. We were celebrating our anniversary and they brought us a lovely dessert. Also, hostess called us the day after to thank us for our visit and inquire about our experience. Really nice touch - so easy for a restaurant to do this and go the extra mile, but really no one does anymore. Kudos to the service team.

6QaVhiclmNUbVPo10lhBHw.text: Incredible ambiance and service. We sat inside this time but will definitely plan to relax on patio in the beautiful southwestern setting! We just moved nearby and will make this a special occasion destination for our family.

RV3efm-SiBd69ki0QTtKgw.text: Amazing patios and service... Meh food  Visited for the holiday and was stoked about eating at El Chorro. After hearing of its long history, quality food, and sticky buns, my expectations were very high.   First, the restaurant has an amazing design-- tons of patio spaces with fireplaces, a semi-private grass yard, old-style rooms with all modern amenities, and all while preserving the historic nature and charm. The western theme prevails through the renovated touches.   Second, the service was top-notch at every turn. We arrived early and they were able to seat us nonetheless. Vicki quickly visited us, took orders, and started to check on us frequently and with an earnest joy. Supporting cast and the waiter from the next table were just as gracious.  Ah, but the food... Our party covered the menu: Lobster Bisque, Arugula Salad, Shrimp Cocktail, Scottish Salmon, Beef Tenderloin, Organic Turkey, Peach Cobbler, and Cheesecake. To the person, all said things were flat on taste. Aside from the sticky buns, nothing stood out. The Bisque was bitter from the sherry used. Salad was par. Shrimp cocktail were well-sized, but standard fare and sauce. The salmon had quality and a great cook's touch on its side, yet left two in our party perplexed by the off pairing with a corn succotash. Two others thought the tenderloin was a great cut undermined by being too raw and being paired with a forgettable gratin potato and completely bland creamed spinach that tasted little like their ingredients. Last, the cheesecake and cobbler were so dull that not a single person of six finished their dessert. And our family craves desserts like Frosty the Snowman likes magic hats!  I'd love to score El Chorro higher. All the pieces are there, except the food. And since it's a restaurant, that's too important to disregard.

photos.caption: Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States

PIIpycCWON5WtoMq-nbilw.text: We have been talking about coming here since I moved to Scottsdale - funny, when I heard the name I thought "Mexican food"! We had a fabulous dinner - food is 5 Stars, venue is great, service good - our particular waitress was "over the top" and a bit too friendly but we'll be back. It was 3 of us so we sat at a table but usually it's 2 of us so we'll sit at the bar.

Jslol8kJVk06jrP4tzR5VQ.text: Stopped in Christmas eve for a drink at the bar. I had a glass of wine and my husband had a beer. It wasn't crazy busy so don't know why it took 15 minutes for the bartender to serve us.  I was then watching the bartender pouring drinks. At one point, he poured maybe a half shot of vodka into a glass and the bottle was empty. Instead of opening another bottle, he shorted whoever ordered that drink.  The final thing that made me realize this place was a rip off was when I was handed the bill for two drinks at the bar is that they unilaterally charged gratuity. I would NOT have given him that amount because I was not happy with the service. Will never go back.

pNXtNI8kiJlulNtZR2NmPA.text: Pretty amazing location and fantastic service. If you want to impress people from out of town, let them stroll around the grounds, take a seat in front of camelback mountain, and eat a sticky bun. In fact, just eat four thousand sticky buns. They're the best. For me, it's like a basket of sticky buns and eggs and the view. You don't need more than that.   In fact probably don't order more than that.   They used to be known for their eggs Benedict. I'm not so sure that's True anymore. My mother's dish came out cold, as did mine. I know this was not the server's fault. Joseph was lovely. He's like an uncle now. I will call him every Christmas.   But again. We really weren't there for the eggs. We were there because the weather was amazing and anytime is a good time for a sticky bun. And the restaurant itself is a beautiful place. Great for people watching. And I'll mention the sticky buns one more time for good measure. Be sure to eat sixteen of them. You may feel dead ill but it will have been so worth it.

21d49dQQirY_TH5WGH6L3w.text: I've been here before but never got around to posting a review. Figured I'd post something right now since I'm laying in bed like a slob. Really had the intentions to go to the gym this morning but decided to eat leftover sticky buns in bed instead.   My boyfriend and I went for AZ restaurant week and both ordered from the ARW menu. For the first course, we split the Caesar salad and the cheese course. We both wished the lettuce was chopped up but I understand it's for appearance. Instead of normal croutons, they used polenta croutons which I enjoyed but my boyfriend didn't.   For our main entrees, I went with the halibut dish that came with jasmine rice and bok choy. It was a very simple dish. I liked it but nothing about it stood out. My boyfriend ordered the center cut filet. He really liked the peppercorn sauce and it was nicely put together. I remember him saying it was a great cut of steak.   For our final courses, we decided to take them to go because we were so stuffed. We took home the strawberry shortcake and the Chocolate cake. I wish we actually looked at the description or had our server tell us about the desserts. He listed our options but never mentioned anything about them. I was expecting a fluffy light strawberry shortcake with Angel food cake. Or maybe cake-like with pound cake, but when we got home, we found out it was just a biscuit cut in half horizontally with whipped cream and strawberry puree. Not really all that great to he honest. The chocolate cake is still in our fridge but I'll dig into it later tonight. No way anyone can screw it up right? It's chocolate cake!  Service was just average, nothing really to complain about. The drinks did take quite awhile but the server apologized each time. I enjoyed it the first few times we came so it will still be on our list of places to grab dinner or brunch.

1jGN9Z9DNbqc-8dbv4Sf9g.text: The goal is to open doors, not close them. To gain engagement and productive interaction, not to have the customer become enraged and walk away.

uevgYAx7iQZuKSj9rKJ7Dw.text: For our last night in Arizona and family obligations over I figured it would be a good opportunity to take my wife to an outstanding restaurant. I made reservations three days in advance on OpenTable.com and they actually called me the day before to confirm and check whether we wanted indoor or outdoor seating. Since it had been so cold the last few days we were there we opted for indoor dining. A little history about El Chorro. The main building was an old grammar school. They added on the courtyard, dining area and gardens when it became a restaurant. It includes their own garden for herbs, produce for the chef. It also includes several outdoor fireplaces and a bocce court. For an appetizer, we started out with a small cheese plate which consisted of parmesan, provolone, bleu cheese & brie with cranberries, dried apricots and candied walnuts. While we were working on our appetizer out came the famous sticky buns. They are delicious, not too sweet and definitely worth trying. For entrees, we ordered the Niman Ranch Pork Tenderloin and the Pan Roasted Duck Breast. The pork tenderloin came with green chili risotto and butternut squash. The Duck came with celery root mashed potatoes, pearl onions, brussel sprouts with a pomegranate reduction. Both were tender and delicious. Even though having tried Duck previously and not really being a big fan I have to say the duck here was done perfectly and not as fatty as my previous tries. For dessert, we split a piece of their vanilla cake with carmel sauce garnished with a blackberry and cappuccinos (they were very strong but not bitter as some can be). This was a perfect way to end our stay in Arizona. You cannot beat the views. Next time maybe we will be able to do a weekend brunch and sit outside to enjoy the fabulous views. On a side note, they even called me the next day to thank me for patronizing their restaurant. I was very impressed.

photos.caption: Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. Entrance at night.
Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. Vanilla cake with Caramel sauce.
Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. Niman Ranch Pork Tenderloin.

LoqmwrhSt0IepgyPZPiMoA.text: This place really offers it all when it comes to fun, creative dishes with an upbeat outdoor ambiance.  For starters, you can't go wrong with the El Chorro Margarita or Bloody Mary, then throw in an order of SW Poutine Fries and you'll coast right into a plethora of tasty entree dishes.

SCWj4t400oPipmVK9CxZkg.text: Food is outstanding, albeit a traditional menu, and service outstanding. Braised short ribs w polenta melts in your mouth. We ordered the beet salad w goat cheese to share. It was enough for the three of us to enjoy a small portion. The patio area is exquisite.  My only complaint is that the last two times we've been forced to sit outside as the inside filled up. This time, I had inside seating but we were booted by a client that reserved the entire inside at the last moment (our guess is that it was a very windy evening, so they switched to inside seating rather than take a chance outside). As it turned out, the winds were not bad and we enjoyed the patio but the restaurant really shouldn't alter seating on a Friday night at the last minute. El Charro, its wait staff and the food, are all 5s if not for the snafus we've had twice with our reservations. We will return for sure and hope for a different reservation experience.  (the warn sticky buns they serve before the meal are a real treat, although they don't really go with the dinners, but imagine more of a very old tradition, which is cool)

photos.caption: Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. Braised short ribs. I substituted the polenta instead of potatoes and was very pleased.

ZIqBms0tKR5sw9mlbCsSLA.text: The patio view, the food, and the history all combine to make this the #1 place to take guests visiting the valley. The food is pricey, but dependable.  Overall, the service is good.  I give it 5 stars for the ambience alone (oh, and make sure to try the sticky buns or a date shake).

tsEHPSN9Ht1A_LFjxkdU-A.text: Dinner last week - we shared the burrata salad and vegetable Napoleon.  The tomatoes on the salad were hard and flavorless, yet the cheese was fantastic!  Veggie dish: Polenta was cooked perfectly, actually had a creamy texture vs. the typical grainy/corn texture.  Very filling and lovely.  Made a mistake of ordering a decaf Irish coffee -- far from the Buena Vista in SF!  They used whip cream from a can and first time out the coffee arrived lukewarm.   Nice wine list - enjoyed the Etude Pinot Noir.    We ate at the bar and servers were generally attentive.  Overall I would give the experience a 3.5 (I know - not available).  A four is too generous given the tomatoes and Irish coffee.

BkVDuGh4ExUm9S0c4CHVjQ.text: I really enjoy this place.  The atmosphere is the best, the food is great and the staff is wonderful.  Thanks to Phillip last night who was a wonderful server.  Only had bad service once.  They keep the patio temperature great no matter what time of years.  Great for special occasions.

1MBCXihBDw2Iqb8IGFAn6A.text: I enjoyed breakfast here very much.The service was great and so was the food and the mountain views! I had the trout almondine and the pork & green chilli as a starter.

JoHL53gQlDoZ7eaXuhbO2A.text: We at at El Chorro this morning and we were VERY DISAPPOINTED ...  The food was flavorless and overpriced. I ordered a sandwich with a side of mayonnaise and it must have been from the night before. it had congealed and there was ketchup on the bottom of the bowl (like it had been taken off someones plate and reused) ... It was nasty and did not spread. Once we complained to the waitress we were comped my sandwich but no other apologies made... We spent over $90.00 for 2 adults and 3 children for a Sunday morning brunch (which included 1 mimosa.) Wow... $4 Orange Juices and $10.00 chicken tenders. Don't waste your money unless you are just trying to find a restaurant with a good view.

A3eIGGxBl_8ybwZIUzcHvg.text: Food was fine.  Service was really slow and unresponsive.  Maybe there were understaffed.  We eventually got what we asked for but had to wait and wait for it.

tqfBvVU0Zexlf1nibcBVZA.text: Great ambiance and service.  Traditional food done traditionally and good. We had a great evening, really enjoyed the decor, history, views.  Lovely.

NQNZ55gByiHPd_nW1acjcQ.text: We went to El Chorro Lodge for brunch the other day and what a wonderful experience we had. There are a lot of reviews already written about this Arizona landmark restaurant so here's another review to consider if you're thinking about trying El Chorro Lodge.  Restaurant ~ they have one of the best dining patio's in the metro!  Great views of the desert and mountains, everything is shaded with umbrella's and they have the misters going full throttle this time of year.  There is usually some light entertainment in the evenings on the patio.  The restaurant is somewhat a "mission style" clean lines, exposed ceiling rafters and white walls with some nice art work.  It's smaller inside than what most people might think, so you will most definitely want to use Open Table or call them to make reservations before going.    Service ~ good servers here. Most of them are very attentive to your needs and very accommodating.  There were a few times we saw some of the servers blast past customers without a "pardon me" while going to and fro to the patio.   Food ~ WARNING, eater's discretion is advised here!  Yes they serve you  sticky buns throughout the day and they are sooooo good and very addictive!  You'll want to order more but dont!  It will spoil you appetite before you get your main course.  These tasty little buns or goodness will swell in your tummy so just enjoy one (or two) that way you'll have something to look forward to on your next visit.    On this last visit I had smoked salmon omelet with goat cheese, capers and some other goodies.  It was awesome!  It came with a side of hash brown potatoes and toast.  We also had their Creme Brulee french toast and ordered a side of bacon.  This sounded much better than what it tasted.  They use thick challah bread that must soak for a very long time, for this french toast tasted more like and eggie bread pudding.  The apple wood bacon was slightly over cooked but still tasty.  We also had their  eggs benedict which was delish.  You have your choice of proteins with your EB ~ canadian bacon, smoked salmon, lump crab or beef tenderloin and served with asparagus.    El Chorro Lodge has a great ambiance, good food and service.  It is what we expected most of the restaurants would be like prior to moving to Phoenix.  This is a great place to go with friends and family.  I recommend dining on their patio for brunch or a late dinner.  Hope to see you there sometime!

M1tUW290EGA5SzntrT5R6g.text: This is a TRUE five start restaurant. Our party of three was two out-of-towners and one local who was new to the area. We had El Chorro recommended to us by friends in Mesa. A short wait at the bar and we were seated on the patio and had a great server.  We had short ribs, seafood pasta and trout almondine with mussels for an appetizer. The seafood pasta and mussels were a bit overkill on seafood, but I am a seafood lover and loved it all.   The new Paradise Valley member of our group (fresh out of college) loved it as well as us older folks and plans to return as soon as she can. All and all a wonderful evening out. We have added it to our must visit in Phoenix list.

sIMs_IWkhNhlkmFGuQ4PMw.text: AHHHH-MAZING  Love the sticky buns! Went for brunch last sunday, service was great and food was even better. I had the breakfast burrito and loved every bite of it! Did I mention the cinnamon Sticky BUNS?!?! Sooooo good!  My sister had a delicious mimosa and some steak and eggs benedict dish and cleared her plate as well! She has been before for dinner and said it was great. They serve cinnamon buns at dinner too folks!  Its a fancy country club feeling kind of place but staff was very friendly. I will definitely come back.

3wWUj2-vNyWE_NvtjY-bbw.text: Went on a beautiful Sunday for a girlfriends bridal shower. This place is gorgeous. We had a separate area with a beautiful brunch buffet set up and it was lovely.  I'm not really able to write a well rounded review as I didn't dine as usual, but the food was delicious and the sticky buns are OUT OF THIS WORLD!!! I wasn't going to try one and another girl forced me to and they were TO DIE FOR! I'm stillllll craving them. I might have to go just to get a sticky bun fix.

kcq7rx50coHxYU1_eGPWfQ.text: El Chorro has been in the valley for decades. This is where the wealthy old tourists and snow birds dine for a good meal in a beautiful setting.  The patio is wonderful, very old west/desert sky elegant. The drink menu is creative and original and changes frequently.  We ate here with a group of 9 and they were able to accommodate us easily. The watermelon gaspacho was interesting and flavorful and spicy. The steak was cooked near perfect for my taste and the au gratin potatoes were off the hook.  The wine list is expansive, many bottles in the $40+ range all the way up to several hundred dollars.  The service, while attentive, is very casual. Don't expect starched shirts and formalities.  The clientele as I stated is typically older, our table by far was the youngest in the restaurant with mostly 40 somethings and a few 30 somethings. Expect a lot of Tommy Bahama shirts and Rush Limbaugh conversations.  We dine here once a year or so due to the ambiance and good food. It is rather expensive so we like to keep it as a treat.  You can't really go wrong here for a nice meal.

9nuNaX6BswmYN4nFbSx9oQ.text: Eggs Benedict is a classic and they do a great job. The inside is so much more inviting than before the remodel. Great job. Service is very good but a little stuffy. Highly  recommend

SNrpFhG57sq-RhTDNF0dnw.text: This review has to be broken into the tale of two worlds - happy hour and dinner.  First review will be our experience in the bar for Happy Hour and the Second in the dark, dark world of the outdoor dinner seating.  We valet parked our car without a care in the world. It was my wife's birthday so we thought we'd get to the restaurant early and enjoy the happy hour in the bar. Rachel was an absolutely lovely waitress. Our cocktails (party of five) and appetizers were simply a very warm, inviting, and lovely experience. The arisan cheese plate was enjoyable along with the grilled sausage trio. The happy hour buffet that is advertised simply didn't exist. Cocktails beyond their house pours were overpriced as expected.   Overall the experience was very nice and I'd return for this portion of the evening. (but, you might want to read my review of the dinner experience).  ---  After a lovely experience in the bar for happy hour (separate review) we were seated in the outdoor dining area (no one "got" us as we requested when our reservation was ready, and they didn't come to our table but asked us to come up to the hostess stand - no big deal but a bit tacky and awkward for all).   (This is very sad as we're Phoenicians for 25 years and have experienced this restaurant over the years)  Our waiter, Eric, didn't seem to want to be there or make our experience better in any way. Eric seemed to have had a bad day and so would our table of five along with my wife, for her birthday celebration.   We ordered directly from the dinner menu as we had just enjoyed app's in the bar. It was obvious that Eric wasn't' pleased with this but he marched off and placed our orders.   Upon delivery (next time we saw Eric), all was just fine until I cut into my $44 strip steak. After some time, Eric stopped by and asked how dinner was. I showed him the steak and asked if it was medium. No, and he took it away. He came back and asked if I'd like another glass of Cab - well, no, unless your manager is buying so I might have it with the steak I ordered. Ten minutes later, when the rest of the table was about done with dinner, my steak was delivered. And, yes, it was cooked to a perfect medium (although, who's hungry after sitting that long and nibbling off everyone else's plates?).   How's my wife's Birthday going? Well, not real well. Did Eric bring the wine, dessert, or anything to enhance the experience? No. I spoke with Alec, the manager, and he simply could not have cared less. His eyes were glazed-over as I explained the experience and lack of response from his staff. Alec was truly the manager of a restaurant that I would never want to experience again. He didn't sympathize, apologize, or even care about me or my family.   DON'T GO HERE IF YOU WANT A GOOD EXPERIENCE! Spend your $ elsewhere.

t-Wxq8Ctp6udnxZTw_g6ug.text: NEW CHEF!  We had been visitors before the remodel some years back and never made a visit to the remodeled El Chorro. While I miss the funky decor of old Scottsdale, I like the updated version also!   We visited on a very chilly night and after a drink at the bar, my husband suggested we have our early dinner outside on the patio under all the heaters. I scoffed. It's really cold. The hostess suggested blankets. So she pulled out cozy blankets to cover our chilly laps! After sitting at our intimate table underneath the heaters, I really didn't need it and enjoyed the moonlit sky.  Our server was Andre and he was great! Attentive and friendly without being too chatty. My husband had the sea bass and I had the pork tenderloin. We also had the wedge salad. Sticky buns yummy as always! Our food was moist, delicious and perfectly cooked. Soooo happy! Only complaint was that our wedge salad (which Andre had divided into two for us) had too much dressing on it. Second complaint was that the food was so good, I overate. My pooch is sticking out as I write.  In our conversation, Andre mentioned that there was a new chef in the kitchen when we said how great our food was. Strongly recommend El Chorro.

ftWf4sJx8XB8qOciIeBhXA.text: This was a great place for Sunday brunch on a beautiful spring day. We sat at the outdoor bar, rather than wait for a table, with no reservations.  The hot ham & cheese breakfast sandwich was delicious. Good service too. This place is a True 'valley of the sun' classic.

izPhTWTIipoy7DSqYeKqog.text: Maybe my expectations were too high but other than the mellow view from the patio, I wasn't overly impressed.  The place dates back to the 1930's and was remodeled in 2009 (??) The outdoor dining area has great views of Camelback Mountain.  The service is slow and the food was nothing to write home about.  I thought it was very overpriced as well.

Xm4jxmXPLcClYNbKYnzBDg.text: I came here for brunch today. What a beautiful patio with a wonderful atmosphere. Perfectly relaxing for a Sunday morning. The sticky buns they bring to the table are delicious. I could have just eaten those, but I did order the huevos rancheros.  They were pretty good but I was more impressed with the eggs Benedict my friend got. I would like to come back sometime for dinner. I'm sure the patio is beautiful at night.

psuY7hf-mg5KoVLucvFWSA.text: Had always wanted to come to this Phoenix institution, so when I had the opportunity I went.  Older place but nice with some absolutely beautiful scenery if you sit in the right place on the patio. It got cold out there, and they put heat lamps on which really helped tremendously. Nice bartenders, too, but beware the drinks are somewhat pricey at $9 for a margarita which tasted like it came out of the Sauza bottled mix.   Had the $12 cheese platter which fed more than one of us as they give alot of cheese, crackers, nuts, dried cranberries on it.  That was a nice platter really. But, all in all, a nice place to go in Paradise Valley, and--when I find Mr. Adequate--we'll be going there as it's verrrrrry romantic in the evening as they turn very few lights on at the tables outside.  Muy romantico...kiss, kiss, kiss! As Ahnold says, "I'll be back."

-b4UYqDbWiSfDRwxgCTWzQ.text: Attended brunch for mothers day. The place was nice and the food was good. However there was cross contamination with the dishes and both my daughter and myself are vegetarians and had stomach problems as a result.

tj79rZD3z8P6Y6d9iUe6ng.text: Yes, the sticky buns are great.  My grandparents would think this was one of the best restaurants in the world.  The menu is very old-school with rich, heavy dishes.  We started with the recommended shrimp pepper pot.  It was delicious, but we both commented on how heavy the butter seemed in the dish, and how it could have been lightened up with a little olive oil.  The house salad was romaine lettuce with a sherry vinegarette.  Again, a more modern menu would probably use different greens.  Our entrees were huge - my prime rib was cooked nicely but lacked a little seasoning. My wife had the fish special: halibut in hollindaise sauce.  Again, huge portion, very rich.  Coffee was very watery and reminded me of dinners at grandmas house.  The patio is amazing with beautiful views. The menu a throwback to an earlier generation of "fine dining." it was nostalgic to eat food like this, but i doubt we'll come back.

6qo6bvUej8rU7dFLCc_hyg.text: Typical American restaurant. Flavorless. Not to mention overpriced. Don't waste your money.

7WShfmrjVGdBewqxbYpeEw.text: Excellent food, ambiance, and service! I had the lamb, and my friends had the restaurant week special and we were all very pleased with our meals. Scrumptious!

xsGvEPGAC4yKrrpkJZDmXg.text: Great food and nice environment. Seating inside or out. Highly recommend for groups or date.

jn9hGyuqI9BldY5sVjJtfQ.text: I've dined here for both dinner and brunch. perfect place to entertain and get a flavor of an Arizona setting with it's beautiful outdoor patio. I had an out of town guest and before they left, I thought to make an Open Table Brunch 9:15 reservation for a party of 4. Early because my guest had a flight to catch, but I have to say it was really nice, the brunch crowd wasn't there yet so it was very peaceful and very enjoyable. The service was excellent.  Of course we had classic brunch cocktails: Bloody Marys as we munched on their delectable Cinnamon Buns and assorted pastries while looking over the menu. Entrees ordered: Banana Pancakes (toasted macadamia Nutella fondue sauce), 3 Sausage Omelette, Green Chili Pork Stew, and Best of Both Worlds Egg Benedict (one benedict of each. Jumbo lump blue crab cake, tomato salsa hollandaise, petite filet, bearnaise sauce)  All the dishes were hot, fresh, and tasted wonderful. My out of town guest had the Eggs Benedict which looked absolutely amazing and he said it tasted fantastic.  Arizona Landmark with excellent service, Food: very good... just a great place for an early brunch!

photos.caption: Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. Bloody Mary
Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. 3 Sausage Omelette
Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. Banana Pancakes (toasted macadamia Nutella fondue sauce)

QS7R-NBtWHFyIurlP-qopg.text: Enjoyed some of the best food and service we've experienced.   Denise was our server. She attended to everything quickly and was friendly and personable all evening. It was Monday night and Denise was training a new server. They worked together to make it a pleasant experience.   The food was well prepared, presented nicely and was delicious. Of course the atmosphere and ambiance of El Chorro is unique and a reminder of what great eating establishments can be if they stay True to their roots.

nSbgIh_06cf3z4ZIoPGTkQ.text: Decided at the last minute we would go here for dinner. It's always been a place we've wanted to try but always forgot about. Well, it did not disappoint. Our server Mark was immediately welcoming and very friendly. He provided us with excellent service. He recommended a delicious bottle of wine which paired well with our dinner. We started with the tuna and crab dynamite appetizer, followed by salads. I had the tomato burrata salad and my husband had the caesar, both were very flavorful. For dinner, my husband ordered the lamb chops and said it was the best lamb he has had. I had the jumbo shrimp and grits which were flavored with cajun spices that they gladly adjusted to accommodate my spice tolerance. For dessert their fruit pie was apple which they warmed up for us to create apple pie a la mode. Overall it was great culinary experience and I am sure we will be back.

ltNq0YkyMNjpakDY-QqzfQ.text: We had people come in from out of town and was looking forward to going here. Totally different experience this time versus last time. Hostess Anastacia was unpleasant. And basically all of the interactions we had with servers were pushy on everything. We didn't come here for pushy service. we came here for a peaceful dinner left feeling rushed while not receiving pleasant service after spending $600.

pJhzU9dw5hYDMtulEflsiA.text: This restaurant is one of the most amazing places I've ever been. If you come you must reserve a spot on the patio. It's gorgeous and even if the weather is warn their air units are fabulous. We had the greatest waiter we've ever had... Nate from Seattle. Ask for him. You won't regret it.  Atmosphere beautiful... this place has been in operation since 1937! Unbelievable! The food is outstanding! BUT have a discussion with your waiter because things can be creatively customized to match your tastes and preferences. My dish was no where on the menu or the specials list but it was one of the greatest dishes I've ever had. No one was disappointed and we all agree that if were ever back in Phoenix we're returning.

photos.caption: Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States
Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States
Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States

4xj0VjpTU2jY4F6V9LR3Hg.text: We had dinner last evening at El Chorro.  The dinner and service were outstanding.  Denise, our waitress, was very informative about El Chorro and gave us great information about the menu.  She was very attentive and made our two out of town guest so very comfortable.  Couldn't have been more pleased.  We had a variety of items from the menu: short ribs, beef stroganoff, flat iron steak, and sea bass.  All were wonderful and everyone raved  about which item was the best.  To top it off we're the sticky buns which were wonderful.  Ryan, the general manager, took time to stop by our table to ask about our meal which was very thoughtful.  Can't recommend El Chorro high enough.  Great for family, business, and out of town guests. Don Ingram, Scottsdale

skS6BFNrlg4Sa81TBbqryQ.text: Reservations made a week ago, sat on time, drinks were great, food was absolutely terrific, we had 8 different food offerings, team was friendly & seemed to be having fun at work. We sat outside which was awesome, this place is perfect for a great evening.

Ts4ebcdPAxkfy5GFywAwmg.text: Decided to come here for our fancy meal of the trip - made the right choice!! Decided to sit outside and it was nice - breezy, a little dark.. but that bodes well with the intimate/upscale feel of the area.   Our waiter was friendly and patient while we decided what we wanted to order. Decided on the crab cakes for our app, seafood pasta and short ribs for our entrees. There was a mix up with our app so we ended up being able to try the pepper pot shrimp as well, which was really delicious.  The food was FABULOUS - all the flavors were there and it was SO ENJOYABLE. The short ribs were cooked perfectly and melts in your mouth. Crab cakes and shrimp were super flavorful and rich as well.   Only small thing is the pasta seemed to be cooked similarly to the shrimp - felt like I was eating the same flavors.. just with noodles.   I guess it was the end of the night since our waiter brought out sticky buns for us, thank you!! They were a wonderful finish to our meal, although it's honestly a classier cinnamon roll.   And being that we were there pretty late/the last table, the restaurant promptly turned off the lights as soon as we paid.. not sure how I feel about that. Regardless, the food was worth it and done nearly to perfection.  This isn't a place to come weekly since it's so upscale, but this place is definitely a strong contender if you've never been/have something to celebrate, or just simply want to enjoy life!

Sw4_TOkFEVm9Mstjyzz4OA.text: Had dinner here Friday night. Arrived early so we had a drink at the bar. The bartenders seemed overwhelmed. Lots of drink order tickets stacked up and it took a while for them to take our drink order. A gentleman in a tie, I assume the manager, jumped in to help and they got quickly caught up.   We had the trout almandine and the sea bass special. Both were very good.   Special shout out to the great service from Tristin. He knew the wine list, told us about the interesting history of the restaurant's buildings and even showed us around the grounds after we finished. He made the meal very enjoyable!   Beautiful outdoor dining setting. We will be back for sure.

GahGXDNR7Bd72mkPfzRa_w.text: Been here a few times now, so time to rate. Dinner this trip was excellent. They start with their famous cinnamon rolls. My Lamb Shank was, I think, the best I've ever had. Tender and for those of you who don't like the sometimes gaminess of lamb, this is for you. Full of long hours of cooking... wow!  Two at our table had the wild salmon and they were THRILLED!!  I ordered an avocado salad before my main, that was great but sized for a meal. Loved the light dressing that accompanied it.   We have come and done appetizers and a salad for dinner also. Very good

x3qyo8YvRckogH60MQFc7A.text: We had never been here and were really looking forward to Easter brunch. But... it was a really bad experience. The food was below mediocre and dry and tasteless. The service was even worse and because we were a party of 7 and they added an 18 gratuity .. they somehow didn't think they needed to offer any service.  The valet was pretentious ... yes for real! They acted like they were doing us a favor by bringing our car back to us - and we drive a high end luxury car..wonder how they treated people who drove lesser cars! All in all... I can safely say I would never go back here!!!

T08ys-pkSs24ObzVN3aQjg.text: We went to the Easter brunch today At best this was a casino style and quality buffet  Very very mediocre food  Average service; food and valet both The food was dry in the trays and so average you'll wonder why you paid $200 for two  Please look elsewhere  This is completely not worth it  We would've have been ok if the ambience, views or facility was anything special but it just wasn't Please go elsewhere

LJNCKXa8fCbaLLt7WVG0zw.text: Semi-decent food but BAD service. The actual setting of the restaurant is beautiful (especially outside--it's gorgeous.) But our service was completely horrid, with inappropriate comments from our waitress who belonged in a Chili's or McDonald's, not at this place.

bZcDve1o25YO-iPL5uNzxg.text: Tracy- make sure you meet this young lady... polite, went over and beyond to find us a table for happy hour and although it was busy the service lacked ZERO! Adorable & professional young lady! The happy hour menu is off the chart... we had the sliders, that came with a bowl of assorted chips, the bun was fresh and pickles were homemade. Make sure you end with an order of sticky buns-the recipe from 1935 still stands the test! Overall ALL the employees were professional and friendly- the service was I impeccable... will come back.

F6pq7lxlMYfzoxnCvtv6_Q.text: We were turned on to this place by some friends of ours that suggested we go for restaurant week. It was really really great and I am glad we decided to give it a try. We got a spot on the patio which was absolutely stunning! We were seated right away and the staff there were very friendly. The restaurant is actually quite large and they have a lot of patio seating which I was surprised about.  The meal started with a lobster bisque which was delicious. They also brought out some sticky buns which was a little odd for the beginning of the meal but nonetheless they were good. My husband and I both got the fillet, I got mine with a crab cake and loved it. The steak, mashed potatoes, and asparagus were all really great however, I did not care for the spinach. Lastly, for dessert we got the tiramisu and strawberry shortcake which were delicious.  I would absolutely love to return here and try some of the other items on the menu and to enjoy the great ambience of the patio.

photos.caption: Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. Tiramisu desert
Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. Filet with the crab cake. Amazing flavor!

okadXzEam9SjVOmwbpi-ug.text: I NEVER give 5 stars!  I'd rather give a 4.5 rating because the service in the bar unlike the restaurant wasn't up to par!  There were tons of staff thank God as they took care of things bcuz of server pretty much disappeared!  The cocktails were a 6.5 out of 10....small pours; tfw wine list is a 8.5 out of 10; the food was a 9 out of 10 and the service as stated above!  It's a historic place and a MUST that's a gorgeous piece of property in a gorgeous city!  Don't leave AZ without visiting!!

IzpPxuQ1tFXiQXU7yfaXGw.text: Excellent. Love the outdoor patio. We only get to Scottsdale every two years, but always make a point of eating at El Chorro.

0IKlkhRzl7XVE9pgJueDSA.text: My cousin and I had dinner here last week and had a beautiful evening. I wanted to come to check out the beautiful grounds because I had a family photoshoot yesterday evening (12/28/18) I had spoken to someone over the phone earlier in the day (12/28/18 @ 10:45, I believe her name was Nicolette) She said there is a site fee for photography. She said since I was taking photos of a family who already had dinner reservations that the fee was waived, no site fee. She mentioned to check in with the hosts to let them know I was on the property taking photos.  I arrive at the beautiful El Chorro and walk right in to let the hosts know I'm here. They call the manager over who proceeds to tell me that I need to pay the $250-$500 site fee and that he has no reservation for me to take photos. He gets someone else who I believe his name was Tim. This is where I felt completely uncomfortable. He comes over to me and asks, "who are you???" I introduce myself and let him know what Nicolette told me on the phone. He accused me of lying and said "that's a lie, this is a lie. There is a site fee you need to pay". I kindly said I will tell the family who is waiting patiently outside that you're not allowing me to take the photos and we will leave. He then threatens me with "oh no it's fine this time, but if you disturb any of the customers, I will ask you to leave and take your backpack away from you" mind you, I have all of my camera equipment in my bag, so no one will be taking anything away from me. That would be considered theft. I said my thank you's and walked away from a very uncomfortable situation. The family and I walked over to the beautiful courtyard and took the photos. We didn't disturb any customers since we weren't anywhere near the restaurant anymore. I was SO excited to take photos here, but with the way I was treated, this place really doesn't care about anyone. If anyone is thinking of taking photos here, I would think again.

bWmPjm9hoctWyzBCo_t2nA.text: I finally had an excuse to try this place out with my girlfriends for brunch the Sunday after my birthday. I loved the patio and fortunately the weather cooperated so it was not too hot. Everyone really liked their food. The biggest hit was those awesome Bloody Mary drinks with the huge jumbo shrimp. Those were amazing!!  I was expecting a huge tab but actually it is a very reasonably priced brunch. If you know what to order. My friend sitting next to me got the French Toast which was a huge plate and she didn't finish half of it. My sister on the other side had the beet salad which was tiny! Since it was twelve dollars, about the price of many of the other meals, she expected it to be entree size but I would consider it small even for a starter. I had the breakfast tacos which were on the small side as well but very tasty.  Overall, I'd say that it's a great option for brunch and I really enjoyed it. I'd come back for sure just for that bread basket and cocktails.

xdd9jMuwIdM4Ilez64IBmQ.text: I had my birthday dinner here a few months ago.  Oddly, the weather in March was warmer than it is now.  I digress.  Anyhow, beautiful patio!  Although I would have preferred to sit on the patio furthest from Lincoln, it was closed for a wedding.  Not sure if it's normally open for general seating, but I'm hoping so.  Because we can't help ourselves, we started with both the shrimp pepper pot and the cheese and charcuterie plate.  The shrimp was in a rich, spicy broth, and served with crusty bread.  Delicious and perfectly cooked.  The small-sized cheese and charcuterie was to serve 1-2.  We either got the large size in error or there are some big ass eaters out there.  And I'm one of them, so I can't imagine that this was the small.  But regardless, there was a nice variety of cheeses and meats with all the accoutrements one could need.  Then came the sticky buns.  Dang.  I forgot about those when we ordered two apps.  Ooey, gooey sticky goodness.  But eat them while they're hot.  Once they cool off, it's over.  I do wish these were served at the end of the meal though.  I felt like it was a dessert.  Not enough so that I wouldn't order dessert...that would be unthinkable.  By now, we could have skipped dinner, but I insisted and we opted to split an entree, the seafood pasta.  This is where the star comes off.  We opted to pay the up-charge to have them portion it for us.  You actually get more seafood that way.  But I would have preferred less in the end.  While the pasta and sauce were very good, every piece of seafood in the dish was overcooked...shrimp, scallops, lobster, etc.  For the price point, there's no excuse for that.  I almost took 2 stars off, but I'm giving them the benefit of the doubt that this was the exception.  But it was disappointing enough that while I will gladly return for drinks and appetizers, I'm in no hurry to actually have dinner.

gx6L6iGFfsOHWX9emGVvZQ.text: I'm extremely disappointed in El Chorro  after tonight's special dinner for my mother's birthday turned out to be a regret. After being seated we ordered drinks, 25 minutes later and being told at least four times that my drink was coming, I find out they cannot make an Appletini and have to order something else. This was shortly followed by being served hard, Old tasting sticky buns, which was a major selling point for them. Still I reserved judgement, that was until I got my over-salted beef stroganoff and waited another 20 minutes for my second drink. After hearing that the experience was lacking, the server abruptly went to get the manager as if we had upset him in some way. The manager, Ryan then comes over to the table, pretends to listen and gives a generic  insincere apology accompanied by the gesture to make things right and ensure we finish having had a great experience. This by the way did not happen. He did nothing, no discount to the bill, gesture for a future visit or even something as small as dessert which would be a minimal offer after spending over $200. Overall this was a disappointing experience especially on what should have been an enjoyable and memorable day for my mother. Poor service was giving from the start and followed up with over promising and under delivering. Sad to say but I have removed El Chorro from the list of restaurants I would recommend. Note that I heard this restaurant is under new management which way be the reason why both quality and service have gone downhill. I have eaten here many times which is why this is even more disappointing

ApxivwfenwIznnurV3Fn6w.text: They serve an incredible brunch spread! I ordered a turkey sandwich with fruit and a side cup of the verde pork soup. Everything was perfectly prepared and delicious across the board. The entire table was raving about their selections. I would recommend the verde soup to everyone as a must try. It was not too spicy and had so much flavor. I usually have a hard time deciding on whether to go sweet or savory with brunch, I always want both! But you don't have that predicament here because they bring out the most amazing cinnamon rolls in place of the traditional bread basket. They were so good! I'll definitely be returning!

ySDwTrX76SzYF0ZTmtX3sg.text: Great food lace for a celebration lunch.  Our service on the patio was great.   Service inside does not seem quite as nice.   Views are great.

duU_HeCg_A8uXx0_4I6qrQ.text: Spent Mother's Day here with the family, and not sure we will ever return. They accepted far too many reservations, people were having to wait to be seated. We sat at our table for 15 minutes before anyone even noticed us. We were only offered one round of drinks, they came out halfway through our meal. Our server only came to our table that one time that he delivered our drinks. We had to flag him down finally when we got tired of waiting to pay. We noticed that he had very long conversations with other tables about his time as a realtor. Food was decent, that is the reason that I gave 2 stars. Our meal came out to $360 for 4 people. Mimosas should have been included for that price.

P8U1FvmpVRHgc0uDIuU3Jg.text: Ate there last night. The service was beyond bad. Had to wait 35 minutes for our waiter to take our order  but only after we had to ask someone else to get him. He said we were talking so he didn't want to interrupt-  wow! Had to ask for the cinnamon rolls that they bring as bread before dinner.Food took forever to come. We were outside and had heaters but they were pointing  away from table so we asked for the heater s to be pointed at table. waiter said he look into it but never happened. Then on top of the bad service, because we were a party of six, there was an automatic 20% tip and they have the nerve to ask for additional tip. Why does a party of six take more work than three tables of two. This place is a snow birders trap. Second time we have had bad service and mediocre food. Won't be back and would recommend others avoid them

NW-JEO8DeUJaqH-aLQqeUg.text: Not even sure where to begin on this horrendous experience. First off I was giving El Chorro a second chance as I last ate here a couple of years ago and did not have a great experience but that was nothing compared to last night  My girlfriend and I wanted to treat her kids to an "iconic" Phoenix dining spot with a patio as her daughter was home for spring break and she graduates from college in a few months. Needless to say we wanted this to be a special evening. Unfortunately it was quite the opposite.   After being seated we had to wait 20 minutes before our waiter even acknowledged us and then it was 45 minutes before we had cocktails served. We were not in a hurry and wanted to have a leisurely dinner but this was a bit much.   After appetizers and ordering a bottle of wine for dinner we waited over an hour for our meals and also had to order an additional bottle due to the long delay. In the meantime the table next to us who was seated after us had finished their meal and we're leaving.   By this time myself and my girlfriend were not only frustrated but embarrassed by the situation as we really wanted this to be a special evening.   We expressed our frustration to both the waiter and the manager who never once during the course of the evening stop by our table. To their credit they did comp part of our meal but that was not the point as the evening had already all but been ruined.   Then to top things off when the waiter dropped the bill off at the table he copped a whole lot of attitude about my being frustrated and stormed off.   Then this morning we realized that we had never even been offered the so called signature sticky buns which pretty much demonstrates how messed up they were last night.   Needless to say we will never be back and will certainly warn anyone not to as well.

CZm7qVfC1gPsjNA4Db7Wqw.text: Cannot go wrong here. Outstanding steaks, wine and wait staff. The lobster mashed potatoes and mac n cheese are a must have. Portio.n size makes it great for sharing for those like me who cannot decide.   Beautiful view of north side of Camelback. Mtn from outside dining. Cool bar.   Only regrets are we have not made it for Sunday brunch yet but will and they are not 30 minutes closer.

WZ8tgoijn5dYZcoeHTJbdQ.text: We always have a great time at El Chorro! Usually for a family brunch, mothers day or birthdays, but I had my baby shower there as well. The menu selection for brunch is very nice, food quality is fantastic. I have had everything from the French toast to biscuits and gravy. Their yummy sticky buns are served in a basket of baked goodies before the meal. Service can be a little relaxed, but they are always busy, and that has never had a negative effect on our meals. The patio is lovely, views are gorgeous and I love that they grow their own herbs and veggies on the property.

gO27YTbC7QOb9S39zRtppg.text: El Chorro certainly deserves more stars then it has! Whenever family comes to town we always go here for their final night. Although the menu is small, everything on it is AMAZING. Waiters are extremely attentive and are never hard to get a hold of. I went for my graduation and it was beautiful. We sat outside by a beautiful fire. Two adorable young hostesses were at the front and led us to the table. Lighting outside is gorgeous. I had the seafood pasta, and wish I took a picture to post. large portion sizes, and as a recent college graduate, I appreciate that more then anyone.

cs8o0BFBXm3x-k_z_FV-gA.text: I brought the family to El Chorro last night. It was my wife's birthday. Great service and terrific menu  The Halibut special was great and two members of our party had the braised ribs which were superb  Robert our waiter was most attentive and really made the night. He is very personable and kept just the right amount of attention to the table  Great history beautiful outdoor seating  You need to check this Paradise Valley treasure out for sure

n5TRep7vAyjKtAHn6JbFWA.text: Beautiful Setting, Perfect Service, OK Food  Big time points for the setting and the service here.
