You can relax here either indoors or outdoors and feel calm, relaxed and pampered. The staff is exceptional and service is simply what they do. If you go a couple of times they remember you, what you eat, what you drink, and where you like to sit. I love to go there for brunch on Sundays, and am comfortable going there alone.   They work very hard at preparing your food exactly the way you want it - and they should - because it is pretty pricey - but you are paying to be in that lovely setting eating it. I have nothing else good to say about the food, except for the sticky buns. They come with anything that you order, and they are delicious.  Go for the setting, enjoy the sticky buns and the excellent service, and don't give much thought to whatever else you are eating

B22WhOjXnST3O7JRMOoBqg.text: This is one of my favorite locations in PV. Located north of Camelback Mountain the bar and outdoor seating area has incredible views of the mountain. I like to sit at the bar or a high top table in the bar area as there is a nice vibe. The Happy Hour is a great way to be introduced to this place, if you have not tried it!

Nd0x8OocC3O3IRIsk94unA.text: So beautiful and so thankful for a wonderful experience. Chef Charlie made an amazing dinner of fresh heirloom tomatoes and burrata cheese, a fresh sea bass with roasted red pepper puree. Truly delightful and served with absolute care by John who loves his job! Can't ask for a better experience and a son who loves to make his mom happy!

photos.caption: Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. Hot cocktail on a cold winter night!

5jiA8ehL1QqLdAJOFk7a4g.text: There have been many positive reviews for this place, but definitely not my kind of place.  First the positive: The outside patio is lovely.  But the negative outweighed the positive for me:  There are no vegetarian dishes on the happy hour menu. The server did tell me there were vegetarian dishes on the main menu, but the only thing that looked vegetarian was the tomato  burrata salad I it was terrible and over-priced. El Chorro would do better to serve the traditional caprese salad. I did not eat the salad.  It was supposed to be served with crostini, but I never received that either. I did ask for some bread and the server acted like it was unusual but finally served me some old, hard sour dough bread. Definitely not going here again.  Sorry El Chorro, I found the service lacking and the food worse.

ArSTUWPzNFVAJ2kp2Wheew.text: This legendary place is a beauty that is tucked up in Paradise Valley with an awe-striking view of Camelback Mountain. With history thru the 1930's the beauty of the mansion is magnificent. The patio is huge and I was excited that our group was able to sit outside without it being so hot and take in the beauty of the place and the mountain. We started off in the bar with happy hour. Loved the cheese plate. Loved the sausage plate too. It's ample and enough to share with one-to-three people as a sampling. The bar is busy. It was pretty much standing room only. I waited for the waitress to bring my house marg. when she forgot and reminded her a couple of times. Yet working in the service industry at 39k feet, I am forgiving and I get that! Meh. Wasn't a fan. Pass on the house marg that is priced way above what it should be. My boyfriend got the Pom Fire marg. a mix of margarita/pomegranite/jalepeno. He loved it; but was happy with just one before heading to his usual brew. I could not taste it, despite the desire to, as I am allergic to jalepenos. Bummer. I opted for the seasonal Strawberry Bliss drink and loved that one. It's a mixology of greatness containing champagne, mint sprigs, muddled strawberries and liquor. MMMMMMMM. Blissful.  Again know that these drinks aren't for the budget conscious. A happy hour drink that ranges from $9-13 is not exactly 'happy'.  Dinner we moved on to the patio. Live music provides an ambience as does the back drop of the mountain and lighting is just correct. Our picks for the night: Truffle fries.. Yum.;Filet 8 oz with Peppercorn. Heaven in my mouth.; Tenderloin Pork. Yum; Sticky Buns. Don't like sweets, but everyone raved over that gooeyness!; A bottle of Pinot Noir. Get ready . Dinner alone will set your wallet back over $250 smacks. Great service. Perfect setting for the desert. Awesome food. Steep price. That being said. You decide.

NGwiw6HVT8Jv7G2qtGwAlA.text: The food is fabulous and the ambiance is fantastic. This is a great place to meet friends for lunch and the views. Dinner here is so nice and romantic. Don't forget to bring your winter visitors here for lunch, they will love the food and rave about the setting!

LZd-ZM320I11kdYVu8e-zw.text: Tucked away in the town of Paradise Valley, this place is a local legend.  It was one of the first places I visited when I moved here a couple of years ago.  Since then, we come here every once in a while to meet friends for drinks or to entertain people from out of town.  The Better Half and I enjoy the "Southwestern" decor and atmosphere here, but it's done in an upscale & classy way.  When we dine here, my fav menu items are:  9 oz Filet, $41 Truffle Fries, $7 Scalloped Potatoes, $7  I try not to come here when I'm super hungry because the Filet is only 9 oz.  It's very good and the portion is just right for a normal hunger level, but it's kind of small for a big appetite night.  The Truffle Fries are amazing and the Scalloped Potatoes are delish....but filling.  We enjoy sitting outside here.  They keep their exterior furniture very clean and it's comfortable, especially during the Fall & Spring.  The building & complex is huge....I guess they can do fairly large special events here.  The only special events I've attended here are business mixers or industry cocktail events....but I've heard it's fantastic for weddings, anniversaries, and reunions as well.  The service here is great.  Nice employees who are friendly and accommodating work here.  There's plenty of parking in the back or a valet service if you choose to use it up front.  Return Factor - 91%

He8o7AFFBqNYbyOKoOXegA.text: We go to El Chorro every time we visit AZ.  Never a disappointment.  Food is outstanding and service is the best.  Our most recent visit included three times to El Chorro.  The outside patio must be the best one in all of Phoenix.  In the shadow of Camelback mountain, we enjoyed wonderful dishes like the ever fabulous trout almondine, lamb chops, seafoods of all kinds and prime steaks. The NY strip I had with a peppercorn sauce on the side was just one of the best steaks I've ever had.  The pork tenderloin is like no other pork dish anywhere.  Can't wait to travel back to AZ and enjoy the best restaurant in the entire valley!!

rgminwal0tStTCYiC1zPOQ.text: Over priced and the food is highly variable. Had a fish dish that was one of the best things I have ever eaten, and a vegetarian dish that was worse than dirt. With the respect to the latter comment I am being unfair to dirt. Call me traditional, but I would prefer consistency. Service was great, but did not make up for the poor food.

_HFtTfTk15Fj9DVftvNICA.text: The atmosphere and view is unparalleled but I think they know it. The food, while very good, took an inordinate amount of time on a Monday night with the restaurant not that full. Received apologies for the "slow kitchen" several times. It was clear though that some of the food had been holding while they completed other parts of the meal (and perhaps a trip up to Costco). Experience did not equal the price.

FzCN-BANCRdMGIc9O1t7ig.text: Delicious food and excellent service!  The ambiance is wonderful.  Those sticky buns are amazing too!

FGvyBCB5_zsrmIf0xxSj3A.text: Happy Hour here is the best, free food & drink specials. Great views & intresting people. Met friends for dinner / restaraunt week, trout was great & service was great. When @ the bar ask for Alec he is great.

F1P2n3XBnxP7N2ms-lBaAA.text: Food was terrific.  Service was polite until the older gal showed up as our waitress.  Would definitely come again and recommend this restaurant.

-jG11ah8YK-qtipyXi9cUg.text: We had a lovely dinner here. It is an elegant setting with indoor and outdoor seating. The sticky buns were a nice twist and the filet and salmon entrees were superb. Our server was excellent.

YVoI_tRDMg9tCl4BrtR0gw.text: I love the view, food and service here. I love dinner and brunch at El Chorro. I just adore everything about this restaurant. (No, the sticky buns are not a draw for me :) I personally think they are weird with wine and dinner-I guess I am not a sticky buns kind of girl) Love the patio!This is one of my favorite places in the valley.

IQW3pDhOCaIvHZbyLeVuUw.text: First time being back to El Chorro since the remodel a few years back and it has really opened up the outdoor seating areas and added some great views to the place.  The sticky buns are still spectacular. Our group had the cheese platter appetizer and it was delicious.  Salads were fine but nothing special.  Main dishes were generally OK but on the plain side.  The roast chicken was very bland.  The Beef Stroganoff was good but underwhelming.  The steaks were the best things ordered.  I general, just nothing special was had that made the meal memorable.  Had Blueberry Pie for desert and the theme of adequacy continued.  For the money and from past memories I was expecting more...maybe my expectations were too high.

vXt9zoE5LGHoZWk2lmXaIw.text: I always love gong to a local staple and if you are looking for a culinary classic search no further. The best dishes are the deep fried lobster wit the drawn butter and the sticky rolls are to die for.

sKamHsvDSQVP7u8GwKc1mA.text: I came here for a pre-Thanksgiving dinner with the almost in laws. We enjoyed happy hour drinks and appetizers on the patio to start, and what a great start it was! We munched on tater tot-like pom fritos and the sausage plate, which came with assorted pickles, mustard and pretzel bread.  Next we moved into the dining room and our table of choice was next to the fireplace. So cozy! We were all starving so we ordered another appetizer, the shrimp pepper pot. That definitely didn't disappoint! The shrimp was incredible! It reminded us of the mo rockin shrimp from eddies house. Delish! For dinner I tried the pork tenderloin and absolutely loved it! It was perfectly cooked and bursting with flavor. My man had chicken enchiladas and those were nice as well. All in all, we were more than satisfied with our evening at el chorro, and will make it a point to return for happy hour and dinner more often!

hlH6gYzYGZSwKOF938Atgg.text: El Chorro sits right on the backside of Camelback mountain and has a southwestern decor and gorgeous patio.  Casual dress or a nice dress could be worn here.  The menu has a variety of options.  We started off with a shrimp pot dish and it was deelish.  My entree was trout almondine with green beans ( ordered a separate side of scalloped potatoes also)  My dish was prepared perfectly and didn't walk out feeling overly stuffed (like my usual) so I felt pretty good about myself for having the self discipline to not order a dessert.  Sit on the patio if you can!!!!

6-J9AoIMsHRLaP9fXA83Rw.text: Four of us dined at El Chorro on Jan. 2, 2015.  The restaurant is nicely appointed with a courtyard for outside dining; large bar inside; and a nice open dining room.  I had the seafood pasta dish which was excellent; my wife had the 1/2 order of the New Zealand lamb chops, which was also excellent; another diner in our party had the short ribs, which he thought were excellent; and the other diner in our party had the trout almondine, which she said was outstanding.  Overall, the food was excellent.  The waitstaff were attentive but not overbearing.  Price was moderate +.  I would recommend the restaurant to a friend and we would return.

iMD56EgZTKxnf23cF-clKQ.text: Update...went back again with old friends. Beautiful surroundings...and that's it. Rude service once again. I'm done with this place. Makes me so sad, so many happy memories here. Customer service is everything and they just don't have it here.

C3Vl8o5JVMk9xFbgN0FElA.text: Expensive, relaxed, sultry, with a ginormous motherload sized patio and courtyard area - quintessentially Phoenix (or should I say PV).   My first time here ever so cannot compare to the old and on a Wednesday didn't have a reservation so was seated in the bar patio with the bar menu. The cheese & charcuterie platter was fabulous but the steak & onion soup was the rogue menu addition and bad order choice (great steak but processed onion flavor).  ***Warning*** $15 Chopin martinis...but it was fabulous and so was the view. I could really learn to love $15 martinis here.... of course I can also imagine the valet bringing me back a Bugatti when I leave.   Eager to return for a main course or happy hour again...

h-8jR_OC2ct2LmuI3Jq3OA.text: I had the opportinity to attend the Easter bruch on April 5, 2005.  Arrive eraly and had a drink at the bar awaiting friends.  The Bar Tender indicated they had 1,800 reservations which immediately concerned me.  The Brunch was equivilent to a standard resturnat buffet with sesert thrown in.  There was no silverware on the table, getting water was a challenge.  The plates were never cleared.  Asked several time for someone to take the plates.  How this place still draws a folllowing is beyond my understanding.

JnoZtr1FEAWP1AN2rXkeyQ.text: Gorgeous grounds and fantastic happy  hour

2eBvv6dNoecCM-UgEWB88g.text: Great drinks, food is below average and way overpriced. Atmosphere is ok. Not in the top 100 in my book.

C5HxeauXEql9Kj-XwmrV_w.text: My husband and I finally made it back last night for a do over. We arrived about 4 and sat at the bar for HH.  Everyone behind the bar was very attentive from the start.  I had the HH margarita and my hubby grey goose Cosmo - perfect.  By 4:30-4:45 the bar was full.  We decided not to order off HH menu although everyone around us did and it all looked great.  We had the pepper pot shrimp - so delicious! I wasn't sure about the beer broth when we ordered but such a nice compliment and the dipping bread...yum!  We also tried the flash fried lobster with drawn butter (not needed) but the aioli was great and the batter was so light it did not take away from the lobster.  Our bartender Jason was so great very attentive but did not rush.  Our experience had gone so well we felt we needed to stay for dinner.  We shared the filet cooked at medium as ordered which came with a portion of scalloped potatoes and brocollini, lobster Mac and cheese - good, and the steamed spinach.  Everything tasted SO good.  Overall it couldn't have been better.  You would never have known they were hosting a wedding and 3 other events last night.  Thank you, especially Jason and Ryan!

fGvLugzHqyDuAeZ9tWuLsw.text: It has been 1 year since I went to El Chorro. Went to Sunday brunch last week and was very disappointed. Ordered eggs Benedict and got cooked salmon on the bottom that was salty and a very small English muffin. Eggs Benedict should have lox or cured salmon . I could have cooked a better dish at home . Not worth the money. The service was good but the kitchen needs to do better at making their food worth while. The best eggs Benedict is at St. Francis on camelback rd.

cUwIpnCVOkY7XVo4IhC_1g.text: I came for brunch with girlfriends & sat in the outside patio area since the weather was cooperative.  Customer service was great.  I had a bloody Mary which was pretty good & also had the Egg Benedict with Canadian Bacon.  I thought the food was ok.  Maybe it was just my particular choice which wasn't too impressive.  It wasn't bad though, just to clarify.  I probably wouldn't go back again, not because it was bad but because I am not from the area so I'd probably try to find a better "go to" spot.

aL9HrFPEfAA91kYbKoHutA.text: I'm torn on my rating for the new El Chorro Lodge.  I had visited the "old" El Chorro Lodge prior to the renovations, and enjoyed it (although I found the bar area seriously lacking).  But last weekend was my first trip to the upgraded version, and it was a mixed bag.  First of all, let me say that if I were rating on ambience alone, this place would get a solid 5 stars.  Their patio area is extensive, and there are so many cozy nooks with semi-private fireplaces scattered around that it's easy to find a quiet corner to relax in with your special someone.  The bar area has been increadibly re-done, and is beautiful!  My friend and I sat at the bar, and were entertained by the live band playing just a few steps away.    Now the downside.  The bartender that helped us (there were at least three behind the bar) was just ok.  He was very friendly, and very enthusiastic, but didn't seem very knowledgeable.  We asked him for drink specials, and were told there were none.  We asked for drink recommendations, and he had none.  We asked if they offered specialty martini's, and were told..."um....we have the El Chorro Martini"....finally we asked for the drink menu, and found that there actually were a BUNCH of different specialty cocktails and martinis that all looked appealing.    I ordered a beer (I know, I know, after all that....but it sounded delicious), and my friend ordered one of the specialty martinis with basil.  After 5 minutes I got my beer.  After 10 minutes, still no cocktail for my friend.  We mentioned it to another bartender, who told us that he'd pass it along.  Then our bartender came back and began to make the drink....slowly....Finally, when it looked like it was ready to be presented, our bartended said "oh....I need to make you a new one.  The basil I used is still dirty"......and the process began again.  Once the drink was received, it tasted great and we enjoyed the rest of our evening.  I guess I'm going to give four stars as an average for the 5 star ambience and 3 star service received.  But I will definitely be going back soon.

SOOVBpcoxErKe-eKiTqWGA.text: Difficult rating as I have had very different experiences at this restaurant ranging from very good, 4 star to not so great, 2 star.  Love the ambience of the patio.  Happy hour was disappointing as so many tables were reserved that we end up in a corner and  reserved tables were still empty when we left.  Brunch was good but very slow coming.  Really slow.  I will give it a few more tries.  I do like the brunch menu.

KVJX58ly3LRDlff0ink_FQ.text: This place was amazing! Gorgeous setting, wonderful service and everything we had from sticky buns to chateaubriand and the beet salad and the cake and even the coffee were perfectly prepared. Can't wait to go back! N

4uB_vdC7czvVhsisSz9onQ.text: I can't believe how this place has expanded! I was put off by FOUR hosts when we first walked up... told it would be a 2 hour wait and they weren't welcoming AT ALL. We were going to grab a drink and go somewhere else, but the waitress in the bar said she would serve us in there (Elizabeth) and she totally turned our experience around.   Food is tasty. Don't have high expectations for portion size. I ordered the Pan Seared Escolar, which was wonderful It was served with snap peas and crispy potatoes. OK, so the potatoes looked like a Parmesan crisp served on top of the fish, not a side dish at all. There were 3 (THREE!!!) snap peas. Someone ordered the flash fried lobster, that was good. Someone else ordered the fillet - he said it was good. They still have the sticky buns...yum! White Cosmo was super great, best martini ever.   Pricey and a little overstated for my taste, but still a good experience all around. BTW... walked the restaurant after dinner, tons of empty tables. Don't understand the 2 hour wait???? Make a reservation... Thanks Elizabeth!

MJ5Js-IPrqLyNTcXIwXChw.text: Have you been the the new El Chorro? El Chorro is a Paradise Valley staple, originally built in 1934 and is a unofficially extension to the Paradise Valley Country Club crowd. In an effort to compete with the new, more modern trendy places in the area (BLT Steak, Prado), the restaurant has been completely revamped with a more modern, brighter feel. However, it still is attracting the silver-haired population.   The food, however, has also received a major overhaul. There are still comfort food options like Beef Stroganoff, or more current ones like the pan seared escolar (soooo good! Please try this, it's one of the better fish dishes I've had in AZ!). My Mom loved the duck, Grandma loved the Mushroom Ravioli, and  Dad loved the Pork Chop!   Every entree comes with a salad or cup of soup (the Steak and Onion soup is delish!), which is so rare these days for fine dining.   Great service, better atmosphere, but still not stepping away from the geriatrics, but overall, I was happy to give El Chorro another shot!   Yes, they still have the sticky buns.... and they are wonderful!

OejDeF6btyRP3HbEiS1K_A.text: Living up to the hype is far from the reality! The atmosphere was well done and beautiful to their credit. The food, menu and average age of customers was pre-vietnam. The experience started with us receiving OJ that tasted concentrated @ $4 a tiny glass. The second was the Americano I ordered, still had fluids from the cappuccino machine cleaner. I was unimpressed with the place and wonder what they will do in the next 10 years.

u7ODvU1t2dZKkR4Lel-EQw.text: I have dined here for Sunday brunch a few times and was always impressed, but I finally got round to having dinner here last month. And...OH MY GOSH. Without a doubt one of my favorite dining experiences in Phoenix. My parents were visiting from out of town and I wanted to wow them with somewhere fantastic, El Chorro did not disappoint. We sat outside on the patio - what a great setting with some great music playing in the background.  Our server was fantastic (I wish I remembered his name, shame on me!). It was restaurant week and the $39 for an appt, entree and dessert was a steal of a deal, but we opted for the regular menu. A little pricey, but worth every penny. The sticky buns are to die for. El Chorro is the total package and I will, without a doubt, be going back there very soon.

V7Ir0p60SO7ZwosJA_DI9w.text: I had brunch with my family on the patio at El Chorro this morning, and I was quite disappointed with this landmark restaurant.  We sat on the patio - which was absolutely beautiful (and the reason this rating gets any stars!)  and had an amazing view of Camelback Mountain.  There was also a fair amount of heaters and fireplaces, so it would be nice to sit out there in colder weather, too.   It was pretty fun to people watch here - everyone was so expensive looking! And, at 23, I think I was the youngest person there by a solid 15 years.   The service here was extremely sub-par, especially considering the prices they charge.  We were greeted with a "you have reservations, don't you?!"  No, we don't. And now you just made us feel like we did something wrong by not making them - even though there was plenty of seating!  We were seated right away, regardless.   And, it goes downhill from there. The waiter was unfamiliar with the menu and had to have us point to several items on the menu.  The bus staff that brought us our food had quite a hard time reading the ticket that told them who ordered what, it would have been much faster to ask, "who had the french toast?!"  I was brought the wrong dish, and when it came out the second time, the eggs weren't cooked how I asked.  It took a good 15 minutes to get our credit card back from the waiter after we had given it to him to pay.  I tried to give the staff a little credit, because this place is brand new - but you think in this economy they could hire some experienced wait staff!   I thought the prices were ridiculous - $6 for a side of 2 eggs?! $13 for a fruit bowl!? Ouch.  As much I would like to come back for drinks on the patio at sunset, I don't think I can justify dealing with the staff and prices again.

KAwi5CKHInxYSobWLEiOjQ.text: I hadn't been to El Chorro in 7 or 8 years...long before the renovation and was completely impressed!  We met some friends for happy hour on Friday night and it was quite a great deal - $5 sangria, $4 select glasses of wine and free food - sausage and cheese risotto croquettes, tomato/mozzarella salad and a cheese display.  The locals clearly know about this deal, so make sure to get there at 5pm when it starts!

c_no6Xo15R2KWSkqe_Qiaw.text: El Chorro is not a place I'll come back to. The atmosphere screamed 60+, I might even say 70+. My first impression was when I sat on the patio and it was covered with pollen. Not sanitary at all. We decided to move the party inside to their community table instead. It worked for our group. We all ordered the El Chorro Margarita that was on their Happy Hour menu. I ordered mine up (martini style). An epic fail. There's nothing worse than a martini with ice chips in it. We were all also disappointed in the drink's lack of flavor. They did have a good selection of food options. The best dish was the Southwestern Poutine. The street tacos were just ok, the soft taco shells could have been warmed up just a tad. We tried their famous sticky buns. Some really liked them, I wasn't overly impressed. The service was terrible. Our waitress kept disappearing. They added 20% gratuity to our bill because of our party size and it was obvious because she didn't bother to try and earn it. We also had a few dirty saucers handed to us. It was just old and southwestern and not the upscale environment I prefer. This place could use a renovation to modernize and help it live up to their website. You win some. You lose some. I give it a 2 out of 5.

w6a9xPLHyWgOXQdzR7wpzg.text: Wow, first time back here in 15 years. Awesome meal from the house salad to the tenderloin stroganoff. Top notch every bit of the way. Tracy the manager made sure we had a great time. Will be back sooner than last time for sure.

gZdsPvFkXI5ocnQkcfwWlw.text: My picks: Derby Smash Green Chili Risotto Pan Seared Escolar Sticky Buns  If you are looking for Arizona charm, this is the place. Every Arizona resident needs to experience this hidden gem.  Thanks Jacquie, Kristy & Tim for continuing to believe in this historic restaurant and landmark!

5_e-6-QX1fT4_2LKhogv-A.text: Was it the scene, the huge martini, or the company of friends?  Not sure and don't care, I love this place.  Sit outside at a table or at the bar, service was amazing and the night had a hint of cool about it.  I will return.

dOmOVOkZI2TXbeuzwuhgOQ.text: Came for Sunday brunch with a friend, and having never heard of the place, really had no expectations.  Upon pulling into the parking lot, I was really impressed by the expansive outdoor seating area.  Decor was relatively trendy with a hacienda theme.    I ordered the smoked salmon eggs benedict, and it was great.  Eggs were perfectly poached - the yolk ran out all over the english muffin and tasted delicious.  It came with sun dried tomatoes, asparagus and a potato pancakey thing that was pretty good.  The bread basket had the famous mini sticky buns, as well as a moist chocolate scone.  Service was extremely attentive - I think we had 5 different people waiting on us.  It was borderline overwhelming at times, but everyone meant well and was incredibly nice, so overall I'd consider it a positive.  Prices were a bit high for brunch but it was well worth it to sit outside in a quiet, beautiful setting for an hour or two - I'll definitely be back to try El Chorro out for dinner sometime!

mKsJboGazcyB65W2G-9SaA.text: Outstanding again!  Took an out of town guest there for dinner, the food was outstanding!  I had the salmon and my friend had the jumbo shrimp, both were spectacular!  Beautiful setting on the north side of Camelback Mountain!  I'll be going back!

-tZhRkXRWDaXcJAZYCVyEg.text: Went for dinner with my husband and parents before they fly back to France. Perfect dinner, perfect setting, service was excellent. I highly recommend El Chorro if you want to enjoy both the food and the setting in a calm and serene setting. The cheese and charcuterie platter is more about cheese than charcuterie but other than, the short ribs are excellent (really) and the trout was well appreciated by a picky french eater. The bar tender was very knowledgeable. Perfect evening.

Zj-pDg3ziUI6tIXrGF1BSw.text: This was recommend as a must do for fine dining. The views and atmosphere were breathtaking. Warm mini cinnamon buns in lieu of bread basket, OMG! Server was attentive. My steak was good. I was a wonderful date night out. Will do again!

J_XstwCvzUOj_9xFMa4Y4w.text: I have to tell you about the brunch I had at El Chorro over the weekend...   So good! It literally couldn't have been any better. It was a gorgeous day out to start with and we got to sit out on the beautiful patio. We ordered the Eggs Benedict (a must try!!) and the Smoked Salmon to split, and some Truffle Fries to snack on while we waited for our food. The chef also sent out a giant Shrimp Cocktail for us to try as well; probably the best shrimp I have ever had. Cooked perfectly and a great salsa/cocktail sauce to go with. The Eggs Benedict were absolute perfection. No BS, couldn't have asked for them to have been better in any way; it is hard to paoch an egg to perfection and they nailed it. The Smoked Salmon was very impressive as well; nicely toasted bagel, cream cheese, capers and a light salad on the side.   You MUST go try their brunch on Saturday or Sunday. Amazing!

6aSDf1I9tJlW3JyJXW-2Nw.text: Setting is gorgeous, though I still prefer the "old" El Chorro versus the "new" renovated El Chorro.  While the views are still outstanding and the patio beautiful, service was decidedly lacking and the our dinner selections fell completely flat.  Disappointing and for the price this restaurant charges, I expected much better.  We'll be back....  but for cocktails only!

4mqEXQWxjLS2s51wi8LDlA.text: Had a wonderful dinner here Saturday night for my husbands birthday.  The service and food were excellent.  I got the filet which was cooked a perfect medium and had a brandy peppercorn sauce with it, it was fantastic.  My husband had the roasted chicken and it just melted in your mouth.  Absolutely loved the sticky buns they brought to the table.  It was like having dessert first.  Our server Stuart was one of the best waiters we have ever had.  Can't wait to return and sit outside when it's cooler, their outdoor seating area is beautiful with great views!

cnWkzuIsm5KpESuBPVzlCQ.text: Got a recommendation for this restaurant from a friend, and SO happy we came.  Made a reservation to eat on the patio, it was a bit chilly and we were warned to dress appropriately. We got there right at sunset and the backdrop of camelback mountain was spectacular! The whole dining patio was amazing...heaters everywhere, fire pits etc.  it was about 50 degrees while we ate and I never had to put on my jacket.  The food was amazing, the service excellent. Can't wait to co e back!

2GprBlXo4kfMzM8UyW6Fug.text: This was the coolest place to go 24 years ago when my wife and I moved to Phoenix!  It had the twin lobster tails that were flash fried as an entree and was the best thing I had ever tasted!  We now live in Kansas City and brought our kids to Phoenix for Spring Break and wanted to take them to the place w the twin lobster tails and some of the best food in the Valley.  However, what we experienced last night was anything but!  For one, they no longer had the twin lobster tails as an entree, but as an add-on to an entree for $35 and all we got were 6 little pieces of what was supposed to be Lobster, but not sure it was even Lobster!  I spent $300, w tip for the entire family and our meals and was extremely disappointed with what we got for our $$!!!  I would not recommend this place to anyone anymore...and sad to see such a great place it was once...is NO More!

f9HvMXmw0WovsUNMJ-PBHw.text: We had dinner here last night with a party of six. Every meal + appetizers were cooked to perfection. The ambiance is great too. We will definitely return!

-8twlkwMyHxSlqd9JXMwCQ.text: Absolutely horrible experience! We were hoping for a nice meal on Christmas Eve, but were terribly underwhelmed. The Hosts: We were immediately judged based on how we were dressed and given awkward looks. Although we made a reservation 5 weeks in advance, we were placed in a secluded room in the back that was freezing cold. We requested to be seated at one of the many open tables in the main dining room and were eventually moved. We were still placed in the corner! Luckily, the server ended up being very nice- the only positive part of the meal. The Food: We wanted to split a dish and were charged a 7 dollar split fee that was not listed on the menu- outrageous! Furthermore, the 40 dollar beef ribs were tiny and not even good. The salad was small and very bland and the baked potato was served with limited toppings, including no cheese which was requested. Post-Meal Consequences: 2 members of our party- both having had the short ribs- had terrible stomach aches following the meal. Something was seriously wrong with the 2 dollar portion of 40 dollar ribs and the sickness caused by the food is very worrisome.  Conclusions: Do not attend El Chorro unless you want to have bad portions, high costs, rude hosts, and sickness following the meal. There are so many great options in the Paradise Valley area, and it is a major mistake to blow your money and time on this restaurant.

xm42hL9EBK_YHK7XMiBYOg.text: I love this place!!! Great food, awesome ambiance, terrific service, extensive wine list and nice happy hour!!! Its got so much history too!!! My fave hangout!!!

B12-ZsAGUGsSxOe-aTiRTw.text: After being on my bucket list for awhile, I finally made it out to El Chorro for happy hour yesterday. This place has a legit happy hour! Everything on the HH menu is 3$.... that is crazy! We had decent margaritas that were on the strong side (3$), split the sliders (3 sliders and fries for 3$... and the meat was good, juicy and seasoned with onions... really yummy stuff), and the sticky buns (pretty standard sticky buns). The food was tasty and inexpensive... the portions were large. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this place for HH and I know I'll be back!  PS The restaurant itself is beautiful and the view of the mountains is nice.  PPS The bartender was friendly and our wait time for drinks and food was incredibly short.

XL3TwvxfZclFrNfpdGA9Yw.text: We have been going to El Chorro for Christmas for the last few years. It has been a wonderful experience that we look forward to each year. The Christmas experience is a fixed menu with three options, beef, salmon and turkey. The food is "old school " good, the service is great and the setting is fabulous.   Although Christmas there is fairly new to us, this restaurant has been a Paradise Valley tradition for generations of my family. It has been getting better, too. There are lots of outside patios and hidden nooks to enjoy a drink with your friends and family.

xeMbpP1KIqXGPe_8GvdnOg.text: This establishment needs a serious attitude adjustment.  Nothing makes up for service this bad but adding insult to injury is their slapping on a 20% gratuity (for a party of 6) when 3 of the 6 entrees ordered came out wrong, they ignored a food allergy, had run out of 3 of their house specialties of the day and took 45 minutes for the wait staff to figure out who had our table.  After electing to go to the bar to order a bottle of wine for the table, glasses arrived with no wine?  At the conclusion of the meal we asked to speak with a manager (which took another 15 minutes) and the most they could offer is to remove 2 of the entrees off the bill.  For the prices they charge and historic reputation it wouldn't have killed them to comp the $200 tab.  Let's talk a moment about the "famous sticky buns", they used to be when a hot, full basket would arrive at your table...now they count them...6 people, 6 buns (you get the picture) and refills will cost you and what is with the extra "fillers" in the basket?!  Sticky buns are sticky buns, leave the rest of the junk out as guessing every basket is returned with those remaining. Bottom line, If you want the "privilege" of paying $22 for Eggs Benedict and $16 for an Omelette of the Day (as previous reviewers commented (no substitutions) I suggest you go elsewhere, anywhere else.  Then perhaps come back for a glass of wine and the views. Take the time to read other poor reviews...in every instance the Manager attempts to comment and correct the wrongs but the same complaints are listed over and over again.  They are obviously doing nothing to improve their service.   I have been a resident of Paradise Valley for 20+ years and have loved El Chorro and brought many out of town guests, friends and family there.  Sad to say, I will not be returning.  I hope The owners are reading some of these reviews.

8OQUHOvpkKpTI7gGoZi9Nw.text: Based on online photos and online reviews but not an in person visit, I recently booked El Chorro for a group dinner hosting some VIP clients and crossed my fingers. The private dining booking contact, Katie Roberts, was very professional and on top of all details leading up to the dinner, and the evening of, the venue's ambiance and food was a Huge hit with our Sales team and clients. (And given how often our Sales guys are out at restaurants, their high praise isn't easily earned). If you're looking for a great venue to wow your staff or clients, you can trust El Chorro, and Katie, to provide a memorable experience!

lYRLMpf16ziA-_9RDN-abg.text: Fantastic views of camelback. Absolutely gorgeous location. Beautiful all around. Drinks are great. The lavender lemon martinis was good. The charcuterie board is fantastic! Fried lobster tail is great. The lamb chops are alright. Not the best. I should have gone with the short ribs as the waitress suggested. The sticky buns are FANTASTIC! And the apple pie was also amazing. Couldn't really go wrong and I had a great night.

photos.caption: Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. At the wedding post having fun.

iy8D-E4vGreve32WZnnkmA.text: A couple friends and I went here after a Yelp event the other night.  The server we had was super nice, and attentive. The food was good, although I was surprised that theyre catogrized as American food. With a name like El Chorro, and given the decor I was expecting mexican food.  I was very surprised by the decor. Again, judging by the name I was expecting it to be darker w/ a lot of rich colors and western pieces. the western pieces were there but it was more akin to what I imagine a resort in Cabo would look like. Very bright and open w/ lots of white and blue accents. I actually told my friend that Id love to have their bar chairs in my (dream) kitchen.  I cant wait to have a drink on their huge, gorgeous patio when it gets cooler.

photos.caption: Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. Fireside: Crown Royal Maple, Hazelnut Baileys, &amp; Tuaca

m5eMmoE7mFWrobiQ0xGvyg.text: Whenever we are in town, we wont miss going there! Best atmosphere and great foot plus super friendly and helpful service. We really travel a lot, but this is one of our absolute favorites!!!

yzbAB2TyGCD-mxizL_Re1w.text: Went there for the first time last night and it was great! The happy hour prices can't be beat and the crispy shrimp was crazy delicious. So good, we ordered a second helping. This may become one of my new go-to happy hour spots - just wish it extended past 6 p.m.   I would love to go back for dinner on the patio.

WHsaoJgFbn3nlA6mBA1G5w.text: I came here for my friends birthday celebration and it was perfect! It was a nice quiet setting and the food was delicious! It is pricey but the food was totally worth it! The service was stellar. Our waiter, Philip, consistently checked on us. He was great! I will definitely come back!

photos.caption: Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. Red Bird chicken! Delish!

Vpo84hJbcceU4eDarLugDA.text: We're visiting from Las Vegas and "what a wonderful find!" Met our neighbors from California who live in Scottsdale and had a wonderful meal in addition to tasty cocktails ( enjoyed the Passionate Mule so much I had 2) and a super server, Julia ~    The sticky bun are good, seemed odd for dinner but I had no trouble devouring mine. My husbands beet salad looked pretty and tasted as good as it looked. The Halibut was the special of the day and was also quite! QUITE!! delicious and presentation was suburb. The Fried Lobster good with really good remoulade sauce + butter, YUM!   We skipped dessert, enjoyed coffee/cappuccinos, walked around the stunning grounds, enjoyed the numerous fireplaces, and western decor.      Just a great, great evening if your any where near Paradise Valley, El Chorro should be a "MUST" stop ~

z5CetlSpAC_UpppUKlIqCA.text: Thank you for your reply.  After discussing with the party that attended we have decided to return.   On a positive note I would like to comment on the beautiful atmosphere and the items we did order were delicious. Such as the poutine and deviled eggs.

k9dAwcdZA0eNFzoo1o2XMA.text: I have been a LIFE LONG Paradise Valley resident, and have been going to El Chorro the whole time. I can't tell you how disappointed I am. El Chorro used to be the place we went when we wanted the El Chorro experience, and when we wanted a good meal. It looks like it is no longer going to be that place. Ever since they renovated, things have been slipping, now they have slipped so far I'm crossing it off my list. It's sad but it was because of their decisions.  Earlier this week we went in to El Chorro for for my father's 60th birthday. We had left an event and we going there for a drink and birthday dessert. We showed up and sat at the bar, the portion that is outside. First, we were greeted with a dirty bar. There was a bus tub sitting on the bar in front of us (which the bartender moved to the other side of the bar 20 min after we sat down), the back bar was a mess with employee's personal items, bar towels, and god knows what else, there were dirty linens falling out of a cabinet, etc.... The bar was dirty!   Second, we wait for the bartender for about 2 min. to even acknowledge we were sitting there. He was too busy talking to one of the servers at the service well. When he gave us our menus we opened them up to see what we wanted. But we opened the menus and they fell apart. Instead of getting us new ones, the bartender watched us put the back together for him. We then ordered our drinks and a dessert. The drinks are the only reason there's one star (and maybe the view), they weren't half bad. At least he didn't shake my Manhattan.   Third, we got our desserts and they were horrible. The brownie sunday. The brownies were either old or a very bad food service product. The ice cream tasted like it was out of a carton, and it had tons of whipped cream. I think they were trying to hide how bad the dish was with all the whipped cream. You're telling me that a place like El Chorro can't take the time to make their own ice cream and brownies. I could have done better in my kitchen if you gave me an hour. It was embarrassing.   Fourth, my mother was very unhappy about this. I told her to call and tell a manager. I'm in the industry and I know if a life long guest had an experience like this, the manager would want to know about it - so they could try to fix the problem. But, instead of trying to fix the problem, when my mother called, they blew her off. She hasn't heard a word.  I went to work the next day and talked to a few of my friends/neighbors/regulars and they all said the same exact thing. They said El Chorro has been slipping for a long time and they aren't going back any time soon. We are the people that keep El Chorro open, especially in the summer. We are the people that bring our out-of-town guests for a good brunch or good dinner. That's not going to happen anymore. Let's face it, El Chorro is an institution, they are going to be there for a long time, and I hope they are. The views alone are worth going, even if it's a mediocre meal. But, They will no longer be getting my hard earned money. I hope this changes, and I hope they reach out. I would love for things to turn around, but my guess is, with this management, nothing is going to happen. We went for my father's 60th birthday, a big family celebration, and we we're very, very disappointed.

f_IAjURC6SmECOqL3gfK9w.text: This place recommended to me by a few Phoenix/Scottsdale locals while I was in town for work. So glad I ended up there! The outdoor seating area is beautiful. Our server was friendly and gave some great advice on the dishes. The salmon was outstanding and my colleagues also loved their choices of the braised short ribs and the beef stroganoff. The sticky buns are delicious. Highly recommend this place and will come back.

b08nRIvaBG4DabtpylHidw.text: Very beautiful grounds, sitting out on patio for evening dining will make you not want to leave. They are known for suggesting you don't leave without tasting the famous sticky buns. Yet honestly, I have very much enjoyed every item I've tried on this menu. You must go during the seasons they are open, as it's not open year round from my understanding.

p3Du9qraVVz_VMV0pZTvsw.text: Maybe my expectations were super high since El Chorro Lodge is like an Arizona institution, but after experiencing a meal at this restaurant, I can't bring myself to give more than three stars.  Don't get me wrong, it was "A-OK," it just didn't blow me away.  The history of this place dates back to the 1930's and is pretty amazing.  You can read about it on their website.  The outdoor dining area is huge and has great views of Camelback Mountain.  The live music provides for a nice ambiance as well... at least live music when we were there on a Saturday night.  And our meal got off to a nice start with the relish tray and sticky buns - yum!  But the service was really slow and the food was nothing to write home about.  We found it to be overpriced as well.  I'd consider returning to El Chorro for brunch or lunch or drinks or just picking up sticky buns "to go" sometime, but I wouldn't recommend it for dinner.

9UgPQ4A1VWmOASM1yum2vA.text: Great patio seating. Nice bar area. Large portions and very satisfying. Valet and regular parking. Views of mountain. outdoor fireplace

photos.caption: Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. Salmon-starter size. Very large piece
Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. eggs Benedicts
Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. side of Avocado

iRF3UmTuLpP5sGjNeN42_Q.text: Great food and ambiance! Definitely a fun place to enjoy patio weather and tasty food. They offer a great happy hour (until 6pm!) and the service was incredible. The staff really work together to get you food and drinks so quickly and make sure you have everything you need.

photos.caption: Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. Patio area

ovqpLOLTk5gnypyFMYuWaQ.text: Oh how I love this place! I came here once for brunch and enjoyed a table on the patio. I'm a sucker for huevos rancheros so you better believe that was an immediate decision and there were so delicious! Good crisp crunchy tortillas but not too much, along with over medium eggs and potatoes ooooooh yes! And the sticky buns - are you kidding!? I could eat those all day long and I am not a sweet breakfast person. Also there's so much history behind El Chorro be sure to have your server share! All in all I love this place and need to get back for dinner!

photos.caption: Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. Meals come with sticky buns, scones and a croissant. Sign me up!
Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. Mexican breakfast is always a priority and this Huevos Rancheros is a must!

obB9SvwvqC9acfzVZORRgQ.text: My daughters graduation family dinner. Very nice staff. They accommodated our party that ended up to be a bit larger than the reservation.  We ordered the pork belly with foie gras. The pork belly was yummy but the foie gras I can leave it. It won't keep me from trying it somewhere else though. I got the Angus rib eye which they made to my liking extra rare please with leftovers for breakfast. The pot shrimp appetizer, fried shrimp was yummy too. My boyfriend got the braised beef, mom the pork chop, sister in law the center piece filet, ex the caesar salad. I can keep going on but can't remember everyone's orders. Just that we all enjoyed our dinner and service

photos.caption: Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. Sticky buns
Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. Kale salad
Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. Caesar salad

VV7BDZntpuXmHr4ilGjUbQ.text: Happy Hour in a historic Mexican Hacienda - Happy HourZ a-z  For a taste of times gone by, treat yourself to the El Chorro Happy Hour available Monday through Saturday from 4:00 pm to 6:00 pm.  The menu features a nice variety of appetizers.  Choose from deviled eggs to tacos or calamari to sliders, all ranging in price from $6.00 to $10.00.  In addition, the margaritas, well drinks and house wine are only $5.00.  Even more tempting is their "Sticky Bun", a signature sweet treat.  If you like artwork then you will enjoy El Chorro's collection.  The bar and patio area really sets this restaurant apart from the rest.  In fact, you get a great view of Camelback mountain which is located south of the restaurant, right across Lincoln drive.  Have you ever wondered who Lincoln Drive was named after?  Well here is an interesting fact.  Did you know that in 1934, a Dr. John C. Lincoln built this site as the Judson School for Girls so his daughter Lillian could attend school while he was building Camelback Inn (present day JW Marriott Camelback Inn).  Because of this, you might say this restaurant is "old school".   So plan a visit to El Chorro sometime soon.  One of our hobbies is visiting Happy Hour venues in Scottsdale and Phoenix.  Our website is a great resource if you want to Find Your Happy Place.  Happy HourZ a-z.

NmCSKiXVj0W7RDHn4SEKDQ.text: My family and I went to celebrate my mother in laws birthday and we wanted to sit on the patio because of how great the weather is right now. We had reservations, everything was great. Except the fact that it started to get windy and all the pre flowers or foliage was all over the table and all over us. And then you take a closer look and there are tiny bugs all over the table. It was pretty gross. Eventually we moved inside because of this.   We wanted the sticky buns and apparently they are only given to those who order an entree and not a salad. They almost charged us $12 more and we only wanted two sticky rolls for those who ordered the salad. Our waitress was able to talk to manager about giving a roll to everyone. It was just pretty disappointing how much they charge for bread. It should be included for everyone because of how expensive everything on the menu is!   Overall, the food was delicious. If you are going to dine at El Churro, you've gotta try the seafood pasta! But be ready to spend a lot of money. The stars are only for how great the food tasted, however, I doubt we will be going back anytime soon.

KkNASrbarykJmKRruznfPg.text: Our fave in Tucson. The chille relleno are the best. The kids lunch is outstanding. Served on a compartmental tray with more than they can eat. No wait for a table in the best room-to your right as you walk in.  Next time I'm trying the green chili hamburger. It's decadent

iQQjln3b1R4V8hOLz08MXA.text: We stopped there for lunch this afternoon and were very disappointed in two things . First the vodka tonic I ordered was not drinkable . They use a tonic which tastes like some kind of medicine. I turned it back and had a very good BloodyMary instead.Secondly , my wife and I ordered  the traditional eggs Benedict and again we were very unhappy with the dish . The Canadian bacon and English muffin  were not up to standards for a high end  restaurant . The bacon was substandard ; it was thin and fatty . The muffin was so hard it could not be cut with the knife provided. The egg was not cooked properly.  We have been ElChorro customers for years and dearly love the place. So we are hoping things improve .

6X635foNz_dfTd-3BbUbDw.text: Recently my husband and I went to El Churro.  We were visiting the area and we heard he cinnamon rolls were good.    Atmosphere; It's a fancy restuaurant with both indoor and outdoor seating as well as bar.  We sat inside and even though we had reservations, I still felt as though I was sitting on top of other tables.  I would have preferred more room between the 2 people seats.  Food: I ordered the shaved brussel salad, which was deliscious.  It was much bigger than what I was anticipating.  It was great though and I appreciated it was chopped.  We had asked for a side of the cinnamon rolls but the waitress never brought them out so we settled for the 2 that came with the meal.  The cinnamon rolls are deliscious and I can see why they are recommended!  For my entree, I ordered the sea bass special which came with a few beets, brussel sprouts, and carrots.  The plating was beautiful, but for a special, I would have expected a slightly bigger dish.  Never the less, it was cooked well.  My husband ordered the lamb shank which I enjoyed more.  Dessert: We ordered the brownie sundae dessert to split.  When I think of a brownie sundae, I think a large dessert but it was a small serving.  If the waitress had informed us of the size, we would have ordered 2.  The flavor was great and I enjoyed the passion fruit in the center.    Summary: In all, I liked El Churro a lot and will be back.  I recommend it to anyone local and my personal favorites were the brussel sprouts as well as the lamb shank.

BpNR3rILjT5Fz4A-s-yWXA.text: I call a weeks ago and talk to a hostess about bringing my group to el chorro. They said first it is first come basis on the tables. No reservations.    So yesterday i did a get together with my meetup group. There was about 10 of us already around 4pm. We all try to order a drink the waitress said we cannot pay individually especially if big group. If we had more 6 people it will be one check. We were trying pay individually and even wouldn't get the cash.    So some of my members try to buy drinks inside the bar and got refused from the bartender to serve us. They said we only can order from the waitress. The waitress was so rude no personality just such a bitch to us she should lose her job.   We ask the manager to talk to us he came out and said this is there policy. This is bad! I was there 3 years ago and it was so much better then. I will never go there again it is too bad.

qMs8r96PdTlUll4PHpFrNg.text: When you first arrive at El Chorro, expectations are high because of its location, it's valet ($6) service, and its entrance/atmosphere.   However, the restaurant fell short due to its food (mainly the appetizers) for its price.   For our table of 9, i think we ordered about 5 appetizers. Because sharing is caring, I had a chance to try all of them. To be honest, i wasn't not impressed by most of them. I felt the fried items tasted fried. The sausage bites weren't anything special. The pretzel bread it came with are sliced and weren't soft as pretzel bread usually is by the time i got ahold of them. The foie gras was pretty good, but it came with 3 or so mini pieces of toast. The board wasn't bad, but again for a $30 price tag...I'm not sold.   As for the entrees, I ended up getting an vegetarian dish (polenta) and I added a protein to it, which was suggested by the waitress. I liked the polenta dish a lot and its flavors. It outshined the salmon i ordered with it. And the only thing I knew about El Chollo before coming was it had great sticky buns. These we had to ask for, and they were pretty good - just a little sweet but expected. I can't speak for the other entrees, but I heard the lamb was tender and it fell off the shank and the prime rib was good, cooked to asked temperature.   Overall my personal experience is a 3 star because I don't think I would come back as the prices don't justify the food or service. There are other nice comparable options.

photos.caption: Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. Entrance
Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. Dining room
Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. Artisan Cheese &amp; Charcutrie Plate

OnyTMNaiLZGrNvdJFXKU-w.text: After two trips to El Chorro, I have confirmed my suspicion that the cuisine is not much different than any other "fancy" dinner in the area. The location is great. The restaurant's campus is drop dead gorgeous, and the views of Camelback are incredible! The sticky buns are to die for! But that's about where it ends. The french onion soup and various salads are run of the mill. For entrees, I've had salmon, grouper and even taste-tested steaks from El Chorro and they are nothing better than average. Somehow, they even ruined a brownie sundae by filling the brownie with lemon curd! The flavors are generally bland an uninventive, and there's really nothing (other than the sticky buns!) that sets this apart from any of the many "fancy" restaurants in surrounding resorts. In my opinion, this is a great place to impress your grandmother, but certainly not a location I would visit to satisfy my taste buds.

1PGp6NnMpZSDQ8JPmnP9HQ.text: We came in with high expectations and prepared for a somewhat pricey but delightful meal.  The place and its surroundings are beautiful.   Servers were ok but seemed to be consumed with themselves, especially the wine server.  Alright, some fancy places are like that so we tolerate.     We ordered our meals, all of which sounded great on the menu.  When the meals came out, about half of them were very disappointing.  My daughter ordered the filet which came out overcooked and cold.  I ordered the short ribs which were very dry and flavorless, like someone boiled them for too long.  The sauce on them tasted ok, but meat was not edible.  One of our guests ordered the lamb shank which also tasted like it was boiled and afterwards dressed with a nice sauce.  At least the shank was not dried but it lacked any flavor.  The other dishes seemed to be enjoyed so we were at about 50/50 at this table.  Those sticky buns though, not one of us liked the stale little cinnamon rolls.  Who serves that with dinner??  For the reputation, for the type of place and for the money they charge, I can't believe they serve this kind of food and have this kind of service.

lY9s5kElrdv2wcAc_nNC0w.text: We decided to hit El Chorro again for Brunch.  Man, oh man, what a way to start a day!     I had the Best of Both Worlds Eggs Benedict which is one bennie of Jumbo lump blue crab cake with tomato salsa hollandaise and one bennie of petite filet with bearnaise sauce, along with a side of roasted potatoes.   The crab cake bennie was delicious, huge portion of crab - much more than I expected.   I've never had a steak bennie before so this was a new twist for me.  I loved it, and the filet portion was again a little larger than I expected for a brunch dish at this price point.  Great flavors, great meal.   Had a great bloody mary as well, although I do prefer a little less horseradish.  They had a special on sparkling wine and my wife ordered a bottle of Chandon bubbly which we both sipped off of, then they graciously stuck a regular wine cork in the bottle for us to carryout.  Our server was awesome - super attentive and friendly.    Their patio is so money, definitely the place to be.  Misting system in full force, lots of umbrellas and of course great scenery.  It was quite comfortable, and we had yet another great experience at El Chorro.

w6hVKbvKIU-Sw5oK24_reA.text: I'm writing this review based on hosting a private event at El Chorro. I  work for a university and we chose one of the private spaces at El Chorro for an alumni reception featuring our university President. We had a fabulous experience from start to finish, and I would happily return for brunch, dinner, or any other occasion.  The first thing I want to praise is the amazing pre-planning customer service we received from Chelsa and the event team. Being Arizona we anticipated sunny skies and chose to book the combination indoor/outdoor private space for our event, but when the week of the event rolled around, it was some of the worst weather in the area in a long time, including torrential rain and wind. Chelsa worked closely with me throughout the week to monitor the situation, and in the end, it worked out that they were able to accommodate us in a larger indoor space and were kind enough not to charge us extra for it.  My mouth is watering right now trying to write a review for our meal. We did the El Chorro BBQ buffet and every bite I had was better than the last. The meats were cooked perfectly, sides were fresh and seasoned well (shout out to the chef who "cheesified" our mac and cheese, I will have dreams about that for a long time), and I can also confirm that the sticky buns are famous for a reason!  Despite the adverse weather, it was easy to tell that El Chorro is a great location, with all of the Southwest charm that had been advertised. Our event space was beautiful, and the staff was especially attentive to our setup needs with the last minute change of event spaces. The A/V was already set up when we arrived, and everything worked perfectly. We were highly satisfied with the quality of service and food for the price; if you're looking for a great overall experience, look no further.

8Nj5CUn1BEkrkNUafDi2bg.text: We came today for Father's day brunch. We were icily greeted upon arrival by some stuffy unfriendly old lady... they put us in this table by the bathroom probably because we had kids... it is father's day so obviously we would bring the kids to brunch. It wasnt super busy and it felt very dated. The menu is meh .. the sticky buns and the truffle fries were the only saving points for this place. Service was spotty, eggs werw bleh just eggs and the hamburger was overcooked and the bun was stale. At least give some more sticky  buns to forget the rest of the meal...very disappointing experience...do not recommend

YoInqv0MbpXNBk2q0_uWIw.text: Thank you Ryan, Chelsa, Nycolette, and Vicki for continuing to make El Chorro our favorite place Your service is outstanding and the food even better  Thanks for making the DeFalco's Anniversary Spectacular  We'll be back very soon

yDZgSdsCi9GRNwwuCyi94Q.text: I have been here a few times and always had a great experience, this last time the food was ok. No one was extremely impressed with their dishes. I had the Stroganoff and my beef was tough and over all pretty bland. I believe they under staffed for summer and the wait staff was falling behind. I'm sure this was a random fluke as the other couple times it's been wonderful. You can't beat the view and outside patio ambiance though.

WIQbM-QX8TCAU0mRA8ozYA.text: Mostly very good. The food, which should be the most important part, was excellent. Only a few things made the experience less than optimal.  First was the service. It was on the slow side. It seemed as if the staff was overwhelmed. For a premium price restaurant, this was disappointing.  What really turned me off was the valet parking. After dinner, they hit me for a $6 fee. Not much in the scheme of things, but it was a nickel and dime move for an "upscale" place. Especially after the significant amount of money spent on the meal.

UOfEo0mzDD_CJcmv83jTnQ.text: Came here for quick brunch after church since its right next door. Great atmosphere and location but that's all this place has going for it. Service is bad. Food is bad. Water was empty.   We ordered the burger and Benedict.  We asked for bacon on the side for the burger, but that is not how it came. Its okay we took the bacon off, and put it on the side ourselves. Strike 1. The fries were great though.   Benedict was terrible. It was not even warm when it came out. Sauce was mediocre. The potatoes were the only good thing of this dish.   The kitchen staff came and brought gravy on the side. I did not order this and he left it here for me. It was an awkward three minute exchange. I had began to try it since they brought it out and the waiter came rushing out and grabbed it and said this was not for me. And headed to other side of the bar and handed it to the lady EVEN THOUGH I DIPPED MY FORK IN IT AND ATE IT!!!!!! I was appalled. The man next to me noticed as well and was just as shocked as I was.   Never got my water refilled a single time. Same with my friend. Just ate our food and stayed parched with nothing to quench our thirst. It also took 15 min for them to collect our payment.   Stay away from here.

t65Rb5CsJlLf1Zl_1oJO7g.text: El Chorro is my favorite spot for Sunday brunch!  I ordered the omelette of the day, served with potato cake/hash browns, roasted tomatoes and a giant english muffin, the best breakfast I've had in a long time!  Not to mention their complementary sticky buns.  As if that wasn't enough, the atmosphere is unbeatable!  Shade, misters, and an exquisite view!

HvWccoSHVbAOWsLDctzu_g.text: Second trip back. Forward one week.  Today's table was cozily situated next to a gorgeous fireplace which was needed because as the afternoon waned the chill set in.  As always the ambiance was 5 stars.  But....service was hard to locate.  In fact, after sitting and chatting and chatting we decided to hunt down some wait staff.  We got bits and pieces of many servers but never the full attention of one person.  Why was this?  It wasn't that crowded...?  The happy hour food makes a great late lunch.   If you team that with a cocktail it is the best meal to be had.  Interesting to have a salad on the happy hour menu but it worked...for one...no sharing on that one.  If the management could add a few perky waiters or waitresses this place could be heaven.

5IZQNPfxTucH_JXObaaGZA.text: I had such high hopes for this restaurant as I was coming in from out of town and a friend who grew up in Scottsdale recommended.  It was a disappointment.  The food was just ok - nothing special.  The sticky buns everyone raved up - did not come out as an appetizer or even after meal treat - oddly came out with our dinner so it was basically over looked.  The restaurant was not crowded yet we were sat at one of the few tables without a view.  My biggest problem was the flies.  They were everywhere and we were seated INSIDE the restaurant not on the patio.  When you go to an up-scale restaurant to celebrate a special occassion, who wants to be shooing flies away from their food.  It was really disgusting and distracting.  For the money we spent to eat here I felt ripped off.  We ate at the Roaring Fork the next night and it was superb so if you are going to be in the area - you should consider alternatives who have better food, better service and a more pleasing environment - don't waste your money on this place.

7_06Ann-VZHZ4B7urZlmCw.text: Before you look at the stars and don't read on let me tell you I loved El Chorro I went years ago before it shut down and reopened and i yes i was saddened when i came back.  They kept True to the sticky buns and the relish tray (which truly isn't great but i eat it and appreciate it being there because im hungry and with family which is lovely HAHA, also rolls on request, really on request and they are worse than grands, yes i wish i was joking) but really the new place is better in some aspects!  Its huge and really pretty but the food is not good.  I wish it good and hope over time it will be but the food was terrible and ive eaten good food i got duck it was so bad and  their signature fish dish which we were told that the workers came in on their day off to eat "pan seared escolar" was Eh, i would rather get Sea Bass at a good restaurant like Ocean Club.  I didn't go in like someone expecting to get blown away i expected a good Easter dinner based on the fact ive been here before years ago and enjoyed it so i went in expecting the price per dish to be as good as it was, well its not and its sad because the place is pretty and it looks like horses can get married in the back grassy area (check it out, it makes sense).

_EoFeE6B-tobPs56ua3aNQ.text: Since 1984 we have gone to El Chorro for the best drinks with a view and have always loved everything about the charming historic setting.  It has recently been remodeled so we were excited to meet friends there to see the changes.  We should have known there was a "problem" when we pulled into the nearly empty parking lot.  The new bar area is very pretty and the view of the back of Camelback Mtn is still gorgeous.  Unfortunately, the bar menu is extremely limited and quite expensive.  In the past El Chorro was a fun, buzzing place for happy hour, but now the happy hour is limited to pricey watered down drinks and an expensive shrimp cocktail or brisket sandwich. Even the trademark cheese and crackers are gone!  We are so sad to say we will no longer take our out of state visitors to El Chorro.  Very disappointing experience and we will not be back.

xawaVm_p44nV5JZR1cjlKg.text: I was very excited about the re-opening of El Chorro.  I always felt it was a great location that was hampered by a boring menu and a tired looking restaurant.  There is no doubt that the property and build-out was money well spent.  It is a gorgeous restaurant.  It is a shame that they didn't put the same amount of money and effort into training their staff on service and execution.  We ordered the shrimp cocktail and the cheese plate which was $18 for 4 store bought crackers, 2 small, thin pieces of cheese and 4 small, thin slices of salami.  The salads were horrendous - the vegetable chopped salad was a rectangular plate with little rows of potato, celery, carrot, walnuts and cranberries - all totally oversalted and just not appetizing.  The signature steak and onion soup was gelatinous and lukewarm.  (They mistakenly brought the baked potato soup first which had an oatmeal consistency.) And by the way, according to our server we were allowed to order whatever salads we wanted to go with our entrees.  At the end there were upcharges on the bill for the non "house" salads.     We never received rolls or sticky buns (after asking twice) and they finally brought sticky buns out when the entrees were plated.  In addition, we did not have bread and butter plates and the utensils were not replenished.   My friend's $40+ steak was ordered medium rare, yet came out well done.  He ordered no starch so they brought him a plate of carrots!  I ordered "double vegetable" with my chicken instead of starch and I literally had 4 snow peas and 3 green beans on the plate.   My spouse ordered the duck and the side dish it came with was absolutely disgusting - some kind of pomegranate-y starch thing that had a sour taste.   My friend sent the steak back and it came out bloody and rare - and with starch on the plate.  That one was sent back and the chef himself brought out the third one - with starch.  They bought us a round of desserts (the molten cake was cooked through so it was basically a warm brownie) and took the steak off the bill.    I would return for drinks but not for the food.

55S1wvuuCBnBe2pV2xre9g.text: worst brunch on 10/31 i have ever had. ordered eggs benedict with salmon for 18 dollars and received eggs totally uncooked  with canadian bacon. bought to their attention and 20 minutes later received eggs benedict with cold salmon on an non toasted cold muffin. ugh

-y3P65lTO3cOqgzJxVVcAQ.text: Went one spring day w my husband.  We were going to 4-5 different 5star hotels for HH.  Just to taste a little of each.  I highly recommend it This place didn't disappoint.

rVoEMA8QY-OQ6p5iCB_pPw.text: Nice location but that's where it ends. The street sign on Lincoln Dr. would lead you to keep on driving as it looks like a trailer park sign. My Wife and I both said out loud "This can't be it"  Much of the parking lot was dirt which struck me as somewhat odd for a would be "High End" restaurant. I made our reservation 16 days in advance for Valentines day at 6:30 pm. I requested patio seating for our occasion.  We were seated right in front of the entrance to the rear indoor dining area and adjacent to the wait station so it was fairly hectic, (strike one).  For the event it was a restricted menu of selections. Sticky buns were on the table before we ordered which struck me a little odd but after reading reviews I guess it's "Their" thing. Dessert before dinner. Can't imagine filling up on those when a steak costs a small fortune, but hey. I ordered the Tenderloin cooked medium well and my wife had the Chicken. Sides offered were both of the Seafood nature, Lobster Bisque and Crab Salad, (strike two) We passed on both. My Tenderloin came out cold and way undercooked (strike three.)  I didn't want to ruin the Evening by saying anything so I powered through. It was tiny anyhow so it didn't take a lot of effort. My Wife said her Chicken was delicious.  Fast forward to the next morning. We talked about Dinner over coffee and I said be honest, how did you really like the experience? She too said she didn't want to ruin the evening and that's why she said her Chicken was delicious. She stated her Chicken was bland and that she's had better at Carabbas. I told her my Steak was cold. We both commented on the less than stellar table location even with making reservations more than two weeks in advance. Our less than average dinner was right at $200, with nearly a 70 minute drive one way. So a two hour plus round trip disappointment.   Also keep in mind this restaurant is immense, my guess is it seats between 400-450 people as I overheard the wait staff say someone at table 89 (on the patio) needed something. 4 persons at each table, that's 356 people on the patio alone, not including the immense indoor seating as well, so if you were hoping for any special attention or treatment, stay home.  I would also like to comment on one completely tacky maneuver orchestrated by the Valet service. I previously mentioned much of the parking lot is dirt, I had just washed my car and decided to use the Valet Service for $6 as I figured my car would be parked in the paved Valet lot. I was right, they parked it right up front. When we returned my car was no longer in the front. They had moved it to the back to make room for the very expensive/impressive cars like Mercedes, Porsche's, Teslas' I know this because the Valet told me. Designed to impress the guests while they wait for their cars to be pulled up. My nice shiny car  showed up with a layer of dust from being parked in their dirt lot. What really disappoints me is that I put up with that crap AND I gave the guy a $4 tip for bringing me a dirty car! The more I thought about it the madder it made me!!  I almost always read Yelp reviews before I take the leap, but in this case I didn't. Their 3.5 stars and $200 for a dinner for two should have clued me in on the experience but I think I, as well as most others, are captured by the scenery and it's Paradise Valley location, and by default rate the meal higher than it should be.  THOROUGHLY UNDERWHELMING

R3keWn8_NpybGYqWBbrB9Q.text: This is a place that will go down in memory book. Cinnamon buns to die for, lobster corn bisque soup perfectly balanced & seasoned, steak cooked exactly medium rare , lobster mouse in puffed pastry. Our server Robert was great, attentive while not being intrusive. Thank you for a great dining experience

GHgKmK43NvIb52gUwOUxZg.text: Let me say first that the service was outstanding! There was a mix up with my reservation two years ago. Had a reservation booked but then was called that they were closed. Two years ago.  So, Ryan, General Manager, had a note of this and was gracious enough to comp us some delicious sides to go with our outstanding dinner. He came over to our table and apologized about what happened two years ago. Service from Bartendar, waitress,hostess and GM was fantastic. Patio is absolutely beautiful there and the food is delicious. Will always go to El Chorro every time we are in AZ.  PS. Still dreaming of the sticky buns from there

d-unDnq2Ekgqh6jNNfOLkA.text: Beautiful patio and the rest was horrible in a nutshell. We paid $200+ and left unsatisfied. Good for drinks at best.

MGZ7FaAhWnp59HKAYhwOJg.text: One star for the decor. It was empty and that should have been a clue. But, I insisted on my boyfriend taking me. We sat on the patio  just outside the 00 bar area. It was beautiful! But the happy hour food was 0! The fried deviled eggs- nasty! The perfect storm was a nasy storm full of fried shrimp and bottom grade calamari. The sliders wher okay but don't compare to Delux Burger. Unhappy, greased out we spent $60 and now  headed to Tarbel's!

ZaO0Ac0U0Gy7lw10TVTw7w.text: We have been going to El Chorro for over 10 years we are from Chicago.  So when our friends came to visit that was the place we wanted to take them for the beautiful restaurant and view.  Well our/their experience was not very pleasant.  First we were the first person to walk in the door at 4:00 and we were told we could only sit inside or at the one table outside that seats 18 people, so needless to say we sat at that table.  I explained to hostess that we were just having cocktails and appetizers but she stated all tables were reserved.  Ok so after sitting in the sun on the most uncomfortable seats and after appetizers and cocktails we decided we would like to have more food so we wanted dinner.  I went to the hostess and was told we could not get a table.  So mind you the restaurant had many many tables empty all the while we were there (3 hours). So we asked to speak to manager (my husband would not eat dinner at that uncomfortable table/chair) the manager came over and could care less, he stated they had reservations and there is nothing he could do and walked away.  My friends hated the attitude of staff and we were very embarrassed, all these empty tables and we could not enjoy a meal.  So not sure if I can get my friends back there, not a good experience.  Very disappointed.  Well as instructed I did call and did email without any response.

KvSsj3AodR1RInc4n38i9g.text: Amazing place for dinner. Great relaxed atmosphere and beautiful views. Food was amazing. Went with the trout. Wine list is lengthy and full of delicious wines. Highly recommend for family dinner, date night or just for a fancy night out!

SYRWRJg3coGSga1-pu8Tbw.text: The food here is mediocre at best. We went for brunch, and the eggs are spongy and horrible. They taste like they were cracked a week ago. I'm not sure why older establishments cannot keep up with the times. The manager should go to Matt's Big Breakfast to see what fresh food tastes like. The service was just as bad as the food. A few people had requests, I.e medium cooked poached eggs, etc. None of it was honored; it seemed like the waitress didn't even bother to write anything down. I ordered an omelette and specified gluten free (the menu says to specify). It showed up with an English muffin right on top. But I don't think that was the only gluten because fast forward an hour and I'm sick. Perhaps the potatoes or the pork filling in the omelette. Perhaps if the manager reads this, he will get a clue.
