The two stars is only for the beautiful patio and decent coffee.

XOtslJEVUo7iq58OvVbWRw.text: Sticky buns are very good. Bloody Mary excellent. Wait staff very attentive and friendly. The Cobb salad was nice except the chicken was really tough!  Overall the food was good and the brunch menu had a nice selection. My only complaint is regarding the hostess station.   Extremely rude young brunettes who refused to seat us until our elderly parents came hobbling in. I'm pretty sure in the hospitality industry you learn that making eye contact while considering a patron's presence is important. We had a party of 8 and a reservation. We were not asking for special treatment, just to be seated before the old folks and their walkers and oxygen tanks arrived.   If I'm paying $20 for a salad, I expect not to be treated as though you're doing me a favor by seating my party at our reserved table.

qxcn8aO6so7Ono8EkRN4og.text: Been doing Easter brunch for years. They have progressively gone up in price. This Easter brunch was embarrassing. 60 dollars per person with a very small selection of food out in the sun with lots of flies. Dessert was like something you would get at a hotel conference. Sticky buns are still a stable and very good. Did i mention it was a cheesy buffet (serve yourself) with a 20 per cent tip added. If i want to, great but very rude to put that on tab. Maybe 18 per cent at most. The servers were the saving grace. Very friendly and accommodating. Will not be back next year:(

hmRA5uh6ZLQD6WODs5V6LQ.text: We were invited here for a birthday brunch celebration. A very nice, attractive setting.    The food and service were exceptional. However we sat outside and I was not happy with all of the flies landing on the food, table and us.  If not for the flies, these would be 5 stars.  We started with wonderful sticky buns that were perfect. Not the overly frosted dough balls with too much cinnamon that you can get at the mall.  All of the food was beautifully served family style  Platters of fruit, Caesar salad, eggs Benedict, grilled vegetables that were undercooked, and trout. Followed by a dessert platter  The only weak dish was the grilled vegetables, which should have been blanched for a few minutes so they would be cooked inside before going on the grill.

Qj6TFWPo6nta4sXsx5oV6w.text: The atmosphere here is warm and dreamy, the perfect mountainside setting with just enough rustic Southwest charm. I brought a visiting friend here to experience just that, a scenic retreat with a historic Arizona vibe. We were seated in a cozy nook by a beautiful outdoor fireplace with prime views of Camelback. I hope to return at night in the winter, when I am sure the expansive patio comes alive with the glow from fire and string lights. Our server was very passionate and knowledgeable about the property, and encouraged us to explore the grounds after brunch. Snooping around the hidden patios and original casita might have been the best treat of our visit; except for the sticky bun basket of course, which our server never let run empty!

YNatTjSsLfzqWLIGt9LsIA.text: Stopped in for Happy Hour and was very happy with the overall experience. Great decor, great service, and very fair happy hour prices.  We had the flash fried deviled eggs with candied bacon, the El Churro sticky buns, and the calamari / shrimp with cilantro dip.  All of it was awesome, the shrimp / calamari was .. "Ok" .. But the rest was def amazing and at the level of quality expected.  Can't wait to come back for dinner and try that menu.

-itNGj6o69tIUz85DamPWw.text: My Wife and I continue to come back to El Choro year after year.  We celebrated our 25th Wedding Anniversary with friends at El Choro. It is our favorite place to celebrate !!  Love it !!

jOd4zhWkZ47EQtcodaqJbQ.text: Went here for birthday brunch and it was beautiful and delicious. The server was very nice and friendly, and the food was delicious. We got the smoked salmon with a toasted bagel and capers. I'm from the east coast and have not found a good bagel since I've moved to Arizona 2 years ago, however this one was perfect! Also, the truffle fries were amazing, especially the sauce to dip them in- I highly recommend them. No bottomless mimosas though, but overall a great experience with a wonderful view.

Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. The special, chorizo and eggs with potatoes and salad. The truffle fries were the best part!
Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. Bagel with salmon, cream cheese, and capers salad

6c3k7MkSActopH5999bZDQ.text: Best patio in Scottsdale for sunsets over Camelback! The food here is always top notch and the staff/service is impeccable. The Pork Tenederloin and the Short Ribs are some of the best in town. But whatever I order as main entree I'll always sub Garlic Mashed as my starch.....so good!!

1AnAzNFddRj0GA4Lg4rB8A.text: 5 stars based on happy hour alone. I met up with some friends here the other day so we could all Uber to an event nearby and couldn't pass up the $3 HH wine. The patio bar was beautiful, the HH prices literally can't be beat, and the place seemed to have a great atmosphere. I'm looking forward to coming back when I have a little more time to get a better feel for the place.

q-UkhYafs4UvdCKgo7cafw.text: Atmoshere is a 5  But we ordered 5 beet salads and that was enough beets to feed a village.  Waiter should gave stopped that. The bartenders at such a fab bar should sone knowledge of basic drinks.  I had 2 of the worst rob roys ever !  And they served another person a Manhatten in a highball glass !food was ok.  No stickey buns.

UnLvE6NC2HqMNEAzx5uNwA.text: Yes yes yes ..... I was so sorry I forgot about this place for years .... finally a date took me there a week ago and wow the food on point the outside seating was lovely .... can be very romantic... or there where other tables with groups of people ...check it out

2Ko1ZyOrw4-yxl7aBerJ4A.text: Restaurant week menu was excellent, great food for a great price!  We ordered the Shrimp Pepper Pot as an additional appetizer since it's so popular and it was SO GOOD. You'll be grateful they bring you so much bread with it, you'll want to eat all the broth possible.   French onion soup was a lighter take, no baked cheese covering the soaked bread. I liked this lighter spin, the soup was very flavorful and slightly salty (which I like). The flavors were there even though some of the calories weren't.  The Brussel sprout kale salad was fresh with tons of different textures. It was lightly dressed so all the different ingredients really came through.   The grouper was perfectly cooked, great crunch coating on the outside. It was light, flakey and not fishy at all.   Steak was very well cooked, the mashed potatoes with the sauce were what made this steak/potatoes dish sing.   The desserts were fun, perfect portion size after all the courses. The ginger carrot cake packed a big ginger punch, if you don't like ginger don't order this dish. The salted Carmel ice cream helped ton the ginger down but if you need a break from the ginger avoid the sauce they put on top. The passion fruit chocolate cake was very good, the passion fruit provides a different spin to what typically feels heavy. The bourbon ice cream wasn't over powering, very creamy.   Drinks were delicious. Service was excellent. Atmosphere is relaxing, if the weather is good definitely sit outside.

photos.caption: Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. Brussel Sprouts, Kale &amp; Parmesan
Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. Passion Fruit Chocolate w. Bourbon ice cream
Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. Steak

342DChOe9oBQKY7gaSkVkg.text: We ate here on May 23rd. That was my mother's birthday. Reservations were made two months in advance. We had an awful time, service was spotty, we were told we couldn't take appetizers into the dining room, we were told we couldn't order the sticky buns until menus were up....just stupid things that never happen in a professional restaurant. The food was OK. The menu seemed suited for the 50 & 60 year-olds that seemed to frequent that place. When it came time to getting the cake the waitress was nowhere to be found. Once the cake came we had to wait for candles and finally a lighter was found too.   I have eater in a lot of good restaurants and unfortunately this is not one of them. I won't be back and you should run away.

tsuPF1bolIFZEhwHmCu5HQ.text: Mother's Day brunch yesterday was a huge let down. It was hard to get a reservation to begin with ($75 per person, $25 per person cancellation fee...) Our reservation was at 2:30. We got there on time but weren't seated for 10 minutes. It was raining and the host sat us at a table with no umbrella, luckily she saw the look on our faces and put us under an umbrella. We sat for another 10 or 15 minutes without being greeted. I went up to the host stand where there were about 4 hosts and 2 managers and they were no help. Our server didn't apologize and his service didn't make a come back either. It was buffet style so literally his only job was to keep our drinks full...couldn't even do that. We heard another server explaining the options for brunch, dessert, etc at the buffet...we had to find everything on our own.   We've been coming to El Chorro for years and we've never had good service. We continue to come back because of the food and view. I don't think it's worth it anymore.

6xvc6oENG416QcfqhRhY2Q.text: Note: this is a brunch only review  We went for the first time to El Chorro for Sunday Brunch. It is easily the best food and experience for brunch in Phoenix. Why is this place not discussed more for a top brunch spot in town?!  We had a wonderful experience. Our waiter was very attentive and went above and beyond to ensure our time was enjoyable. He even brought two people in our group blankets because they were cold (we sat outside). 5-Star Service!  We will be back many more times to enjoy the property and amazing food! Just beware that this place is on the expensive side.

photos.caption: Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. Omelette of the Day
Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. Cranberry Orange Steel Cut Oatmeal
Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. Best of Both Worlds Eggs Benedict

7pcttGKeJh6N0hYnpaoWFA.text: Delicious dinner with friends! What a beautiful atmosphere, we started our visit walking the grounds. They have a nice bar. I tasted my husband's margarita, it was really good, not too sweet. My friend and I had the old fashioned, great flavor!  We had dinner reservations, it wasn't too crowded last evening (a Thursday in May) but our friends come here often and always have reservations just in case.  We had their sticky buns (cinnamon rolls) to start as it is a tradition that our friends have. They were good! I was so hungry I ate the whole thing before dinner but my husband and friend saved it for dessert. My husband and I split the Caesar Salad, it was great.  I was torn between ordering the filet and the Sea Bass that was the special. Our waiter Ryan was excellent (our friends had him on their last visit) and he steered me towards the Sea Bass and I was not disappointed. Loved the risotto and the root vegetables. My husband had the Ribeye and he loved it. We were too full for dessert but I bet they are good!  It was a wonderful experience. Our waiter Ryan grew up in Scottsdale and he gave us some recommendations for breakfast today.

2bPGxeNbdOquunzvdmwzRQ.text: I'm writing this review based on the brunch.  This is a lovely restaurant that serves a solid brunch. However, in a city of dozens of other places that also serve brunch, I found the menu to be pretty standard. The food was good as was the bloody mary, though nothing was incredibly remarkable.  I was also here for the happy hour a few months ago. Again, great atmosphere for a bar, but the drink and beer selection could be more diverse.

Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. Tamale with a bloody mary in the background. There&#39;s a sticky bun on the side from the basket that is brought out to your table.

fUgFrXzu-2ipNvG5boqXcw.text: My first rodeo brunch at the very special and unqiue El Charro a must have experence! Checkout the entree Best Of Both Worlds Eggs Benedict you get....one benedict of each, Jumbo lump blue crab cake, tomato salsa hollandaise, petite filet, bearnaise sauce, roasted potatoes! The Mimosas with freshly squeezed OJ super fantastic. The best dessert ever a basket of fresh croissants, light flaky fruit scones and the to die for oh my gosh sticky buns run don't walk. After running you will feel no guilt to eat up the stckly buns and don't forget to ask the awesome staff the history behind the buns!

zbWe2fbmY3k-Wq0g7LXV3w.text: The manager reached out several weeks later and apologized for our experience. Hopefully other families won't have to go through what we went through!

fj0eN-XpTzsuI23OklOfOA.text: The place is surrounded by beautiful mountains Piestewa  Peaks. I only heard about this place because my fiance wanted to get married here because she thought the food would be great here because it's an actual restaurant.  I am so glad we came here to try the food out. I think she is now convinced the food here isn't worth spending 40k for a wedding here.  I guess I came in here with High expectations for the food. I was looking forward to trying the famous sticky buns. Let me tell you it's basically a cinnamon roll but the ones that we had was not fresh and hard. I was expecting it to come out fresh and soft especially since we showed up when they just opened for Happy Hour at 4pm.   Sticky Buns here was a failure. I'd pick Cinnabon any day over this. The shrimp pepper pot looked amazing in the pictures I had to try it. Reality is it was really salty. Ok other thing we tried was the short ribs with mash potatoes and French beans and Carrots. That was probably the best dish of all but it was short ribs how could you really mess that up. I've had similar elsewhere and Beckett's Table has one that's pretty awesome.   So is there a dish here that I have tried that would make me want to come back? Not really. Maybe the scenery for sure above the food.   2 stars for the scenery and service.

u85dYPPynSd3aeHXfztkrA.text: My husband and I had a great experience! What a beautiful property, well maintained and tranquil!  The service was great, the food was delicious! Not to mention the sticky buns that come before the meal! What a treat! A formal dinning set up and experience with some local Phoenix history attached! A must while either visiting PHX or a local resident!

jUgvDlNTSGtkk9Pvx3cS2A.text: Sunday brunch was delicious! We mad a reservation for two and were seated right away. The patio is very large and most tables are covered by large canopies. The serving assistant brought water and the pastry basket right away with two of their famous sticky buns (which are delicious!). We ordered two bloody Maria's, huevos rancheros, and the best of both worlds Benedict. Everything was perfect! Their bloodys cone with prawns in them that are perfectly cooked, the huevos rancheros are stacked on blue and white tortillas, and the Benedict cane with one crab cake and one petit filet. Everything was cooked perfectly and was clearly thought out so that all aspects of the dishes complemented each other. Our server, Jet, was attentive and we lacked for nothing the whole meal. We will definitely be back for another brunch or perhaps dinner.

-QojSPIsk06A4ACZ0Iqlzg.text: This sad establishment has been mismanaged for too long!  They did a remodel a few years back and completely lost its old school charm!  If you're a local (with half a brain) you know to stay away from this tourist trap.  Used to spend many great nights dining, drinking and sometimes dancing on the OLD patio that doesn't exist.  Sadly I'd never return to this place nor would I recommend to anyone I respected.  Shit hole!

6vcsPNRBkzqaZ_CD-aah0Q.text: Great happy hour spot. Expensive.  The views here are absolutely gorgeous, it's a wonderful place to stop and get a drink. I've been here twice now, both times for happy hour. The sticky buns ARE all everyone says they are: ewy goey goodness. The margaritas are served in a tall and skinny glass but are decent, not super strong, but good. For 5$ on HH I'm happy.   As for other food, I've tried the flatbread, it was very tasty. The sliders were good but nothing to write home about-I feel like the wagu beef might be a bit of an overstatement...not everything should be called wagu-you know? The chips and salsa are decent. The best part about this place by far are the views. Service had always been very good and quick. The place really clears out when happy hour ends though.  Tip: there are a lot of family style seating options, so if you hate other people, this place isn't for you! Casual vibes, just don't wear gym clothes and you'll be fine!

Rpz7Aq7JTXg38dVN3sg3FA.text: Went here for a Wedding and was highly impressed with the staff at the Valet to the servers and bartenders...everyone was very helpful and professional. The appetizers and dinner was delicious. This place is huge with 2 weddings going on plus the restaurant was in full swing. They also had heaters everywhere for the cold weather (made the wife happy) now I want to come back again.

photos.caption: Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. Wedding Table

CAZNcIoHPr-wkFxSRrp69w.text: 3 experiences here, one happy hour and 2 celebration dinners, I'll give it to you straight. If you come here during happy hour with the intention of eating off the non-happy hour menu I'd say you're making a mistake...well unless you're not looking to eat a lot of good food and drink good drinks at a fraction of the price. My lady and I made the decision to switch from the formal menu to the much more casual menu by the bar and didn't regret it at all! All the food we tried was great, in perfectly shareable portions, and the drinks were cheap and good (what else could we could ask for right?). Come here for happy hour...especially if the weather permits sitting outside. Both dinners I've had here were delicious. The crab & tuna dynamite and shrimp pepper pot are a great way to start your meal here...also must I mention the sticky buns? The food is pretty good. But, honestly the only reason I'm giving 4 stars is because I haven't had anything on the menu yet that salivates my mouth just thinking about it. Don't get me wrong though, I foresee myself adding a star in the near future but not quite yet. Aside from the eats, the service is always great. Our servers are always humorous, personable, and do a great job. El Chorro is mastering the holy trinity of dining with great food, great service, and a wonderful atmosphere.

photos.caption: Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. Any chocoholics dream...2 please.
Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. Old Fashioned Broaster Fried Chicken*...the picture says it all.
Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. Seasonal Wild Salmon. Thick, fresh, and packed with flavor.

hncEkpiZxlY5yTsr6vsHig.text: I love, love, LOVE this place.    The setting is quintessential Scottsdale (western, warm and super comfy), yet, it's not over the top and it's also chic and lively...  The food is scrumptious ~ from the salads which are huge to the calories be damned fried chicken, it's all yummmmmmy.   Last, the service is always perfect.    My fav place.

photos.caption: Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States

VZx8I5M4IEos2XLfZhjTnA.text: A fantastic and outdoor sensory experience. Brought a guest from Europe who was simply stunned by the food, service, setting and views. I requested that we be seated by the outdoor fireplace and that is exactly we here we got seated. Wine recommendation was spot on, as was desert. With summer in the rear view mirror, winter outside dining was a perfect setting. A wonderful night at a superb restaurant. We will be back.

q1NOVMT6yDp_dtkR-gEbqQ.text: It's been some time since coming here but wanted to take my fiance somewhere nice for his birthday so I decided this would be the place to go. We enjoyed the atmosphere so much and the staff was friendly and provided excellent service. Food was great and we ordered off the happy hour menu. The margarita is a must try! Honestly, you can't go wrong with anything on the menu. Highly recommend this gem of a place.

Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. Beautiful atmosphere

GkA3BJtf3dCL0qXfrKAP6A.text: We went there yesterday for happy hour.It was ok.  The drinks were watered down,  the veggie hummus dish was ridiculously small. After 3 appetizers, we were still starving. I mean who serves 2 fish tacos. 99% of restaurants give 3 of everything not 2.  Last call should not end at 615 when happy hour specials end at 630.  Wont be back!!

3GerRhPPzpTM5x5Y1oue5w.text: Came here this weekend with a group of friends to celebrate a special occasion. We all uber-ed and had a reservation, so I can't speak on wait time or valet. I was surprised to see how beautiful the restaurant is. I've driven by too many times to count, but never got a glimpse past the front gate. The landscaping is gorgeous, and I liked that the decor wasn't over the top.  My meal was short, since I personally arrived a little late. But we had a large group, and our server was wonderful. I had a side Caesar salad as a starter, and the Beef Stroganoff as my entree. I love Caesar salads, and this one certainly satisfied. On to the Beef Stroganoff...It was slightly saltier than I would have preferred, but it didn't take away from the overall quality. Prices seem to be a little steep for the amount of food, but I didn't feel totally robbed after.  All in all, I would recommend checking the place out. I've heard the happy hour is great.

w_5TFtFWHeWhvxIDY7wV2g.text: WEDDINGS BEWARE!!! So we have been in contact with the wedding coordination group since January 17th 2012, planning our wedding from away as we live in Ohio, letting them know our plans to be out in AZ the last week in March and planned on getting together to discuss in person. When we got there, the girl in particular was very stand offish and by NO MEANS put a personal touch on the planning. She stood on the patio and pointed where we'd be at for our wedding and did not even have the courtesy to go down to the lawn to show us options for rehearsal and set up. We asked if we could decorate, and we got the comment of "you can decorate a little, very minimal, but NOTHING that would distract our dinner guests" SO...it is very apparent that they care more about disturbing their guests that people planning for their ceremony. We actually had additional people there and received comments from them saying "It felt as if you needed to be careful to fit into their world and to be sure not to inconvenience them" Already bothered by this, we decided to still go through with it has we had exchanged 20+ emails with them, and thought we were in to deep as it was. When we received the contact, there was a 100% PRICE INCREASE!! I immediately emailed them back ad received the "amount of effort, set-up and landscaping costs we incur.  We had some issues at the start of the year that have caused us to raise our pricing.  And we reserve the right to increase pricing" I abruptly asked" in the 20+ emails you could not have let us know this" and we got the ever so nice response of ".  We communicate with hundreds of people each day and we cannot keep track of who has the most current information if it's something we emailed a while ago" REALLY?? REALLY?? Needless to say I was threw with them, and decided to take our wedding party elsewhere. PLEASE feel free to get ahold of me and I will tell you a location where PEOPLE ACTUALLY CARE!!

mWwFXgtoWvQ1EWgFST6UuQ.text: Great breakfast / brunch spot.  The setting, service and food are top notch. Prices may be $1-3 more  per entree than other breakfast spots but well worth it.  The sticky buns are unmatched.  Menu has plenty of solid choices and both adults' and childrens' meals were tasty (and our kids are tough judges).  The service is pleasant, prompt and classy (Houston's caliber.)  Another important breakfast barometer, coffee quality.  Again, A+.   Decor is old school AZ in a high-end though unpretentious way.  Parking is ample with optional valet.  We'll be back here soon and often.

Fy1Wa1kE2SdzfP_bZ5XWyA.text: Took the madre here for Mother's Day brunch and let me tell you, you have not LIVED until you've had brunch here... holy deliciousness! The sticky buns were enough in the first 10 seconds of sitting down to keep me glued to my seat for the next year. Between the four of us we had Bloody Mary's and Mimosas, all of which were tasty. The Eggs Benedict was perfect, brioche french toast was like a dessert, the dessert table had small portions of every bit of yummy sweet goodness you can imagine, and everything in between was great (I thought my husband was going to have to roll me out of there!). This is officially my new favorite brunch place, and my family agrees. Our server was great, and on a day we expected it to be overly crowded and busy, they managed the crowd and buffet food perfectly. The outside patio was so nice, even when it was over 100 outside, thanks to the abundance of shade and misters. Thanks for an awesome experience!

LFKRt6V7wsOntGLpauM3Cw.text: We had an issue with our reservation when we first arrived (only reason for a 4 star rating) which was quickly corrected after speaking with a manager.  After that the night was fantastic.  The food was outstanding, the wine was perfect, and one of the best service experiences I have ever had.  Our server was Warner and he was outstanding.  Make sure you ask for him, I know we will when we return.  The entertainment and dancing was also a nice touch.  A perfect evening!

TG3lOFO7BzK3YPqajTUe6A.text: The new, old El Chorro Lodge has been reopened for all of two days, and a friend of a friend managed to secure a reservation during their soft opening, so I got an opportunity to check it out. I was impressed, but not blown away. Everything I tasted was quite competent, but if I had to choose a word to describe the menu, I would suggest "staid." Perhaps even "stodgy," but that may be more harsh than I intend. Review the dinner menu. bit.ly/aWqVVJ. There, see what I mean? Replete with Traditional American entrees and sides, at what I would consider fairly exorbitant prices. I would say that I wouldn't go back to eat this food at these prices, unless someone else was paying. I should note that a big part of why I wasn't impressed is because this place is simply not my style. The wait staff, attired in khakis and blue shirts, was a little too informal for the prices we were paying, I felt. The menu options were a little boring for my taste. The cocktail menu is exactly not what I'm looking for these days, although I will be very interested to see what Happy Hour looks like. The decor is a tad heavy on the Old Southwest theme, although to be fair, this place not only pulls it off rather stylishly but also is among the most authentically old and southwestern establishments in the Phoenix metro area. The patio and open bar are fantastic. The bar area is considerable, and the patio is palatial - up above Lincoln Dr enough to be fairly quiet, with a gorgeous view of Camelback, sunset here must be incredible. Anyway, back to the food. Everything was very well executed, from the sticky buns we were served upon being seated to the desserts we ordered. I chose the soup of the day to start, a tomato/basil concoction that was quite hearty and thoroughly enjoyed it. The salads my dining companions ate looked boring to me, but they all claimed them to be excellent, with "the best Caesar dressing ever" and "polenta croutons?!?" being the verdict for the Caesar salad, at least. On to the entrees. I ordered the crispy duck, which I found to be delicious and quite hearty, though not what I would call crispy by any means. It was a very sizable portion, and very well prepared. My dining companions ordered the pork chop, the lamb, and the salmon, and we each sampled from each other's plates. I would try the lamb if I went back, but the consensus seemed to be that everything was very well prepared, with the duck being a winner. It was served with a heap of mushy sweet potatoes (just like my mom makes at Thanksgiving - delicious!) and red cabbage, which I sampled and declined to finish. Again, not quite my style. We moved on to dessert - sticky bread pudding with a bourbon glaze and the warm chocolate cake. The bread pudding was a winner at the first two or three bites, but grew one-dimensional as I continued nibbling at it. The chocolate cake was decadent, among the best I've ever tasted. It was clearly made with a considerable amount of dark chocolate, which seals the deal for me. And in case you were wondering, my dining companions apparently have no stamina when it comes to dessert. Suckers. Anyway, as I've said now several times, this place is just not quite me. It's totally classy and very high in quality, but not quite adventurous enough for my taste. I'd love to come back for brunch, and once they unveil their happy hour menu, I'm sure I'll be back to check it out, but I won't be back for dinner unless I can convince someone else to pick up the check at the end of the evening. As a side note, this place is so very Paradise Valley. It's a welcome relief knowing that there is a place that is so anti-scene out there. It's been a little while since I've been both the youngest and among the poorest in a room, and I will say it was a little comforting. Just don't tell the Scottsdale people about this place, and we'll all be happy.

jUYYZRZTx05h2Z39UAXeZw.text: We went for dinner right at sunset and there is not a more beautiful spot in PV.  The steak and onion soup was delicious and the 6oz filet came cooked to med rare perfection.  Patio heaters everywhere to supplement the 5-6 fireplaces kept us comfortable on a chilly evening.  We will go back for drinks as the lounge was busy  with patrons and live music.  The only knock was the server was pushing items like we were at chili's on "get rid of the meatloaf night".  Casual dress, dirt parking lot, nice crowd, all make for a classy evening.

n7VmosiUDxMkSKJsf03Pcg.text: We had dinner at El Chorro as a part of their soft opening.  The restaurant looks terrific and still has the ambiance of one of the grand old dames of Phoenix restaurants.  The menu is well suited for the stature of the restaurant.  Classic meals including duck, steak, lamb chops, pork chops and fish.  The food is good but not quite at the point of being terrific or memorable.  It will continue to satisfy the long time customers of this restaurant.  If you want a good solid meal where everyone will like something El Chorro continues to fill the bill.  I hope that as they settle in to their second life that some of those nuanced flavors that Chef Kassels was famous for in Santa Fe can emerge so that El Chorro is not just brunch on Sundays and special occassions but also a wonderfully, memorable meal.

uTO1GDtswZAzEe_cRjnnLw.text: On  Saturday, April 25th, my wife and I had dinner at El Chorro.  We had the Chateaubriand for two.  It was excellent, and the service was as well, other than it took a very long time to get our food.  This was due to the fact that, unfortunately, the power in the kitchen went out during our dinner.  On top of the delay in receiving our meal, we did not get dessert.  While many patrons that night were not charged for their meals, we paid for ours in full and left a generous tip.  We were told at the reception desk upon leaving that El Chorro would contact us about dessert.  No one did.  Finally my wife called the restaurant on October 1st and spoke with the general manager, Ryan.  He needs professional development in customer service.  He displayed an uncaring attitude about the fact our experience at dinner on April 25th was less than perfect.  He even told my wife that he didn't know what she expected him to do about the fact we did not get dessert, since the power outage was out of El Chorro's control.  Finally Ryan relented and said he would send us a gift card for our dessert.  It arrived - $10.  Really?  Each dessert probably costs $10.  So he sent us a gift card for one dessert.  The better approach would have been to actually care that a customer had a less than satisfactory experience, or at least act like you cared.  Maybe even discount the dinner we already paid for, or offer a free return dining experience at El Chorro.  But no, Ryan had attitude during the entire conversation and then sent us one (1) $10 gift card.  That's how he took care of the fact we got no dessert after paying over $200 for dinner.  Again, sign up for the next seminar on customer service that you can, Ryan.

_v-IaXOTJDQM_eOzyq2arw.text: All I have to say is STICKY BUNS! I went to the El Chorro Lodge for the first time last Sunday for brunch. Outstanding! Great service, beautiful location and tasty food. I will certainly be going there again for brunch. I would like to try El Chorro for drinks or dinner. It looks to be a very happening spot.

PuVUg6rpOfQRcLt84fCDzA.text: I have been dining at El Chorro Lodge since 1974. El Chorro Lodge is a family favorite. When Joe and Evie announced there retirement and selling of El Chorro, I am grateful Mrs. Dorrance saved El Chorro from turning into Paradise Valley's next luxury home subdivision.   First and foremost, the renovations to El Chorro are fantastic! The patios have been enlarged to take advantage of the great views of Camelback Mountain, numerous fireplaces added to add to the ambiance and the charm of El Chorro preserved in the process. Kudos to the designers for saving the copper hood of the fireplace in the old dining room and relocating it to the renovated schoolroom bar! (One sad note, miss the "Knights of the Round Table" table that was next to old fireplace on the old main patio. Its now a service area, but time marches on!)   The entire of the new restaurant speaks of old Arizona, but in a fresh and modern way. Photos and art work of happy times at the Old El Chorro decorate the walls and is a gracious nod to the past.   The cocktail menu has been expand, and a second bar has been added with great views of Camelback Mountain. This is a terrific place to grab an old school martini or try one of their handcrafted cocktails.   Our dinner was graced with the old relish tray, served on a cold plate instead of chipped ice. (Chipped ice would have been a nicer presentation.)   Appetizers include the standard shrimp cocktail, flash fried lobster tail and new additions. Soup of the day or salad is included with the dinner entree, which is a nice touch in an ala carte world.   My girlfriend enjoyed the filet, which was tender and cooked to perfection. I enjoyed the duck breast, which was flavorful, tender and not overcooked.   Just two notes for improvements, I don't know what happened to the original recipes for the flash-fried lobster batter or the sticky buns, but please, please look for them! Some classic items just do not need improvement! Also, $5 for valet parking, please.

jNoktJZB1tIrm7Q95b-d7A.text: I have been coming here since 1975, when our company would have our monthly breakfast forecast meetings here.  I heard it re-opened and wanted it to come and compare it with the original.  I figured if it was almost as good, it would be pretty nice. First, the minuses.  It is overpriced.  The menu did not have the shad roe and eggs that it was somewhat known for.  The sticky rolls were nice, but they hardly gave you enough. I started out with the Cobb Salad.  There were very fresh ingredients on the salad and the ingredients were seperated so you could mix as you wish.  The dressing was Green Goddess or some form of  and it was on the side and very nice.  I also had a taste of the Eggs Benedict at the table.  This was another signature dish and did not disappoint.  El Chorro to was known for the best Eggs Benedict on the planet for years. The atmosphere here is second to none.  The view of the mountains from the patio is tremendous from the old Spanish surrounding.   I highly reccomend this restaurant to anyone.

70PNSfjwetd-Yr-O9pksuQ.text: I went to El Chorro's around 6 pm with my wife and a friend from Chicago this past Saturday and will never go back there again. The host claimed that there were no tables available and that we would have to sit at the bar. We counted more than twenty open tables when we arrived and the same number when we left approximately 1.5 hours later. The food and drinks were ok and our waitperson was good, but overall, a very unpleasant experience.

Zs4pDx8pnE2KIvxhjzbTug.text: This place was designed for the perfect Saturday.  There is a mix of old and new with most of the same charms from prior to the renovation.  I'm sure the dinner menu tastes as yummy as it looks, but with their bar menu and the bocce ball court, I'm not sure why you'd ever sit down to eat!  Chowing down on their burger in between bocce ball throws, sipping a super refreshing, perfect-for-summer cocktail, and staring at some of the best views in Phoenix is the way to experience El Chorro Lodge.  This place is great for everyone: big groups, a romantic dinner, a place to eat while the kids run on the grass, or a dinner with a client.

DRc_c3IL0LzEE3enEi3k2Q.text: Our family made the mistake of dining here on Thanksgiving. Everything from the table to the food to the clueless and absent waiter was outright below average and certainly no where near the kind of restaurant described in the other reviews (which I wonder now if were written by the owner or manager). What a disappointing holiday.

4R-n_i7dVcUxL9VVIwQmuQ.text: Wonderful view of Camelback Mountain.  One of the reasons I love this restaurant is the ambience, whether your with a group of friends sitting by one of the fire pits outside or on a romantic date for two this place is sure to please.  1) you have a great view, 2) the wine selection is impressive, 3) the food will tingle your taste buds.  What better way to enjoy dinner than outside by the fire, with a great view.  There service is on point, their serves are educated about the food and their lengthy wine list.

9oSpkKhkPQeYSfw0WlGa2A.text: The views from the patio are amazing! We came here for brunch and the food was great! I especially loved the bread basket! Service was great with no complaints!

wRxn2BeZNQ37ENrpSBw4Jg.text: BEWARE OF BAD SERVER named Angei.  (6) of us attempted to have a nice meal at El Chorro last night to kick off the first day of Arizona Restaurant Week.  This was my second visit to El Chorro and the first for everyone else.  Our server Angei appeared to be in her first hour of being employed as a server and kicked off the worst night of dining in my life by being completely clueless about Gluten allergies (my sister-in-law has a Gluten allergy).  The restaurant week menu specifically stated that there were Gluten-free options.  When we asked which options were Gluten-free she had no idea what was Gluten-free on the restaurant week menu or the regular  Gluten-free menu.   We sent her off to the kitchen to in quire about the Gluten-free option.  She came back to our table twice more in the next (20) minutes with no answer other than "We were told the only Gluten-free option was the vegetarian pasta."   She actually had the nerve to ask us what would be in their own dishes that would contain Gluten.  How on earth are we to know how they prepare the menu.  She claimed that she had spoken to the chef but she obviously made that story up.  After these (2) attempts we finally demanded that she send a manager to our table.  (10) minutes later the manager arrived armed with the Gluten-free menu for El Chorro to help eliminate the confusion.  As he learned from us the confusion was on the part of Angei who had never brought us a Gluten-free menu even though we looked it up on the restaurant's own website and showed her this evidence on our iPhones.  She claimed the Gluten-free status must have been a misprint.  By this point we are now (45) minutes into the dining experience and just placing our order.  Fast forward another (45) minutes and after a combined hour and a half our young children are now starving and fussy because they are tired of sitting in a restaurant.   My wife and the (2) young children had to leave before the first course even arrived.  When departing my wife went to the front hostess and complained about the poor quality of the service and asked a manager to look into this.  No one ever came by to check on us the balance of evening.  Had they done so we would have shared our experience with them in vivid detail.  We then had everything thereafter boxed table side because Angei stated it was too difficult for the kitchen to box up the courses for my wife.  Even that process was difficult to communicate as we had to remind her to bring additional boxes and tell her it would be inadvisable to place a scoop of ice cream in a cardboard box with a hot piece of chocolate cake that we would attempt to rush to my wife (at home starving with two young kids) 30 minutes away.  Before the main course arrived she came to the table bearing news that they were out of the dessert feature we had ordered and told us they had a chocolate torte (which turned out to be a chocolate lava cake) and then asked which dessert we would like to choose.  We didn't have a choice but the torte so why ask us which option we prefer.  Torte or nothing?  When we finally received dessert my sister-in-law with the Gluten allergy thought she would enjoy the ice cream only on her dessert plate only to find that whatever utensil had been used to dish the ice cream had been previously used to dish something with a cake or cookie consistency thereby cross-contaminating Gluten into her ice cream which will most likely make her very ill in the upcoming hours.    Angei had (3) tables.  (2) were 2-tops and ours was a 6-top that became a 3-top.  Every single request (water, soda, etc.) took (10) minutes minimum to be fulfilled.  Our table was collecting spent plates, glasses, etc. that never left our sight.  The simplest of instructions seemed to be received as complex to Angei as diffusing a bomb.  We repeated our requests and answered her questions more than once on several occasions.  At the end of the night we requested that my brother and his wife have a separate check than my family only to be told that they did not have that ability but if we told her how much to put on each credit card she could do that.  She didn't seem to understand that was the same exact outcome with the only difference being that we would be responsible for sitting at the table and calculating our own bills.  The food was very good from first course to dessert but the service was the worst I have received in my life.  This individual should have been set free in a sit down restaurant where the meals were $5.00 on average.  Instead we averaged $50.00 per person and could have received better service from the bus boys.  I know that this is probably the first real weekend for the outdoor patio seating at El Chorro which looks like it doubles their capacity so perhaps Angei is one of the new players on the team, but it is completely unacceptable that any patrons, particularly first time visitors during restaurant week, be treated to sub-par service like this.

_TsfaJEdwNIuCDuaEIN3tA.text: I saw this restaurant on "Check Please" which is a local show on Channel 8 which reviews 3 restaurants on every episode. The food looked really good and I love restaurants with a nice patio and a lot of history, so I thought this place would be a hit. We went there for brunch and the patio was really nice with a great view of Cammelback Mountain. The food was the biggest disappointment. The prices are really high, which I don't mind if the food is worth the price, yet that wasn't the case here. I had the Cobb Salad and the chicken was cold and it was just okay. I was expecting more out of a $15 salad. (FYI - Charleston's Cobb Salad is a-mazing and cheaper!) They also give you a "bread" basket before your entrees come out, and it's more like a "dessert" basket which is cool but the scones and sticky buns were just okay. My fiance had a breakfast burrito which was huge but it wasn't anything to get excited about. Our waiter was pretty stale too... and it had the pretentious Scottsdale vibe to it.

gl0hmjTNLymLrXhUv5CDZQ.text: El Chorro is a classic. It has the best patio in Scottsdale with great views of Camelback mountain. In March the smell of the orange blossoms fills the air and combined with the spectacular weather makes for an amazing atmosphere. The bar area is great and opens onto the patio so even if you go just for drinks, it will ge a great time.

teaqtB1KGD26RyHe7QQRqA.text: Ordered brisket beef sandwich - inedible, stringy and fatty. BLT salad small for $7 and very average. Would not return

85k81Ztc0GeFLgyMgxHa0w.text: Have been to  El Chorro's many times in the past but always outdoors or at the bar. Went with good friends on Xmas Eve and had some of the worst service ever. It's not like they don't know what to expect on a holiday. Everyone had a reservation and the menu was fixed. Nevertheless, the service was painfully slow (we were there over 3 hours). They made numerous mistakes. They couldn't keep our wine or water glasses full. They even claimed to have run out of potatoes. Really!?  You're a Phoenix icon; not a fly by night franchise. Get it together.

M1upv_JGwcpTRLJOGpkaTQ.text: We had brunch at El Chorro today and it was wonderful. The patio was comfortable with the umbrellas and heaters. The service was outstanding. The food was delicious. I had the creme brulee french toast - it was carb/sugar heaven. Everyone else enjoyed their food. The eggs benedict came out perfect. The BLT looked awesome. The fries were delicious. We will definitely be back.

hi6A79fRLRfZuk0dh3fA0w.text: I ate at El Chorro during restaurant week back in the fall! It was absolutely amazing! Just the right size portions as well! I was excited to try some new restaurants during Restaurant Week and I cant wait til next year so I can try some more new ones! I loved the cinnamon sticky buns as well! It was quite a surprise to get that before our meal as well, and they were super tasty! I loved the ambiance of the restaurant as well and the patio seemed very nice too.

BXNkHgh2mkEOxXOV2uGOow.text: Good Sunday brunch! A little pricey but you get a ton of food and it's good. We enjoyed "the chicken and the egg skillet " and the yogurt and granola parfait. The cinnamon rolls are yummy too. We also enjoyed cappuccino. They have a lovely outdoor seating area which would be great when cooler.

cVywZs-IR0UdLqk7byXkhQ.text: Went here for St. Patty's day and loved it! Absolutely beautiful outside, reminds me of Barcelona or Seville. The food is New American Cuisine! It was delicious. I ordered a house salad that was very fresh with chick peas, croutons, and a nice balsamic dressing. I had a veggie burger for my entree that did not fall apart like at some places. The veggie burger was very good as were my fries. They have wonderful desserts too. I was too stuffed to eat the dessert but did have a taste of what my friends ordered which  was some type of  cake with carmel. The service was excellent too. They were busy that night and they did a wonderful job at making me feel welcome. The decor inside is very fun too.

dA7QkrWzRz1-iXQQKHkYbA.text: Hosted a party for 16 people at the restaurant. It was a great time, the food was tasty and the staff was very attentive. Definitely would recommend this place.

ms5VXGyo7zrAedtA9JX4-g.text: My daughter's wedding was there recently. I can't say enough about how helpful Lindsey was in the planning and the Service staff was UNBELIEVABLE. Jim, the Captain, was very helpful the whole evening and made suggestions along the way so I didn't have to think too much.  Everything was perfect.  I highly recommend you check them out if you are considering outdoor venues.  You may pay a bit more, but it cuts down the number of vendors you have to deal with and that is worth it -  Lisa

2BIiZFHsV28QGcNFZMbgnA.text: A Phoenix tradition sine 1930 so how bad can it be????   Outstanding sticky buns and wonderful outdoor seating with plenty of umbrellas and heaters along with views of Camelback mtn.  couple of items they have  changed that they need to change back.  bring back the relish tray and put the french fried lobster back on the menu as an entree and not as an appetizer served as lobster  fried nuggets.  Places come and go in Phoenix but there is comfort in the tradition of El Choro.

x3EtODAeqFEsnNhlgYW4hw.text: This place was great a few years ago but has really gone down hill since coming under the new ownership. Not worth the drive or the price anymore

AR2tyJtavlxR8Yv__RvDjQ.text: Great location with a fantastic happy hour. Most reviews focus on the sticky buns but what beats a 2.75 Stella in a frosty mug?

BCUSajens0hQY4R5yxKOeQ.text: El Chorro Lodge is not the place to go for cutting-edge cuisine to tickle your tastebuds, but exactly the right place to go when you want to entertain friends with a unique Arizona experience and no risk of disappointment.  You will find great southwestern atmosphere, a beautiful patio, good service, pleasant outdoor service with great views of the mountains, plenty of  good food for fussy eaters, and lots of history.  And sticky buns.  You won't find uniquely southwestern food, just traditional American fare.

DMFapL9DxlmSHK0NT18cOg.text: Went to El Chorro last night for dinner with my boyfriend and my mom that is visiting from out of town. I have been SO excited to try this restaurant since moving here, but was sadly disappointed.  The waiter we had seemed as if he had better things to do and was rushing us the entire time. When I come to a restaurant like this with prices like El Chorro I expect the staff to be patient and able to appreciate the process of "fine dining". He would ask a question and then before you could answer would start to walk away that I had to call after him for a glass if wine. Water glasses were refilled once the entire meal and he didn't take the opportunities to add on to any of the orders. The meal: For dinner we had the Filets and the spare ribs. The filets were cooked well (medium rare) and were tasty. My boyfriend felt his was something we could have made at home in our Crock Pot, so that was disappointing for the price.  When the food came out we realized the waiter had ordered 3 filets and the short ribs  (for three people??) that we then had to wait another 10 minutes at the end of the meal for the opportunity to flag him down to remove the extra meal (that the food runner had said he was going to take off since he showed up with four meals).   Lastly, at the end of our meal we were told only the special dessert option, when asked if he had other options he acted again very annoyed but got menus and returned. We ordered two Strawberry shortcakes and the brownie sundae. Again, as he started rushing away after hearing the food options we had to call out to him to ask if they had coffee. I thought the offer of coffee and/or tea was pretty standard at any restaurant.... But who knows! The shortcake came out with a nice presentation, but the lack of strawberries for a strawberry shortcake was mind boggling!! So it was like 5 slices of strawberries and strawberry syrup which also does not represent their description of "fresh strawberries". The brownie was good, though as my boyfriend said, "it's hard to mess up a brownie."  Needless to say I was very disappointed with this place and will not be back. The food was alright but the service or lack there of doesn't make the price worth it!

aS6mV8o4snC4n_W6ncNvcQ.text: The parking lot here is a dirt lot. Keep that in mind ladies when you're picking out your shoes. There is a beautiful fountain as you walk into the courtyard (minus the yard) which is made up of two large patios. We chose to sit outside even though it was still quite warm out because the atmosphere and view outside was much more appealing. They have live music set up on the patio that is to your right as you walk in so if you want a bit more of a quiet atmosphere sit on the patio along Lincoln Rd.   After we ordered they came out with a relish tray, which consisted of cold olives, radishes, broccoli, cauliflower, celery sticks, carrot sticks and some peppers. The sticky buns were brought out at the same time and were pretty good, but quickly got a bit hard and were almost inedible. We both had a French onion soup which had pieces of steak in it as our starter. It was pretty good, but after I noticed a couple of patrons with the house salad I wished I had ordered that instead. For diner Mike had the pepper crusted sirloin with frites and I had the pork chop with a green chile risotto and green beans. The servings were pretty big so we were definitely not leaving here hungry.  However, nothing really stood out about our meals. Mike commented that he couldn't even taste the pepper on the steak and that the steak was pretty bland. He immediately asked our waiter for some A-1. My pork chop was pretty good. It came with a salsa relish on top. If it wasn't for the salsa my dish would have been pretty bland for the most part as well. The risotto was ok. Lastly for dessert we both had the chocolate cake with ice cream. The cake was a little rich for me so I had trouble finishing it, but it was pretty good.   The food was ok. However, it's not worth the regular price.  For restaurant week it was a decent deal. The service was great. Our water glasses were constantly being filled and plates taken away in a timely manner.   Skip dinner here and come and enjoy happy hour at their outside bar and partake in the amazing view.

qC09olk27FUl6_-XvJ848A.text: I've been here quite a few times, most recently I went with a friend when her dad was in town and I was very impressed with the remodel.  The huge outdoor/indoor bar area is very nice with beautiful furniture and delicious cocktails to choose from.  I don't remember which we ordered but they were all amazing.  We then went to our table after a short wait and you feel like youre at some amazing hotel sitting outside, relaxing, with a live band playing and people slowly joining the dance floor (hilarious to watch by the way...good people watching).  We ordered an assortment of dishes -- some vegetables, some mashed potato thing, and I think I got some kind of fish.  It's been a few months, but all I remember was the atmosphere, the food, and the drinks all being wonderful.

T18D3By3Youv3_LNEMqa0w.text: Great spot. The complete remodel made major improvements. I recommend planning a patio night to drink in front of one of the many outdoor fireplaces

OEKJfuVeDlnSlLTjhWdxlQ.text: El Charro is one of the most beautiful restaurants in the valley, but sadly the food is sub par. I ordered the breakfast burrito and it was mostly a tough, chewy, gummy tortilla with dry scrambled flavorless eggs inside. There was some dry stringy mystery meat inside. Ate about one fourth of it. Thank God for the sticky buns or it would have been a total loss.

hyrYPcUrCALqgPiOqzCYmA.text: We dined at El Chorro on a rainy night so we did valet mainly for the umbrella. I was told by the greeter to leave it at the front door and upon returning it was gone. We were seated right next to a leaky roof with a constant patter, very distracting.  As they staff tried to fix the issue right in the middle of dinner service. Service was very slow as servers are busy with big parties that are also saeted in the main dining. I was charged for 2 soft drinks when all I did was switch from the flat 7up to coke, and they brought me diet and we had to flag down the server to get it switched. Apps. were great and the sticky buns good. I ordered the strougnouff and it was full of onions which was not in the menu description.  For 30$, it did not live up to its expectations.  Finally, we were served dessert with dirty dishes still on our table but all we could do was stare at it as utensils were MIA.  Overall, very disappointed!!

dWJ_vtf0up8NWU9LMMUiwA.text: Service was a little slow, but the food was really good. The scalloped potatoes that came with the filet were awesome. Plus the sticky buns were really good.  The view of Camelback Mountain from out table was pretty awesome also.

FlXeu_XNFjVyGkB6wu4D3Q.text: My husband and I recently visited El Chorro and it was by far one of the best dinning experiences we have had. We previously had made reservations a few weeks back for the South Patio. From the moment we arrived the front desk staff up to the Management were extremely professional and friendly. We ordered the pan roasted giant shrimp for our appetizer and the seasonal wild salmon and short ribs for our entrees. They were delicious!! We especially enjoyed the sticky buns. El Chorro has the most beautiful patio dining and friendly staff, and we look forward to coming back soon.

Rvig8wns61-uVK7onmagGw.text: I went to El Chorro last Thursday night for the first time since Joe Miller sold the restaurant and I was disappointed with my food but it was only one meal and I never will condemn a restaurant from one meal. However, if you are looking for atmosphere of Paradise Valley then it is a great spot to go especially now that the snowbirds are back in town.

-1f5V1AQYpiimfaV9_vKSg.text: Great restaurant and bar that has been in Paradise Valley for many years. I have gone there ever since it was a kid. Great happy hour incredible views attentive staff and good food

3h1XQYdpY70YRQo-GxgNrQ.text: For my birthday, I found myself struggling between a favorite standby-restaurant or somewhere new... I'm so glad I gave my boyfriend the go-ahead to surprise me with a new place because I was blown away by El Chorro!  We had a rather late meal with some of our best friends visiting us from out of town, making our reservations for around 8PM. When we arrived, the ambiance was already set with twinkling lights, roaring outdoor fires and a beautiful patio. It was brisk and I'd forgotten my coat, but upon being seated, I realized that heaters were keeping the patio quite warm. (Hooray!)  To start, we shared the sausage platter (which was AWESOME) and a shrimp pepper pot. They were each wonderful, and we finished them both! The sausages were my favorite, particularly with the great artisanal mustards they include. We caught up over a bottle of wine, ordered our meals and were surprised when we suddenly got a big basket of sticky buns! (We had no idea that the place was famous for these - we sort of thought someone else's dessert had been dropped off at our table!)  When we were sure they were ours, we dug in and they were phenomenal! A little strange to have between the appetizer and meal because they seem so dessert'y, but who am I to turn down sweet pastries? (Umm, bring it on!) We asked our waiter about the sticky buns, and he gave us the most interesting back story about the restaurant, the Marlboro man and some elephants that he trained using the sticky buns! I have no idea how much of it was True, but it was entertaining and made the restaurant's staple even more enjoyable!  For my main course, I had a seafood pasta that was out of this WORLD. Seriously, if you're a shellfish lover, this is the way to go. It was -awesome-. Our server was kind enough to even bring out a small birthday dessert, which we all shared (and still couldn't finish, as we were so full!) All in all, the food was 5-star, the ambiance 5-star, and the night couldn't have been better! It was the perfect evening with some great friends - thanks, El Chorro!

photos.caption: Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. A birthday treat, courtesy of the very kind staff!
Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. The seafood pasta was a shellfish lover&#39;s dream!! Filling, flavorful, and a little less pink than the lighting makes it look!

hKoCmiuxORu_cScIiHbTrg.text: We had a superb dinner at El Charro with a lovely view of Camelback Mountain. Our server, Joe, was attentive but not overwhelming. The food and service were perfect.

cz_RVKJyNf7bbqIwm7D53w.text: Rather disappointing so, it is a Saturday night at 8pm and they are out of multiple menu items and the menu is already lacking appeal as is. I tried the chicken and it was ok, nothing great. My friend had the beef short ribs which he claimed tasted like a TV dinner. We all laughed and said he was being dramatic...that is until we tried it and realized that it was dry and tasted like a Salisbury steak. The outside patio was nice but def not worthy of a 4 star yelp rating. We should've known better since we called in at 5pm that night and we're still able to get an 8:00 reservation. There are def better eatery options in the area.

3OWqztmcXJv9BhbEcW5hPg.text: Beautiful place.  It's like the neighborhood joint for PV.  Service was very good and wines priced decently. The sticky buns are just small cinnamon rolls. Organic Caesar salad was great, the rest of the food was wedding food like and that's about it.  Mandatory 20% gratuity for a party of two though, pretty ridiculous.    Prob one and done.

Xyu3Eb2yIf2KG9mS_ZV4OQ.text: I wanted to take my daughter to brunch for her birthday.  My dentist actually recommended El Chorro.  It was wonderful!  The scenery is beautiful.  The food is perfect!  The sticky buns are incredible! And they treat all customers the same.  We love catching Sunday brunch with El Chorro!  It's a regular for us now!

CixfIgYkH86BjE8x-UfASw.text: We dined at El Chorro Saturday early evening.  From the staff who greeted us kindly at the door to our server Nate who made spot-on recommendations to Sean the General Manager who treated us as though we were VIPs, we couldn't have enjoyed it more.   Started with a moderately priced bottle of The Prisoner red wine that was velvety but not sweet or too tart.  Then those delicious rolls!  The house salad was fresh and crisp and the dressing an indescribable delight of bright grapefruit and buttery garlic. Our entrees were Scottish Salmon cooked perfectly on a bed of orzo and corn.  Also had the braised shortribs ( a house specialty and deservedly so), heirloom tomatos, broasted chicken that our friend said was the most amazing combination of juicy meat and crispy exterior, and the vegetarian dish with polenta and eggplant that our vegan friend found perfect for her palate.  Desserts - a blueberry handpie, the beet ginger cake as light and airy as Nate said it was, and my favorite, chocolate mousse that was a melange of chocolate flavors and textures that allowed the flavor and not the sugar to shine. All in all, a terrific experience that we plan to repeat.  Thanks for a great night, El Chorro!

53Zu6g4e7MZ6IMl39LtlyQ.text: Amazing food! I have crazy food allergies and the chef was unbelievable with everything! Not only was the food perfect but the cocktails were great too!! I ate with a party of 20+ and they loved the food and made me a separate meal for my allergies! THANK YOU!!

aHjsIYWCAPS57jncu3tYIg.text: Alisha was a pleasure to be around. She gave great service and a happy smile:) delicious food and drinks!!! The cinnamon rolls will have me coming back soon!

SAHW8AE53Ca4jkT3GCuKKA.text: Excellent meal, great service, awesome ambience. Overall fantastic experience at El Chorro. Staff was friendly, helpful and attentive. So many great options on the menu it's hard to go wrong. We had the tuna, house salad, and beef stroganoff - all outstanding. Sticky buns are to die for! Would absolutely come back!

MMbsJhXKLJNthaHhCpzoQA.text: What a great place for happy hour! Still not cheap but very reasonable. For 3 of us the bill was $61 + tax/tip. That included a craft drink and a draft beer not on the happy hour menu. And we didn't go away hungry by any means. We had poutine, fried shrimp, crispy chicken livers (2), vegetables w/ hummus, crispy cheese curds, beef sliders, and 3 glasses of wine. Happy hour seating is limited and was pretty much packed while we were there. The facility is beautiful. The service was very good. I would like to go back for brunch, while not inexpensive it would be a good chance to experience a different part of the restaurant. As a majority of the seating seems to be outside, spring and fall would seem to be the best time to visit.

w34Jqcew8OfssxogiZogaw.text: One of our top ten meals ever.  Fabulous food, service and a beautiful setting.  Would go back anytime in the Scottsdale area.

photos.caption: Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States

mU03eJeBPc6FgzPD5mZmpg.text: First visit...And we will be back... The location is North on Cave Creek road... Lovely, rustic cowboy Arizona feel, small but nice bar.. ..Cozy feel in the indoor restaurant...Reasonable priced drinks..Made very well...I had a Prickly pear berry margarita...Yummy!  Tonight I had the Salmon..Served on Spaghetti squash.....So, so, so good...I will definitely go back to sample other items on the menu...A must to visit...Very good experience....Can't wait to sit outside on the patio in the summer...

XK3al9NYCQwvs7xULMzOCw.text: The place has such potential as it is a beautiful location.  The building is clean and seems to be newly renovated, the landscaping is perfect for the desert.  That unfortunately is where the great feeling for El Charro ends.    The bartender was short tempered and didn't seem to like people or her job.  We all seemed like an inconvenience.  She preferred to huddle with the other servers and chat rather than serve drinks.    The food was mediocre.  I had the burrata and tomato salad.  It is prime tomato season and they were flavorless and underripe.  I was surprised they were served.  The truffle fries were something I would expect to see from a Chili's or TGI Friday's; covered in grated cheese.  The rest of the meal followed suit.  The plates were expensive for the quality which was lacking.      The front desk staff was friendly.  The flowers on the patio were nice and the local art on the walls was fun.   These few things will not compel me to return.

c_CdAtYYAJNSy3ToSXwbuw.text: We were here for my best friend's wedding, and the location and quality throughout the experience did not disappoint!

HMZhhSGSjEVi1cSio9jkPA.text: Best swordfish I ever had and surprised because of the location! Will be back for sure!

x0jo5MR71CwiXMiimXUmTw.text: Great setting, good food, terrible customer service.  There was six of us enjoying happy hour on the patio when we were joined by a friend with a very small dog, 5lbs tops, that she was holding. As soon as she ordered her drink, the manager, Ryan (very rude person) came over and asked for the dog's papers. If the dog isn't a service dog with papers then she could not stay. Seriously??? It's a patio at 4:30 in the afternoon. He insisted we leave.  When we asked that her drink ( which she never had the opportunity to enjoy) be taken off the bill, his response was "I can't do that". Of course he can do that, he's the manager.  He shouldn't be!!  Needless to say, we won't be back!!

hQ1gfekJ1vHy8rnA4KqnWg.text: This will be my first Yelp review ever! That's how awful this food was! I have never been to a place where all 6 people hated their meal! If I could give this place ZERO stars.... I would! I entertain people all over the valley. The worst food I have ever had in my life at a "nice restaurant". Unequivocally, I have had better steak at chain restaurants. I'm pretty sure they serve instant potatoes.... Seriously! DO NOT GO HERE! I was EMBARRASSED to take my wife here on our anniversary dinner with close friends.   On a positive note the sticky buns were great! The patio is amazing. However, I do not go to restaurants for cinnamon rolls. You will be better off going to Outback Steakhouse, or eat a strangers Applebee's leftovers. It's not like the food was cooked incorrectly. The food was just so bland and repulsive!  Go to Rockerji or Mastros!   I'm legitimately sad to have wasted money and calories on their food!

4_XpZd2bgL_u2YQBqKEFRw.text: took freinds for there first visit. they loved it. they started out with fantastic tomatoes with fresh burrata. shrimp cocktail also amazing. they had beef stroganoff, fantastic, we had outstanding grouper. food was great, but also service was great with kayla.

Gn77xV1MZOMxVRZ7K8OWFQ.text: Spectacular!!! The food, the drinks, the service! WOW!!! We started off with the Shrimp Pepper Pot & the Three Sausage plate. Delicious! We all had the filet and we were all very happy! Yum!!! We thought the menu was a bit limited, but the location & feel of the restaurant is truly amazing!

jOQf8uKoqtd4kPNGrm88xg.text: Back to being mediocre.  Go for a drink and a shrimp cocktail and be happy you are in such a beautiful setting with less than average food.  Really a shame to botch Beef Stroganoff, shrimp in mystery sauce, and even the Caesar Salad was bad.  We live across the street and were invited to go....we wouldn't go unless it was an invite for a special occasion.  To many better restaurants to go just for the beautiful view.  We have it all the time!  Bad food is not tolerable, even if the ambience is magnificent.

5ON1FCa9XHGZz59xhL_R0A.text: Always A+++. Amazing drinks with even better views. The summer does eliminate the wonderful outdoor seating, however the interior is beautiful a cross between ranch and yacht. Try the staycation drink, and expect to have only one...holy moly is it strong. Can't go wrong with anything on the menu but personal favs are the farmers chopped salad, the pork tenderloin and a must is the gooey caramel cake. The sticky buns, what they are known for come as the bread!  Enjoy!!

photos.caption: Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States

--bthTcCdXtnr8uRBpHdWA.text: I have so many wonderful feelings, and delicious experiences at el choreographed. So much that we are actually planning our wedding here ! From their sticky buns to jalepeno polenta, melt in your mouth short rib and buttery goodness lamb... Your experience will be outstanding every time.

A-FyGA4EC7krcoSK7WtUjQ.text: We came to El Chorro to celebrate my boyfriend's birthday and it was amazing! We sat on the patio next to a fireplace - very romantic. I had the trout almondine and the boy had the filet - YUM! The service was attentive and friendly,  the birthday dessert was delicious and enough to share. If you get a chance, try the Gin Rickey cocktail - almost too easy to drink ;) We can't wait to come back!

eAkPX_rg-MvDQzMT-cqCdg.text: I could not love the ambiance of a restaurant more. Sit at the bar and the view of Camelback Mountain is spectacular (hope it stays that way after the redevelopment of Mountain Shadows). Was there a few weeks ago on 4th of July. Enjoyed the 5-6:30 pm Happy Hour drink & food specials. Talked to the bartender about some of the history of the restaurant, very cool. I decided to give El Chorro 5 stars, even though I was disappointed in their dry slider buns. It's just too cool a place not to give it 5. Other beautiful restaurants/resorts in the area should take note and also offer awesome happy hours. I love it and will be going back as often as I can.

KMd96nPrS3oc6g7Ls0n-5Q.text: Service was great they got us a table outside. Vicki our server was great. Has the sausage and the shrimp appetizers very nice. My son and I both had the ahi Tuna - his was perfect mine was cooked perfectly but was cold as was the rice so I sent it back - then a rude person ( manager?) brought out my new one and it was way over cooked - probably took mine back and put it in the microwave- she indicated "heres your hot ahi and were not going to charge you" hey charge me just bring what I ordered ...anyway I didn't want to send it back again as the others at my table were almost done... My wife's Trout was superb. I would try it again but when I'm dropping $500 for dinner for 5 with wine I expect good service and good food - don't do me any favors by not charging me for first cold then way overlooked ahi.. Everyone but the person who brought my second plate out was nice - she should stay in back.

Dnoej8Zco5nUw3ZD1wtG7A.text: Not many restaurants can have guests wait for an hour and a half for their food and still get a 4/5 five star rating!   Walking into the restaurant I instantly feel in love with the atmosphere. While spending time in Arizona the last thing I want to do is eat inside, therefore all of the open outside seating was perfect. Our waiter, John was absolutely amazing. He had character that kept us laughing, was very knowledge about the restaurant (both the menu items and the history) and handled the delay in our food very well (the kitchen was understaffed). For dinner I enjoyed the seasoned wild salmon (with steamed asparagus instead of rice) and my tastebuds went crazy. The company I shared the meal with enjoyed the wedge salad, Cobb salad, stroganoff and the soup of the day (clam chowder). The wedge salad was even noted to be the best wedge salad she had ever eaten! Though our waiter John handled the 1.5 delay on our food with poise and class, it was disappointing when there was not any deduction to our bill for the lengthy wait. Regardless, the food and atmosphere was amazing and I would return.

fLwbShD_yq2_mRaNHqLIPw.text: Food and service were excellent! Went for brunch and were not disappointed. Sat on the patio and the view of camelback mountain were spectacular

ydTk1LAL1GS0aghEof_ZhA.text: I was there with a very large group of friends and they assigned a rookie waiter who had no clue what he was doing. Not his fault I blame the management.  Poor guy had no help with as big as our party was even applebees would have two waiters helping out. Our drinks were always empty steaks came out cold, baked potatoes where brought out after meals were finished. I complained to the manager and he said he would bring out complimentary desserts he said he would cover the table.  We waited and only four desserts came out when there was 12 of us.  extra plates and silverware was brought out until later. Then he left and didn't leave any thing to serve it with. O and did I mention the steak sucked its usually really good here but not today not impressed at all!

EdXvvH-ZDJ6O28sY56CUBA.text: Before I came here, I reserved a table for a family of 5 and when I called I asked if they allowed dogs and the lady said "YES" let me repeat that... "YES". So when I got there with my family we were about to be seated until this scumbag 20 year old douchebag came up to us and said "There's no way you can bring that dog in" and I said well the lady said I could bring a dog. And keep in mind that this is a small 10 pound harmless dog. Then the guy looked at us like it was our fault and we did something wrong. It wasn't our fault, it was the 20 year old idiot lady that didn't know the policy. Then they kicked us out and we spent an hour and a half looking for another restaurant. After that, we couldn't find any more places that didn't have crazy drunk people so we ended up going back to the resort. After an hour and a half of driving, we didn't want to eat anymore so we had to starve until we had airplane food at 4:00 AM. I wish I could've gave this 0 stars. This restaurant is just filled with a bunch of idiots that don't have brains. They didn't even apologize to us. So because of those stupid douche bags, our last day of vacation was ruined. THANKS EL CHORO

0ilf_me9KRQBmDesE2ufOg.text: Christina from Huntington Beach was Awesome!! Happy hour was great, we loved the atmosphere..our first time in Scottsdale and at El Chorro..it won't be the last!

W0-jk0Kbb81l4Sb9jVklFA.text: We have been to El Chorro many times. They are on the pricey side but usually worth every dollar spent. However, this visit was a little shock to us. We requested a table in front of the fireplace and were told the table is reserved for birthdays and anniversaries. Ok. We were fine with that.  A little strange since there were very few people in the restaurant but we understood their policy. It was when we asked for plain rolls that we were taken back. The waitress was professional and very kind and explained there was a $7.00 up charge for "plain" rolls. El Chorro is famous for their stickey rolls. We said that was fine but the more I thought about it, the more this disturbs me. Really, a charge for different (and plain to boot) for 4 rolls. You do the math. This is not about money, it is about charging for a change in roll preference. Really shocking and disappointing that a restaurant of this caliber would need to charge for such a small thing. Maybe they could re-evaluate this decision.  With so many great restaurants in the valley to choose from, we are thinking it will be a long time to return since they need to charge for such a small request.

dQM7hPd1B25z8AKiBVHI2A.text: A Russian Roulette experience. My wife has breast cancer, and we met friends there before surgery to make the night less scary for us. We chose El Chorro from great past experiences.   Not this time. We ate on the patio, starting with happy hour. Service started out OK, and deteriorated. This was not a busy night. Midweek, not crowded. Our waitress pretty much disappeared. Food and drinks took forever to get out, we had to ask others to get our server or help us.   One diner ordered the duck, the duck was raw. I finally got the hostess to find someone to take away this mass of bloody flesh from the poor woman who had to stare at it and smell it.    I called to complain the next day, spoke with the manager. He listened, said he would have the manager responsible call me. Have still not received a call.   Go at your own risk. You might have great service or you might have this. This trip was so bad it completely ruined my previous great review of El Chorro. I won't be going back.

N7hhbwrPwXWau8rXUkD9Xg.text: I been only once, the place is beautiful & our waiter took really good care of us.  However  I felt the menu (we did brunch) was limited & they could not do special requests, I wanted to make changes to the omelet listed on the menu but was told the chef did not like that.

H6WqQRipEdMqVCXCGN2bYg.text: What an amazing meal! Entire place is redone and it looks amazing. I usually go for brunch but we decided the whole family would go for dinner. We started with the shrimp pot, shrimp cocktail, sausage plate, and chicken livers... All were really great but the entrees made the starters seem underwhelming because they were so well done. I highly recommend the wild caught salmon, the trout almandine and the pork tenderloin, those were table favorites!

VfBX-Xf0dOIAwIDk3yaf2Q.text: Came to an event which allowed me to get the private dining experience.  Food was incredible, and service was outstanding.  Very nice outside patio ambiance.  Lots of room for people, but still managed to keep the intimate feel.

p5rMVXEG7sct-Q1Hp_jx5w.text: BEST BRUNCH IN PHOENIX HANDS-DOWN! Went here with a group of girls after church. We had the best view (A-MAZING Patio) and the service was excellent.
