The Eggs Benedict was fabulous but what really stole the show were the free sticky-buns! The mimosas were a bit pricey- but they were so delectable, I had multiple!  I can't wait to go back with my family sometime soon!

oZfetngvfV0X3vX_zWs5yg.text: El Chorro gets 5 stars just because it is an amazing venue. Very relaxed but fun. The crowd is a bit older but that decor and layout make up for that. Tons of outdoor dining and cocktails areas! And a great wine selection. The staff was also amazing!!!

XQEXzukrF13ww3GB7FNW1A.text: Went here on vacation for the view and the ambiance. Extremely pleased at the atmosphere and the food quality was excellent. There is nothing like sitting on the patio and watching the sky change colors. The Sea Bass was cooked to perfection and the filet had a good flavor (not like a steak house, but good).  If you like wine they have a decent selection.

a_IWhIQJI-6Ytjb5_XCDUw.text: Went here for a belated mothers day celebration. Loved it! Had two delicious signature cocktails, a lemon drop martini and a spiced rum old fashioned. Had the mussels to start, a mozzarella salad and then the pork tenderloin. It was all so good, I will absolutely come back again.  My server John was amazing with his wine knowledge. I wish I had had enough room for dessert but there's always next time!

0tU01wxr6sz5WltzCs_bNQ.text: Visited Sep 2014. Unfortunately we went on a rainy day so couldn't enjoy the patio. Happy hour menu had a variety of choices that pleased our group, namely the fried liver.   Portions are large and food was good. No complaints. Didn't really blow me away but I will be back for happy hour.

rWWdnbwNBKY099tiqou3EA.text: I had one the the best Kale Salads of my life here. Probably because it was covered in candied walnuts, dried cranberries, and several other non-kale items  Because of the huge salad, I ended up eating the half order of lamb chops, which also tasted great.  They were cooked a perfect medium rare and did not have the gamey taste that I've been disappointed with at other places.  Sitting outside at night made the ambience a bit too romantic, since it was just me and fellow coworker eating. Also made it hard to take pics of my food :P

photos.caption: Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. Kale salad (too dark outside to get a good pic :( )
Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. Half order of lamb chops

VZq7mpZfyvup9dY1-PPIew.text: Came in here with two out of town friends for my girlfriends birthday. We decided to try something new and after reading a few reviews decided it couldnt hurt.  We were directed to a nice table by one of the fireplaces and our server couldn't have been nicer. We had a later reservation on a Sunday and were the last table there, but never felt rushed.  The food was excellent. Everything that came out received a thumbs up, including the famous sticky buns. I had a pork tenderloin that was perfectly cooked, and no one said much we were all too busy eating!  Will be back again for sure

dmPYZVqll1-3vr4m7OkdCA.text: This was my first time here. Service was great. We had the truffle fries, beet salad, house salad and the seafood pasta. All the food was excellent. Portions are not huge, but just the right amount. With the free cinnamon rolls we enjoyed every bit!!!

_9_O1kHaJUihh_IkDI8Cjw.text: One of my favs in the world.  Go, sit outside and enjoy the basics done amazingly well and creatively.

c2hBllocCFUh3DdZOXWOuQ.text: Sticky buns...I repeat...ooey gooey sticky buns, with a soft dough interior and cinnamon running throughout, they are divine (and to top it off free!).  Greeting you at breakfast, lunch, or dinner, is a basket of these infamous sticky buns.    After filling up on these buns, we had the omelette of the day (ham and cheese with assorted grilled veggies) and the canadian bacon eggs benedict. - Omelette 3.5/5: fluffy, light eggs with lots of cheese but little on the fillings. Cost- $16 - Eggs benedict 4/5: egg perfectly cooked and still runny, sauce was light and flavorful.  Cost- $18  Weekend Brunch menu has small plates, salads, sandwiches/burgers, and about 8-9 breakfast options.    The restaurant setting is breath-taking.  Outdoor patio with lamp heaters and fireplaces, wraps for women who are cold, and Echo Mountain as the backdrop...could you ask for anything more?!  Summary: Would I bring friends here: YES.  Would I come back: YES for special occasions but not on a weekly basis because of the price.

photos.caption: Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. canadian bacon eggs benedict
Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. omelette of the day
Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. the basket of goodness- sticky buns, chocolate scone, almond/apple pastry

0H0vsXvlc-g8KXqi6X0XrA.text: Fantastic setting!!!  Food is excellent, and great first class service.  Love sitting on their patio for brunches and enjoying the serene scenery.

iS9_Zp2lBw0gwiayapWuWw.text: Stop It...  Just STOP!!!  The first thing they bring to the table is a basket of Sweet Cinnamon Rolls  and they were moist and DELICIOUS!!! Had the pleasure of going here for dinner last night with our Awesome neighbor and a new friend.  I had the Salmon, my husband had the Opa fish and they were both really good!!!  We had lobster macaroni, scallop potatoes, and spinach for sides. Everything was soooo Yummy!!!

EZ2LVGp0_RobetXQ-D4EHg.text: We loved the outdoor dining experience! Heaters kept us comfortable.  The fires and fairy lights were very atmospheric, and the staff were friendly.  They have a great wine selection, and the food was enjoyable.  We had a great experience, and hope to be back soon!

QrigRPQ44SDTpUkXy_qgvA.text: Wonderful atmosphere, not as rustic as used to be, modernised quite a bit but still with Southwest charm! Very nice indoor outdoor bar and really nice patio area, and the food and service was great.  I give 4.5 stars and a shout out to our waiter Brent! We had chateaubriand for 2, perfectly cooked medium rare and good wine and desert ( peanut butter pie) as well! The classic sticky cinnamon roll for appetizer was awesome!  Live music would have made it a 5!!

photos.caption: Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. Entryway to El Chorro!  Wonderful atmosphere and food! First time we&#39;ve been there in like 5 or 6 years..

7HziwJW1fMzAXSGGq981Ew.text: This has always been one of my favorite restaurants in the Valley. It reflects the feeling of Old Phoenix and it makes you feel like you are visiting your friend's beautiful southwestern estate. Plus, I could probably eat a dozen of their sticky buns in one sitting. When we were planning the wedding and looking for a rehearsal dinner location, we immediately thought of El Chorro.   They have multiple areas for private parties, the atmosphere is lovely, the restaurant has a lot of character and the backdrop is just stunning with the restaurant being nestled against the north side of Camelback Mountain. El Chorro lived up to expectations! We had about 40 guests attend the rehearsal dinner and we had a combination of an indoor and outdoor event. They set up several tables with nice linens outside while twinkle lights light up the area. We also had the indoor area that had dark wooden paneling and felt like a beautiful southwestern home.   The servers were friendly, the drinks flowed and the food was simply phenomenal. We had a buffet style set-up with a combination of Mexican food, a meat station, a slider station and french fries! It was elegant comfort food at its finest. I personally think that this is one of the best (if not the best) locations for a rehearsal dinner!

Hx5aexFZu6mTfxgaZPzISQ.text: Thanksgiving Day.  Party of two.  Turkey, stuffing and mashed potatoes all served cold.  Service slow.  $65 per person was way too much for what it turned out to be.  And they automatically added a 20% tip and then asked for more.

U04u7Ujg5WdwLvX8fVpe8w.text: I had an amazing birthday dinner here. I am still craving the sticky buns which they bring you before your meal. The food was amazing the service was also excellent. I will definitely be back for another special occasion! The food took a while to come out but our server was apologetic.

HwY2bvj1AFAroRINlxnvyA.text: My wife and I took my sons to El Chorro last night for dinner. They are both college football players and full time students so our chances to get together with them is are rare. We were first introduce to El Chorro by my parents 30 years ago and it is our favorite resultant in Arizona and we have been accused by some of traveling from Chicago to Phoenix just to have dinner.   The night was awesome! The restaurant was packed as usual and we had a 8 pm reservation. We were seated on the patio which we requested at 7;50. Our waiter Leo was awesome! He was super knowledgable about the menu and anticipated our every need. Our food as usual was outstanding. As a starter we had the shrimp pepper pot, outstanding. For our second course we ordered four different items for a good sampling. We had a bowl of New England Clam Chowder, wedge salad, tomato salad and the beet salad. We sent back 4 clean plates. Next the sticky buns, Epic!! As our main course my wife had the short rib with mustard seed infused whipped potatoes, I had the beef stroganoff and my sons each had the New York Strip steak. Everything was perfect from presentation to temperature. Again we sent back for clean plates. The dining experience was capped off with one more round of sticky buns for the men while my wife enjoyed the strawberry shortcake.   El Chorro is a True 5 star dining experience in a beautiful spotless setting and receives my highest recommendation.

photos.caption: Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. My wife after another wonderful experience on the patio at El Chorro.

4A00qnkxorxjBwxv-cv8pQ.text: Dinner on patio with friends on March 19 was a first class experience in all respects.  The grounds were beautiful, the weather spectacular and the delicious cuisine paired with flawless service completed the package. Julia ( from Philly), our server , was quite personable and very knowledgeable on the menu, wine pairings and the history of the property. We will request her when we return to this restaurant. (Even though we live 300 miles away)   I had the locavore beet salad with goat cheese - beautiful presentation and delicious. Entree was halibut with Pasilla chili-lime beurre blanc sauce - show stopper.   Finished our meal with an expertly prepared cappuccino and a walk around the grounds and appreciated the historical photographs.

SSHrgtU2Kd5OsstTYio1wg.text: You must try Happy Hour at El Chorro. The drinks are great, and so is the food offered. I had Wine (which by the way for a house wine it was really good) . I ordered the sliders that came with a load of fries really delicious. Not to mention the wait staff was so obliging and friendly.  The view was breathtaking,, since Camelback mountain is right at your front door. Great evening out,, and the bill??? very reasonable.  Trust me try this place,, you will love it.  I will be going back for Dinner very soon,,,maybe I will include the Happy Hour as well.

Z68BGZps0yT-cwPcEnhoHw.text: Came here last weekend for my boyfriends & his dad's birthdays & it was great! The ambience of the whole place was really nice, its tucked away in paradise valley, north of Camelback. I wish it was warmer outside so that we could have sat on the patio. We started with the raved about sticky buns, SO. GOOD. We got them as an app but I would recommend them for dessert :) but then again, I would eat them whenever, they were that good. Then for my main course, I got the salmon, my boyfriend and his dad split the Chateaubriand for two & his mom got the pork. Everyone was very satisfied with everything. I would definitely come back here. It is a little pricey so I would save it for a special occasion :)

nweh_DzBp3rFSG3WR_ydBQ.text: Forget  this  brunch  on a special day. Mother's Day was a disaster. Seated  in a  back patio,  so could have been  anywhere. No view,  no music. Had  to ask for extra umbrella 3  times.  The food was  more than forgettable.  Eggs  Benedict on an English Muffin that could  not  be cut with a steak knife,  chicken tenders totally dried up and inedible.Bus persons left dirty dishes on table until they we  asked to have them removed.  And to top it off, American valet parking  which took up all the close spots  so that with a handicapped sticker we were obliged  to pay $5.00 parking  or walk from  back  parking lot. None of it set well, probably  the last time for  this place I used to love. Too many  other places  to choose  from.

f05xH2GyZZRtgUFdi3K1Kg.text: Another awesome evening at El Chorro. Had friends in town from Philly and they couldn't stop raving about the ambiance, food and staff.  Salmon, Seafood Pasta and Pork Tenderloin just to name a few were spectacular.  Of course, the Cheese and Charcuterie platter along with Shriners sausage appetizers, are by far, the best in town. Can't say enough about Ryan and his team. Excellent evening.  Thank you.

cVphX3ELTjyxyY6eY55XOg.text: Great atmosphere and location, very average food, nothing unique or appealing in the menu. Missing orders, dishes missing parts of it, nothing to rave about. Never again.

VpG1P6rYtoPEXegaLlL5Gg.text: They've done a great job of remodeling and making it feel modern, yet still authentically desert-town appropriate.  Last time I was here was in 1998 - I won't forget because I was in town on business and had dinner with my dad, in order to tell him I was pregnant with his grandbaby. It was a favorite restaurant of my dad and step-mom, and they took me there a few times when I came to town. It never made that much of an impression on me...felt a bit tired. Then, when we came to town last month, I was catching up with an old girlfriend who had just moved to Phoenix. She had El Chorro on her list of places to try, so hubby and I decided it would be fun to go with her and invite my dad.  We all had a lovely evening. The waiters were extremely helpful. I got the trout amandine and everyone else ordered some meat things (yeah meat thing names escape me). The trout was absolutely delicious and everyone loved their meals as well. My dad mentioned something about the sticky buns to the waiter at the beginning and they were brought out almost immediately. Strange before dinner...but good.   It's pretty pricey so that would be my biggest hesitation. But for food and atmosphere, I'd definitely return!

IlFbd5s0s3AgEYxSTepPfg.text: The boyfriend surprised me here for my birthday while we were in town.   It has good food, great service and a great view. The place is a little overpriced but I would definitely come back especially for the sticky buns they serve instead of the typical bread!   And we even got to experience our very first sandstorm while we were here too. I would definitely come back if I were in town again.

photos.caption: Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States
Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States
Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States

wXH6b3C9QS_CLAK6kfJaAQ.text: Very disappointing. Was there once 20 yrs ago but thought we would try it again during Restaurant Week. That was a mistake. 1 tb spoon Gorgonzola dressing on the wedge, small thin piece of cold halibut and I thought the dry "Petit Fours" size dessert on the plate was a joke. Wait staff (Nate) was dismissive and added a 20% tip to our ticket for party of two.... joking sarcastically that it was added because we chose the Restaurant Week menu, "but you can double the gratuity if you'd like!" I remember now why I didn't go for 20 yrs. I don't need to go again. Go instead to Capital Grille or to Ocean Prime. You will be much happier and get a MUCH better meal... throughout the year.

xDrVwoiyiP9xLVoBfsuUnA.text: The best service I've ever had, Denise was amazing. Very knowledgeable on menu items and gave great insight into the history of the restaurant and surrounding area, as well as just overall great conversation. The food was equally amazing, with the Michelin chef making incredible organic, from scratch dishes. Will go back every time I'm in Scottsdale.

QV2wRFcS2u8f8HE-8hT53Q.text: The worst service every...unfortunately it came from the manager on duty.  I was part of a group, and had to pay as a group or they would not serve us.  By that I mean, we could not buy a glass of wine for CASH at the bar!!!!!    The MANAGER said, "I mean you are a big group.  And imagine what we would have to do if more groups came??  How would we ever be able to take care of 2 big groups??".    Wait, what?  Are you not a large restaurant?  Don't you have staff, and various cash registers, and lots of glasses?  Ridiculous.  Neither I, nor any of my friends and family will ever go here again.

7QnoKGhy4o7u4xwtNCLc-A.text: My favorite restaurant in Arizona hands down. They won the James Beard Award for a reason! Great food and Service make El Chorro my First Choice for fine dining. When I take friends they all love it and become steady customers. My favorites comfort food is their Beef Stroganoff. Try it, you won't be disappointed.

6kBiUc9yuAOitK8EJc6dsA.text: Between one wedding, one dinner, and one happy hour, I overall really like El Chorro.  With the exception of my happy hour visit, service was impeccable. I don't remember his name, but the waiter I had st my birthday dinner was fantastic.  The happy hour menu is awesome. You could easily leave buzzed and stuffed for under $20. Beware- happy hour is only outside or at the bar.  I think the food is good, but not 5 star worthy. I haven't been blown away by anything I've had (save the glory that are the sticky buns), but the food is solid.   What really makes El Chorro great is the overall atmosphere. The staff are great, the restaurant has a cozy and rustic feel, and the views of Camelback are gorgeous.

OdkUzXO7Q-lFqw9r8f1VLg.text: Beautiful setting, but the food was very average for what you pay. We ordered the sea bass which was bland-veggies we're good. Probably wouldn't go back because there are many other choices in the Scottsdale area with better quality and pricing.

rrWdqFmE4DrDowY3fJroiA.text: Great ambiance, scrumptious food. Pretty sure our waiter was jonesing though, he was really strange about talking to us or not talking to us and didn't offer me a dessert menu but just brought me a white chocolate mousse for my birthday. Guess what, I hate white chocolate. He just said "oh don't worry I have something for you" and brought it out. Last, his hands were totally shaking when he boxed our sticky buns and had really scary dark eyes and would disappear for long periods while we waited for service...

w-hTUsBD2mwIsqcR3sgngw.text: - Beautiful space, great scenery, the outdoor seating when the weather is nice is spectacular - The service is nicely paced and well informed - The food was ok, but not special - The burrata salad had great burrata, but the tomatoes were too firm and had little flavor - The charcuterie board was typical, except for the St. George Brie, which was spectacular.  Extremely fatty with a nice aftertaste - The gluten free menu is somewhat limited, so I had the chicken.  It was tender and savory, but at the end of the day, it was chicken - No gluten free desserts

zWhj2caxUXc1ye9U2uLv-g.text: A really interesting and fine restaurant and very popular and crowded.  This place has a really interesting history, which explains why every table gets a pan of cinnamon rolls.  Before it was a restaurant, it was a board school for young women.  As a way of raising funds, the school offered food to cowboys who were passing through, driving their herds, I suppose.  The cowboys' favorite was their cinnamon rolls, and so they still serve them, and, even though I am not a cowboy, I think they are very good even to eat before or during a meal.  I had the beef short ribs and they were excellent.  Everyone else in our large party seemed to greatly enjoy their food, too.  I do not understand the lower ratings given by some reviewers.

pFlFLvHHyriPr4-SejnlrA.text: My wife and I patronized this place for our 50th Wedding Anniversary!  We could not have picked a better location!  We've been there 2 times before and this time was not to disappoint!  This old established in 1938 Restaurant is elegant in every way possible!   Our Server was extremely helpful and unexpectedly treated us to a compliment desert which we thought was nice!  Located at the base of Camelback Mountain the scenery is second to none!  Go there you won't be disappointed I guarantee you!

KIYPnmqB-qM28vVC3RbfPg.text: One of the best happy hours I've ever had! The outdoor area is beautiful, surrounded by desert landscaping and views of Camelback and Mummy Mountains. The service is friendly and very efficient, with bar and high table set for easy and pleasant socializing. We ordered several items from the happy hour menu: crispy chicken livers, crispy shrimp, southwestern poutine, and crudite with hummus - all excellent and well-paired with the red and white wines I ordered. With such good food and wine (for happy hour, the bites were $5 per dish; wine was $3 a glass) and beautiful surroundings, this place is now my favorite happy hour destination.

photos.caption: Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. Happy hour nibbles: crispy chicken livers, crispy shrimp, southwestern poutine, crudite with hummus.
Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. Outdoor area, Mummy Mountain in the background.
Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. Outdoor area with view of Camelback Mountain

_w67Uhz5sHt2gB_wUEqo-A.text: I was so excited to come to El Chorro on Christmas  Eve with my husband and daughter . I knew it was going to be a little expensive but I was prepared for it. The setting is beautiful and the patio was a great place to have a meal. However, everything about our experience after that was average. Our waitress was nice but did nothing to make our visit memorable  , I think she checked on us once. Our food took a long time to arrive . We ordered the short ribs, salmon and trout. The meal was good but not memorable(for that price I feel  I could have made the same things as good at home ).  We always pick a new place to go on Christmas Eve and in the past we've had meals that we talked about for days: this was not one of them.   Disappointed , definitely not worth the money.

AnnZFQB4YGQfnPPLgZiDsA.text: We had a beautiful Christmas Eve dinner here last night.  I hadn't been to El Chorro in ages and forgot how magical the setting is at night.  Service was outstanding as our special requests were graciously accommodated, even on this busy night.  Our food was first class, especially the crab & tuna dynamite appetizers, the roasted lamb shank, beef stroganoff and crab oscar topped center cut filet.  Cocktails & wine were also excellent.  Unfortunately, there was no room left for dessert, but they looked wonderful!  Ryan was our server and provided incredible service.  Thank you for a wonderful evening!

wCQX9Zipj0G5RPMtJR2-vQ.text: The grounds at El Chorro are delightful. They have a beautiful and relaxing patio. There are a lot of desert plants and trees. The restaurant has been open since about 1937 and there is an interesting history to learn about. The dining rooms are nostalgic of an earlier time in the desert. I ordered Brussel Sprout, Kale & Parmesean Salad.  The salad was quite delicious. It had roasted pepitas, almonds, dried cranberries and a Champagne Vinaigrette. I also ordered a Grilled Petite Filet with Brandied Dianne Sauce. The steak was very flavorful and was accompanied with mashed potatoes and French Green Beans. I picked out a dessert that was a Spiced Chocolate Tart with Espresso Creme Anglaise and Passionfruit sauce. It was very enjoyable.  A friend was with me and also ordered a Petite Fliet. Her steak had a huge chunk of gristle that was fat and two inches long. That is not enjoyable in the steak; especially when it is petite.  I figure the steaks are probably hand cut but in an establishment like this with a hefty price the meal should be perfect.  The manager kept passing by our table and didn't visit our table until he was flagged down. We noticed he visited tables all around the room and even outside on the patio but, it felt like he wanted to avoid our table.  A good manager would be aware of what is happening in the dining room and I would expect he would be proactive to address an issue rather than ignore guests.  I think the price is very expensive and the premium price should be met with premium service and a premium meal too.  We shouldn't be flagging a manager down and hearing the manager make excuses like we did.  I have dinned in other restaurants where the service was exceptional.

photos.caption: Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. Spiced Chocolate Tart
Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. Grilled Petite Filet with Garlic Mashed Potatoes and French Green Beans
Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. Brussel Sprout Kale &amp; Parmesean Salad

yKIvaqguJaE-4fw8U4gGlg.text: What a wonderful date night spot! Nice Mountain View, delicious food and friendly staff. Haven't had a chance to experience the happy hour on the patio but it looks like a fun time!

9hELPiBe9hYoGfL8wqCm3A.text: Came here on a Valentines Day date to check out their 3 course meal.  El Chorro has been since the early 1900's, but became a restaurant fairly recent.  The place is charming and has a historical past with some nostalgic story behind the scene.  It definitely has some history and an Arizonian feel giving you a homey feel.  For our food were treated with their famous sticky buns while we ordered a bottle of wine along with it.  The sticky buns was to me just warm cinnamon roll.  I wasn't too particularly too sure what the rave was but okay.  For starters my date went for the Dungeness Crab salad and I ordered their Potato Leek Veloute.  The crab salad was nothing all too inspiring, it was difficult to find some crab or avocado among the other ingredients of mango, arugula, fennel, and edible flowers; I think if it was larger in size the ingredients would shine, but would have been more of an entree salad by then.  My potato leek soup was probably my favorite of the night.  Nice creamy texture of the potato soup and whipped beets and mild hint of sweetness.  For our entree my date ordered the filet steak and I shot for the sea bass.  The filet was cooked to perfection and came with a peppercorn demi-glace; overall nothing too spectacular, but good.  My sea bass was well seasoned and came with a fun olive citrus sauce, and whole olives that gave it some texture.  Again, well cooked and the olive citrus was cool.  To finish I ordered the Strawberry Scone Shortcake and my partner went for the Oreo Chocolate Cream Tart.    To end, service was on top of things and attentive.  The place is lovely and I can see why it would make a great wedding venue, which it is.  Overall, the food was well seasoned and well cooked, but I guess I wanted more whimsical and fun especially during Valentines Day -- Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States
Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States
Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States

qej89NtOlwHMwv438TfL6Q.text: I went here with my family for Easter brunch. While I was impressed with the food, I was very disappointed with the service.   They offered a great brunch - Eggs Benedict, Bananas Foster French Toast, cheese blintzes, bacon, cheese, meats, salmon, salads - it was great. There was a very nice selection. They also had amazing desserts, like a lemon blueberry cheesecake, colorful cookies, and various other small treats like tarts and cinnamon rolls. The mimosa I ordered was perfect! Just the right amount of OJ to bubbles.   However, our service was awful. Our waitress acted like she couldn't be bothered to come to our table, let alone fill up our waters or get a drink order. I was there for over 45 minutes before someone asked me what I would like to drink besides water. Additionally, when we asked for something, it took FOREVER for it to be brought to the table. I finally gave up trying to order a second mimosa, because I didn't want to wait another hour to get it. And when it came time to pay the bill, our waitress acted like she didn't possibly understand how to split the check. She was very rude and rolled her eyes when we finally convinced her to split it - we just wanted to split it down the middle, nothing fancy. I was really disappointed by that because it was a great experience otherwise, her attitude just ruined it. I will say that the manager walking around was helpful, and without him I don't think we would have gotten any service at all.   For the most part, though, the atmosphere is great. The outside seating was wonderful and the surrounding area is beautiful - it's very green and well kept.

INfpqQCGItbBOSkLRSatBQ.text: THE STICKY BUNS ARE SO GOOD!  Seriously though, my fiance and I went to El Chorro for Sunday brunch this morning and we loved it. The restaurant is beautiful, offering stunning views of Camelback and Mummy Mountain. Dining is available inside, or covered outside seating with portable air conditioners. We chose to dine inside.  When we sat down we were immediately served some fresh sticky buns and croissants. The sticky buns were warm, gooey, and delicious, everything you could want in a sticky bun. We each ordered a mimosa that seemed to be the perfect balance of orange juice and champagne.  My fiance ordered the two eggs for breakfast, which came with bacon, potatoes, and an arugula salad. I ordered the omelette of the day, which was a carne asade omelette with peppers and mushrooms. The omelette also came with potatoes and salad.  Overall we were very pleased with the food and service. The wait staff was super friendly, the front desk was super friendly, we felt at home. El Chorro highly recommended for anyone looking for an upscale brunch experience complete with sticky buns.

photos.caption: Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. Entrance to El Chorro

On08yspDvtSlYTvSX5bWJw.text: Went in for a late night dinner and was received graciously. We sat outside in their beautiful courtyard - one of the nicest outdoor spaces in the area. They are very accommodating with huge outdoor air conditioners and even offered us some natural spray to ward off any possible visiting mosquitos!    I thoroughly enjoyed my order of their corn and lobster bisque and mussels. It was a perfect late night meal along with their amazing sticky buns - of course!  I little dessert before the meal never hurt anyone, I'm guessing and they were scrumptious!

T_FYD9I2wUyzVQ7YqH7neg.text: This review is specifically for Easter Brunch.  Ambience: 5 stars - It really doesn't get any lovelier than El Chorro's patio on a warm spring day Service: 5+++ stars - Seating & flow were planned to perfection, our server & busser were fantastic, the valet was quick and polite. Food: 3.75 stars - What was served was very good, especially the seafood dishes. However, I wasn't a fan of the prime rib; it had nice flavor but was too fatty. I would have enjoyed more variety/healthier options and I was surprised to see very few spring vegetables. Although I'm not a dessert person, there was a wide selection for every palate. Value: 4.5 stars - Brunch prices were more affordable than other restaurants of this caliber, we were happy with what we paid. A complimentary mimosa, bloody mary etc. would've made this a 5 star value.  From the minute you walk up to the tree flanked and blooming entrance, El Chorro just feels like the perfect place for an Easter Brunch. Everyone was dressed in Arizona chic; flowy fabrics and floral colors dominated the day as it approached 90 degrees. Despite the full booking, we were checked in immediately and taken directly to our seats - an outside table as requested, fully shaded by umbrellas.    Right away I was impressed by the attention that had been paid to planning this busy holiday meal. Tables were spaced generously, staff was plentiful, and the buffet was set out in duplicate with multiple entrances and exits.  We never waited for refills or for plates to be cleared, nor did we ever feel rushed.  Our server was warm and personable, she asked my son about his Easter basket and was always on hand for drinks, clean forks, etc.  As we approached the end of the designated brunch hours, buffet dishes were still full and there was no indication that it was time to leave.  My favorite dish was the salmon - delicate, light and lemony. I don't think I've ever had salmon at a buffet where it wasn't dry and overcooked. This was perfection.  Two of the salads were also stand-outs.  The shrimp salad with celery and nuts was creamy without being heavy and filled generously with fresh bay shrimp.  I also enjoyed the interesting slaw with feta, jicama, and some kind of fruit I think? Whatever it was it was bursting with unique, fresh flavor and great texture. The frittata and eggs benedict were also very good if a bit heavy for the heat of the day. As for the bacon - it was delicious.  I know it's hard to mess up bacon but this was thick cut and exceptionally meaty. Yum!    I have to give a special high five to the El Chorro Bloody Mary.  It's spicy, tangy, cool refreshment - and comes with a meal on a stick!  Balancing precariously above the glass, a fresh, gargantuan shrimp takes this cocktail over the top. Along with huge olives and peppers, the "liquid" lunch could be making a comeback at El Chorro.  Overall, I was very impressed with our brunch at El Chorro. The planning and service were top notch and we felt very cared for from start to finish.

photos.caption: Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. Easter Brunch &amp; Bloody Mary

c1R8tX8PaQGog_hsJy1HKA.text: This review is only for happy hour. Monday-Saturday 4pm-6pm  Tips:  Absolutely go for happy hour if you can. All of the happy hour appetizers are only $5.  --------------------------------------------------------------------------------  Fried Chicken Liver $5 - I personally love chicken liver and so I liked this dish! I personally prefer the larger pieces so that you get more of the liver taste rather than the breading taste. The bacon marmalade with it is delicious!  Southwestern Poutine $5 - This appetizer is just some thin fries with cheese and sauce on top. I made the mistake of thinking it would be like Canadian poutine with gravy.  Famous Sticky Buns $5 - You get 4 sticky buns, one sticky bun is about the palm of your hand size. These sticky buns are DELICIOUS, I can see why everyone raves about them so much. They are made with a nice caramel sauce/taste with a good amount of cinnamon spread on the inside of the bun swirls. You cannot come to El Chorro without trying their sticky buns.  Margarita $5 wine $3  I absolutely love the decor and atmosphere here. It is like a country club with amazing outdoor seating which is perfect for Arizona weather. The service is great as well, I had a great time at El Chorro. I would definitely recommend coming for happy hour if you don't want to splurge on the high prices of the dinner size entrees.

photos.caption: Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. Sticky Buns (4)
Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. Southwestern poutine
Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. Southwestern poutine

53xTTppqwVCPZWWw38YAFg.text: Food and service were great.  Had the steak, which was cooked perfectly.  Very upscale and romantic vibe for special occasions.

xvzKFhgcNnTvPx1mLdXU2Q.text: God damn outstanding. If you don't come here then you are an idiot. Service was top notch, food outstanding, couldn't ask for a better meal .... we had filet, trout, lamb shank, & salmon... all beautifully prepared and served. Worth every second to make the  drive  Enjoy!!

UZpy5TPT1LpJPkQNUYgEdA.text: Visited this restaurant for brunch and I had a very creative version of huevos rancheros... delicious!! Beautiful place, ambiance, worth a visit . Service was a little slow.

photos.caption: Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States

VDMNfW9Zqz4tVJfQZ_FQjQ.text: We came here during Restaurant Week for a special family dinner out. The location and facility are beautiful, the food is excellent, and the service was fantastic.   First off, it is brilliant that they include the brunch menu along with the dinner menu. Everyone got excited about the brunch offerings, so I guess we'll have to go back to try that.   Our waiter, Colin, and the other waitstaff were always on it: refilling drinks, clearing plates, and ensuring that everything about our meal was to our liking. We browsed the regular menu, but both my wife and I decided to order off the Restaurant Week menu so that we could try a wide variety of things. The kids both ordered off the kids menu (one had chicken fingers+fries and the other had macaroni and cheese -- nobody said they're adventurous eaters!)  My wife had a beef filet with mashed potatoes and sauteed spinach. She said the steak was cooked well and the potatoes were good, but she did not enjoy the spinach as much. She had a salad to start. I think it was a Caesar. The polenta "croutons" were something different.  To start, I had the soup of the day, which was a green chile stew with pork. It had a bit of spice to it and was FANTASTIC. If that is on the day's menu and you enjoy green chiles, I highly recommend it.  For my main, I ordered the pork tenderloin with bacon risotto and asparagus (see the picture!). Why have more pork right after the pork stew when I could have had beef? Honestly, the bacon risotto hooked me, and it was SO worth it. Creamy, bacon-y and delicious, it was a perfect accompaniment to the asparagus and tenderloin. The tenderloin had a nice crust on it and was cooked nicely in the middle, if just a slight bit more done than I make mine. People tend to like their pork more well done than I do, so that's to be expected and I thoroughly enjoyed it.   For dessert, one of us got the chocolate cake and the other the strawberry shortcake. Both were presented nicely... but I did not get pictures. People dug into them too quickly and my phone is old. The chocolate cake was moist and just the right amount of chocolatey. I liked the accompanying berries and whipped cream. The shortcake was a little dry, but the abundance of strawberry compote and whipped cream more than made up for it. In fact, the cake being a little dry allowed it to soak up more of the strawberry goodness, which was OK by me.   I was called the next day by a member of the management, Lorenzo, I believe, to ask if everything was to my liking and if I wanted to provide any feedback. I thought that was nice and told him that we had a great experience and we would definitely be coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. Pork tenderloin with bacon risotto and asparagus - AZ restaurant week menu

q_L3s9Kk8F6qLj2haLoKzA.text: Beautiful venue, but inexcusable, sloppy mistakes with their food. I would have only given 1 star if they didn't do the right thing, which was comp our meal. My husband and I went out for dinner on Christmas Day. I spent a lot of time researching places that were open. We didn't want a buffet, but we would have been better off at Denny's.  First, they sat us outside as it was a beautiful day. The fire was crackling, it was wonderful, except that our table was right next to where all the service staff hung out, so we could hear them talking. Much more desirable tables were all around us and empty during the entire 2 hours we were there.  Second, our onion soup was brought out lukewarm. When we find someone to bring us another, I don't get a soup spoon and no one offers ground pepper.  Third, the main course: my turkey and mashed potatoes are lukewarm and my husband's filet is well-done! They take both plates back and start over. It's fixed -- although I swear the mashed potatoes are right out of a box.  Fourth, I order pecan tart, and it tastes like something brought in from the frozen food section of Safeway. It doesn't taste like anything I'd serve at home.  All this for $70 per person + taxes and tip! I would never go back to that restaurant. It's a shame because it's so pretty, but it's beauty is just skin deep.

xKHYNMQIrT_dfD9IzWuhgA.text: Food was awesome and the views were even better! Highly recommend. They also have a great happy hour - the tuna poke was awesome and the truffle fries are amazing!

bWSdZ2_m0h42edz34t-mtQ.text: Hadn't been to El Chorro since new management took over.  What a disappointment!  Weekday happy hour starts at 4:00.  Ordered a drink inside at the bar while waiting for my Meetup group, about 30 of us.  Wasn't sure which patio we were meeting on, so I asked my server, she didn't know.  5 minutes later, I ask to close out.  She informed me that since I'm part of a large group it's one tab.  I'm inside, sitting alone, and she refused to let me pay?  Brings a "manager" to explain it to me.  There are 2 guys sitting at the bar.  I ask "Do they get separate checks?".  No, they'll only split it down the middle.  Also, policy is any 6 or more people it's 25% gratuity.  So, bring your friends, just pretend like you don't know each other.  Server gave me lip, so no tip.  That's my policy.  Finally get my check & was charged full price for my so-called happy hour drink.  Maybe that's another wacky policy they have.  Been to Meetups all over the Valley.  Never had this happen.  Our organizer confirmed it all in advance, but El Chorro would rather choke on its policies.  Anyway, I'm glad it did.  Hadn't checked out the Hearth 61 bar across the street at the new Mountain Shadows.  Beautiful!  They welcomed us with open arms, lovely service, separate checks & no lip.

hpHilBO2gXVG9BAu7Xx07g.text: How do you enjoy dinner outside in Arizona? Outdoor Air Conditioning! Yup for real!  This place earns 5 stars for; atmosphere, cuisine, environment, selection and service!  The setting is out of a movie set. Outdoors is shady, cool, and wonderfully landscaped.  We enjoyed the trout, short rib and pork tenderloin as entrees. Sticky buns began the experience followed with lobster bisque, shrimp pepper pot and a great salad. If you are a Tequila snob, like me, you will have to settle with my favorite, readily available, 1942 as their top shelf selection.   As a foodie, I am rarely impressed. This place was a solid five stars. Phillip from Iowa lead our wait staff team. He knew the history of the venue, the details of the preparation of our dinner as well as how to politely not interrupt a table conversation. As usual I asked the head waiter to select my entire meal. He agreed and delivered perfectly. Next up...  Double fudge browny Sunday to finish.  Wow!

photos.caption: Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. Sangria El Chorro style
Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. Short rib perfection!
Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. Shrimp pepper pot. A maz ing!

Hm7-a89mrHpIE9Q38-4alA.text: I was pretty dissapointed with my birthday dinner at El Chorro so much that we are doing another birthday dinner to make up for this one. The restaurant was SO hot that we asked if they can turn the air conditioner on 2 times. I ordered the lobster bites. They tasted like something you would buy at a local Popeyes. It was overpriced, cheap looking and tasting. I also ordered the salad which was pretty tasteless. Nothing about El Chorro's dinner said come back and eat again.

TZOerJ3Z52YDlx3zipX-LQ.text: What an amazing destination dining experience!  We sat on the romantic patio with an awesome view of Camelback Mountain on a beautiful Pheonix afternoon and enjoyed superb food and service!  My wife had the Breakfast Tamales and I had Rancheros and both were wonderful...along with scones and sticky buns, yum!!  Definitely order a Bloody Mary...the best you'll ever have!  The gardens walking up to the restuarant were beautiful as well!  El Chorro brunch was a highlight of visit!

bpQev1LpM_0YtysBlspHxA.text: Come for the ambiance, not the food!  Being Chicago foodies, restaurants have a hard time living up to our standards. We started with the anchovy Caesar, lump crab and tuna poke, lobster Mac'n cheese and crispy chicken livers - mediocre at best. When I can create and serve better food at home and I'm not the worlds greatest cook, you know the food is ehhhh. Everything was very bland. Barely any flavors in all the dishes.   We all were praying our entrees would be better. We had the fire roasted shrimp w garlic and pine nut risotto. The shrimp were excellent, I'm sad the risotto was made with goat cheese (and I eat everything but Goat cheese!). Being such a pungent flavor, they may want to add that to the menu description. The seafood pasta week and needed seasoning, Mediterranean chicken dry, dry, dry. The best was the fresh catch of the day (Mahi) and that too was just ok.   After trying all the dishes mentioned above and not one stood out, it's disappointing. I could have bought a great handbag for the price of dinner, but it's not the loss of money that's the bummer, it was the whole aesthetics of the food experience that left us sad :((   The best part was actually the wine, and that was served lukewarm.

nm5t5LliU9EXUF9KJDePSA.text: Limited menu. Cold chicken and undercooked risotto does not make for a good Christmas celebration.  First wine served was quickly changed into a cheaper quality once dinner came.  Outdoor seating did not have proper heating.  And the cats running around eating what's left was not a pleasant sight after dining.

Rm4MD1Ft9PcLUvbD0XM2bA.text: Very disappointing! It was our 58th anniversary and we were looking forward to a amazing experience. Everything started out great. We were seated outside in their lovely courtyard. The server arrived quickly and was very enthusiastic and spend time explaining the menu and the history of the restaurant. We ordered a starter of Chicken livers and then Beef Stroganoff and the Short Ribs for the main course. The chicken livers were not crispy and came very small amount of sauce. They were very ordinary. Neither the Short ribs nor the Stroganoff had any taste of seasonings or wine, and they both were very greasy. They tasted as if they had been cooked the day before. Things only went down hill from there. The server did come back to check on us and then she completely disappeared. We ran out of water and finally we had to go to the the front desk to ask for the bill. Truly, the worst fine dining experience we have ever had. The restaurant called several days later to inquire about our experience. When I told her how disappointed we were she'd stated that the manager would call us. We have never heard from him.

aqZVaukwG06pWPBKV4akyg.text: Had an amazing time here!! Originally came in just for Happy Hour last week. Brittany was my server. She was absolutely delightful and ended up talking us into staying for dinner. The atmosphere was wonderful, and the food was delicious. I will definitely be coming back in again soon!

nKxaISQDG-_StS2ZWf-owA.text: Great Mexican.  You are given TONS of food so order light.    Only suggestion is updating the exterior- looks scary from parking lot and no windows anywhere.

UataEyQi4g35PjUZMYCO8Q.text: We went to El Chorro for the thanksgiving buffet. As it was a holiday I did not bulk at the $70/person fee, however if I am spending that kind of $ for a dinner I have expectations for food quality and service. The service was below average even for a buffet. We were not greeted as we set down and no one bothered to check if we needed drinks or to explain the layout of the dinner. Our server finally showed up 1/2 through after we asked for a glass of wine.  The only other time we saw her was with the check.  The food on the buffet was generally good. The beef tenderloin was rare and juicy, but the turkey and salmon were dry. The veggies and salad fixings were tasty however.   The wine and liquor list was good with enough variety to please most patrons.  Overall I might return on a regular night to give it another try but at regular $$. There are definitely better options in the area to patronize

BC9TesT1QnHMsLckHtLT9Q.text: I have been a regular here for more than 30 years. Our party is never less than 6 people. Today was the first time I was charged for sticky buns to go. One of my daughters was unable to join us due to her work schedule and i wanted her to Share in the experience. Despite putting up with two screaming children at the table next to us, two waiters in training from a questionable lead waiter, and spending a couple hundred dollars, I was charged $13 for the sticky buns. I am insulted, buyer beware there are other delicious restaurants in Scottsdale.

NgvMMmWWY0MGB3S7wtAsOQ.text: Meh I was under impressed. The quinoa dish was the only vegetarian entree aside from the veggie burger. I think it's overpriced for what you get. The food was somewhat bland. The truffle fries weren't bad and the sticky buns before the meal were a nice touch although I would've preferred bread and butter. The waiter was nice but a bit too much so Everytime we made eye contact the waiter would come over, it was a bit well overbearing.

gu9w0YkU6Sv96WzeUZNwKw.text: Have been looking forward to trying this place for so long since I moved to Phoenix but was sadly very disappointed. When we arrived we had our pick of sitting outside or inside, and chose outside to watch the sunset. The sat us at probably the worst table right next to the wait staff area when the place was totally dead. I ordered a cup of the lobster corn bisque, which had okay flavor but the corn was practically raw and there were zero lobster chunks in the soup. The sticky buns were the only thing that lived up to the hype. During the middle of our dinner a manager and three waiters had to have a conversation about some VIP they were seating near us and kept going on and on about how special he is and deserves the best treatment, while we on the other hand had no service at all and had to sit and listen to this. Meanwhile back by the waiting station all of the wait staff kept complaining about the tables they were getting and we had to listen to that all night too. Overall the service is what ruined the experience and I likely won't go back because of it.

jRjCgsu1aIglLzs8p_vCrA.text: I grew up in Paradise Valley, no not the Barry Goldwater part ( I WISH), the part near 32nd street and Shea Blvd.   My family did attend a church on Lincoln Drive however,for 26 years, and we often went to El Chorro for various meals, and took our of town company there a lot.   It's amazing patio and views of Camelback Mountain just say Arizona, I think.It's always been beautiful. The menu has changed a bit since I was a kid. Niman Ranch steak, what?   But the tried and True sticky buns are good, no doubt.   When I was a kid, I always wished I could have a pretty cocktail like the adults did. They looked icy and delicious. Humph. Those mean adults.   Next time I'm there I'm totally having one... or two... and my kid can watch ME.   Ha.

CKxBbmmUZ3r5-FnqxB2rPQ.text: Great outdoor patio with lots of fireplaces and twinkly lights! The atmosphere was the highlight of the evening.  We had the wedge salad and Caesar salad. Both were excellent.  I had the giant shrimp for my entree and it was great! My husband had the chicken and it was just okay. It had kind of a bitter undertone that he didn't like.  The sticky buns are amazing!!

bL0vSflgzo5ZUuHg3kUAXA.text: Your review helps others learn about great local businesses.  Please don't review this business if you received a freebie for writing this review, or if you're connected in any way to the owner or employees. A friend and I enjoyed Sunday brunch at this beautiful venue today to celebrate her birthday.  We were seated on the patio and ordered the Trout Almondine which was recommended by our server, Chris.   Our drinks arrived and then the sticky buns and pastries arrived.  Nirvana!  Out came the trout which is frankly the best I have ever tasted.  So if you are looking for a fabulous meal with impeccable servic ( request Chris ) come to El Chorro!!!

OcW0eOFH7yVtU6blKZ9ykg.text: In Spanish el chorro technically means "getting the runs" and that's exactly the case .

8opJxAEGtSMFuNUHNjW9Xg.text: Yummy! A glass of Riesling and a plate of the pork tenderloins hit the spot. Kudos to the chef! We ordered the chicken livers as our appetizer and those things took me back to the back-woods of Georgia! The barista was very friendly and chatty. I love the new renovations, but would loved to have dined in the old part. The place wasn't crowded, so that section wasn't available for dining.  There is indoor and outdoor seating available. The views from outside are gorgeous! Great place for a romantic dinner or to hang at the bar with the girls.

photos.caption: Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. First El Chollo&#39;s bar, before the renovations!

6MNpHiHy77tgqU-RsGFqZw.text: I came to Arizona prepared with all the food places i wanted to try..   El Chorro made it to my list after watching it on the Food Netowrk's 'Best Thing I Ever Ate' for it's famous Sticky Buns.....  And i must say...It didn't disappoint....  We drove to the place using my GPS. I thought it was one of those little hole in the wall places that were small and odd looking from the outside... BUT!!!!! as we drove along Paradise Valley, we saw mansions....resorts, estates....it felt like a different country.. a rich people's road definitely...and then we saw the sign "El Chorro that led up to a driveway with a parking lot and the restaurant well lit with a little valet roundabout inside.....  Felt like we were underdressed in denim shorts, and flat sandals and a tank top for me; and plain shorts, a collared shirts and slippers for my boyfriend... Walked in and found a little fountain and an outside dining area with diners happily dining... We were asked by the hostess if we had a reservation; i merely replied that "oh, we're just here to try the Sticky Buns"... and just coz i didnt want to wait for a table...we opted to sit at the bar.....  Our sticky buns came in a little basket platter. I thought it was one cinnamon roll for each of us... It came out warm and soft and doughy...with al the gooey goodness that just melts in your mouth and makes you want to eat more and more and more....I'm really not a fan of anything cinnamon-y.... it makes me sneeze and dizzy. However their sticky buns is an exception as it just has the right amount of sweetness and there's not too strong of that cinnamon flavor that overpowers the taste of the dough.  we were chatting it up with the bartender and he mentioned that El Chorro had a new owner and the old owners sold their recipe for the Sticky Buns....   It was indeed perfect.  The ambiance of the restaurant was very romantic; very intimate...it's very perfect for a reception.... I would definitely come back here to try their dinner menu and of course... make sure i leave room for the Sticky Buns.....

photos.caption: Photo of El Chorro - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. Sticky Buns!!!!!!!! really to die for!!!!!

oYgZHoNFfWSnTUkjj4Aq1w.text: As we waited for our table we could see the sun setting over the mountains while drinking a solid glass of wine.   Then we sat down in this beautiful restaurant where they brought out these cinnamon buns instead of bread. YUM. I was almost hooked on this place.  We ordered the burrata appetizer and it was done perfectly. We couldn't wait for our entree.  Then it came. We had ordered the lamb which came over a mashed potato type side. I couldn't even eat it. It was not good at all. The lamb was overcooked and lacked flavor. The side underneath it had a weird aftertaste. It was so disappointing. Everyone at our table agreed that their meals were also a letdown. The night was leading up to this phenomenal meal and it let us down. Maybe this was an isolated incident, but maybe this place survives on it's beauty and location.

6-45SSaJMRPCkUQRS3CrzQ.text: Beautiful setting, good food and service. We recently went for happy hour with another couple and had an enjoyable evening. We were shocked, however, when a waiter came by to ask us to leave because happy hour was over and he needed the table. I would have understood if there were no empty tables but more than half the patio was empty. Bad ending to an otherwise nice evening.

lqtY8DsFj2K8X1ntoz_gKw.text: Finally, I made it back here after a first failed attempt over 8 years ago.  I love, love their happy hour deals, although I had the Lavender Lemon Drop, which was delicious.  The sliders, tacos and brie platter are awesome at just $3 a pop.  I think the margaritas are also $3.  I can't wait to come back and bring my in-laws, I know they will love the setting and ambiance.  Such a beautiful place.

oZj3Vzbk0XtsdSo5AlJGkw.text: Just got home from another dinner at El Chorro.  I grew up in Paradise Valley, and I have been eating there for over twenty years.  I have always enjoyed the food as I did tonight.  Most every item on the menu is delicious.  I probably have eaten there over 50 times, but tonight may be the last time that I will eat at El Chorro.  One of the main reasons that I enjoy this restaurant is for the sticky buns.  They are the best.  Tonight, while orderings our meals, I told the waiter how much I enjoy the sticky buns and to be sure to keep my basket of them replenished throughout the meal.  He unfortunately told me that now the restaurant only gives each customer one sticky bun with dinner and if I wanted any more of them I would have to pay an additional $12.00 for a small basket of 6 buns.  I almost walked out of the restaurant after hearing that.  The sticky buns and El Chorro are a Paradise Valley landmark for so many years.  Unbelievable.  We did order dinner, with additional sticky buns and some wine.  Our bill before tip was $120.00.  I gave the waiter a generous tip as well.  I just don't understand this absurd policy change in regards to limiting the sticky buns at this restaurant.  When two people spend $150.00 for and excellent meal, why does the management charge extra for a few small sticky buns, when they never did in the past?  I understand this is a new policy that was started one year ago.  I doubt that I or any of my family and friends will be returning to eat at El Chorro in the future.  This happened on a Saturday night at 7pm in the middle of our tourist season in the valley.  The restaurant was barely half full, so I may not be the only person upset with their new policy.

2UBBqdQfSWlTAKVCGI9EWQ.text: After finding the desk filled with six women with headsets who looked and acted like they were directing a moon landing we were seated outside next to two tables of tourists wearing t shirts and cargo pants.  Menus were left and perused.  The dishes were very outdated and expensive.  Nothing looked inviting unless you were a 70 year old from Peoria or someone who doesn't dine out more than once a year.  After fifteen minutes of being ignored we left and escaped with our dignity and stomach lining intact.  Go to Arcadia!

58fsRAsQkKuaX3hUYu-piA.text: A bit stuffy for my taste...   I went there for dinner, so brunch may be a different story.  The waitress was a sweetheart and able to accommodate my food allergies, so no complaints there, but the crowd is a bit "old fashioned" to put it nicely.  Jaws agape and staring when a young couple walked in and the girls shoulders were bare. How dare she... I can only imagine their blatant stares come summer once people are in less clothing due to the 120 degree heat!

oFqCBmOXtLKV7CXFxAvbIA.text: Went for Restaurant Week, had the Perfect Table, view of Camelback, GREAT service and will be back. . .

8516StP9ihxrx2EK9qQToQ.text: It's a beautiful place where you can take pictures with the beautiful scenery in the background. I actually wish I could see what each dish looks like rather than a description of what it is. Waiters are average, they tend to forget to come back with things that I ask since they are busy. But overall, it's great.

EUh5w_zoau_yCSBu_8l3uQ.text: A delightful experience. Outside table on a lovely Saturday evening, great service by Brent, delicious salad - wine - entrees! We will be back soon.

7LMhHQz9N19QS10rNOuBrw.text: El Chorro is a Paradise Valley landmark.  The outdoor patio is gorgeous, adorned in lights and comfortably heated.  The sticky buns are amazing (and classic).  I had the sea bass catch of the day which was cooked perfectly.  The fish was served atop a sweet potato puree and garnished with fresh vegetables which complemented the fish nicely.  Everyone in my party thoroughly enjoyed their meals.    Brunch at El Chorro is fabulous.  The Benedict is superb ... as are the sticky buns and date milkshake :)

n9WqAOaNBJlwTvLfWkcJiQ.text: Went there on Wednesday night for a birthday dinner. Restaurant had limited menu and were told by the waiter that the wine list was limited because of summer time.  Had the fresh catch, RedSnapper $$$$ Fish was mushy and not at all what I expected. The  a gratin potatoes were bland. Service was very slow and they were at all not busy. Almost had to beg for the sticky buns.  The fried chicken livers were the best thing of the dinner. Have been there at least six times in the last year and if this had been the first time m, I would have not returned. Normally the wait staff is first class! When I told the waiter that the fish was mushy, he told me that the fish was flown in daily and did not offer to get the manager involved. Really disappointed on a special night and the main reason we went there was it was my wife's birthday and she wanted the chicken livers.  Not on the limited menu, but did accommodate her request.

1yP6FZH9za_EDLv4HHnqNg.text: atmosphere 4 out of 5 service 5 out of 5 - go Amy although the girls at the front were rude (knocked a star off) food 5 out of 5 - had the Chateau Briand med rare and it was delightful parking 5 out of 5 value 3 out of 5- somewhat pricey $120 for the CB  good for special events

RCQJ3V7FTC7fxZnohxdbyA.text: Valet park. The main lot is dirt :( Food was good and atmosphere was excellent.

52pFjDwzj0M2_g-jrAZXsw.text: Last night I went to the new El Chorro. It's nothing like the old El Chorro and it pulled on my heart strings to tour the beautiful, yet unrecognizable, restaurant. Nothing stays the same and I love change, but not when it involves my valley institutions. Soon nothing in my life will resemble my childhood and I will have no attachment to this town. When Avanti goes, that will for sure be the end. Ok, I'm done whining. Hey, I wasn't the only one. I noticed plenty of others reminiscing... they did happen to be my grandparents age, but I guess that just means I'm wise beyond my years. Ha.    The new El Chorro is incredible and if you knew nothing of the Old El Chorro, you'll like it that much more. It was a last minute idea to swing by for dinner and the place was packed. So packed that we couldn't get a table. I've never been without a reservation and I figured a weekday was a good time to try... think again. Luckily, the bartender (where the old bar used to be) told us not to worry because she wasn't going to turn customers away. She obviously wasn't working there the time my uncle threatened to burn down an umbrella because it was blocking the view... he did tip $100 to the guy for moving it, though. His personality allows him to say things like that without causing anyone to feel alarm... or maybe it was the $100? Anyway, El Chorro lacks nothing in the customer service department.  So we sat, my mother, her ex and me. An odd group of three. He is totally still in love with her, so I encourage these little gatherings. Between the three of us, we ordered the filet, trout, and escolar. All delicious, but I am still saddened by the menu change. No beloved eggs benedict (that was served all day). No chicken livers. No jumbo shrimp (even though it's on their menu). The only thing retained- the sticky buns. Thank God for that.    Highlight of the meal was when the bartender made some after dinner shots when he overheard us discussing dessert. I asked him, "what are these babies called?" He responded, "wet dream."  Great, I was having a shot called a wet dream with my mom and her ex. Not awkward at all. Actually, it was pretty funny and the shots were deliciously cinnamony.     El Chorro, I still love you. You're like a relative who got a facelift and although I no longer recognize you, you're still the same inside.

SijmaXjCLNKXL47qXLdfhA.text: As a professional event planner, I am VERY picky about where I do my events. Hands down, El Charro is my favorite restaurant for private group dinners and intimate special events. The food and service are exceptional, the ambiance is vintage-Arizona, the prices are appropriate, the patio is one of the best in East Valley, the location is convenient, and the owners are very friendly and engaging. The special events staff is very prompt and responsive. It is a real pleasure doing business with El Charro.

yIpmvSeRsLNPw0VRuIvRwA.text: A long time friend told me about El Chorro and I was in town and thought I'd try it. We went for brunch. Beautiful setting, very good service by Robert. Food was good, Bloody Mary was excellent (should be at $12.00). It was really hot that morning and portable air conditioners were offered to some guests but not to others.   I don't get the buns on the poor hostesses. They all look like a bunch of Stepford wives. When I was leaving I heard one of Managers (or whoever) tell one the hostesses she needed to wear lipstick next time. Really?? I wonder if he told any of the guys that. Poor girl.   I'd return just for beautiful setting but other than that probably not.

uKeLStQ45GdaMIfAGe3GRg.text: I have lived in AZ for over 25 years and had heard this was a nice place to go. For our 27 Anniversary we decided to give it a try. We had planned to sit outside but the night we went it happened to be a very chilly night because of a recent system going through the state so we sat inside.   We had drinks- gin and tonics. I had the house gin and my husband had the tanqueray. Mine tasted very chemical-ly. Noticeably different than my husbands. So I got the El Chorro Bloody Mary after that and it was good.   Then we tried some appetizers- I got the grilled cheeses- very greasy. I didn't realize (nor do they tell you in the menu) that every piece has a different cheese inside. I am not a fan of blue cheese and of course that was the first one I ate. It was gross. And also the last one I ate.  My husband had the sausage plate and he enjoyed it.   For dinner I had the special- prime rib. I asked for the end cut hoping it would not be crawling rare. Nope. It was. It was a huge piece of meat and I took most of it home, cooked it a little more, and then sliced it and added it to a salad. The twice baked potato and veggies that came with my meal were cold. Nothing fries me more than paying $200 for a meal and it being cold. Sigh. My husband had the pork tenderloin . He liked it. It came with a pile of carrots and broccolini. Niether of which he ate, and some kind of orzo which was ok.   Then we tried dessert- he wanted to try the home churned ice cream. He liked it. I got the gooey caramel butter cake. It had some ice cream on top. It was ok.  I guess I was expecting to be blown away and wasn't. It was just ok. I probably would not go back and would not recommend anyone else go. For the price it just didn't wasn't over the top. Our server was ok. They couldn't manage to get the Dbacks on the big screen that was near us. Hmmm. Why? And something else kind of weirded me out. The hostess had a nice ruffley dress on- appropriate for this type of place yet she had flip flops on. Not nice ones, but kind of too casual ratty ones. That didn't impress me either.

VHqpDNzpMy0R8gtDkBrHqQ.text: Can never go wrong with eggs Benedict, I've never tried a vegetarian style before and it was actually very delightful on my appetite and health :)

36tNUHXA6ba0om_x8SE3aA.text: Brought my parents (and friends)for 50th anniversary brunch although the sticky buns are amazing, we had complete attitude from server when we asked for more (only 2 in basket for 5 people). We had 2 rounds of drinks and full entrees. We were told that only first basket is complimentary even though menu clearly states they come with entrees. After writing email to El Chorro weeks ago with NO response...it was time to give ya'll a heads up. :)

pqApjjXn4CqJ8H62aKH0pQ.text: We decided to go here for my birthday dinner since neither of us had been.  The patio seating was beautiful & it was a nice night, so that was a bonus.  Our waiter was very nice & our water glasses were consistantly kept full.  Another bonus was the gluten free menu. We ordered the artisan cheese & charcutrie plate to start & it was very good.  We decided to split the tomato & burrata salad, which was wonderful despite the stems being left on the tomatos, seriously, who does that?!?! I'm not able to have anything with gluten, so I was not able to try the sticky buns, but I'm told by my mother-in-law that they were heaven (we took them home to her). My husband ordered the Rocky Mountain Rack of Lamb and said it was good. Now, for the bad part...I ordered the 6oz Center Cut Filet with a baked potato & I was VERY disappointed to say the least.  My steak had a very odd, almost rancid taste & it was terribly dry.  My grandfather was a cattle rancher so I know good beef & I hold very high standards for beef & this fell very short.  My baked potato had absolutly no flavor whatsoever, even after drowning it in butter & salt (I'm quite sure my blood pressure jumped a few numbers & my arteries closed a little because of this). I was given a free White Chocolate Mousse Cake for my birthday which we could barely eat because it was SO sweet.  I wasn't able to eat the oreo cookie crust, but my husband tried it & said it did help with the extra sweetness a tiny bit.  I do appreciate the thought though. The patio seating, appetizer & the salad made up for the rest of the meal, but I can honestly say that I would not return here unless it was for drinks on the patio.

TZuGJpC2kyjZzq2z75epjw.text: I would probably give it a 4.5.  The sticky buns are all they're cracked up to be!! Delicious. I ordered the filet and it was delicious and like butter. I ordered it medium rare, I know it's not how ladies usually order it... I even got a double ask from the server; honestly, I wouldn't go above medium to keep the integrity of this fine cut of meat. The scalloped potatoes were pretty great too! My date ordered the special of the night prime rib with southwestern mac and cheese. It was very good, but my filet was better.   The patio with this weather was absolutely perfect! I would go again for a special occasion.

jTzcOMp29tUUm1RAWouaHg.text: Not only is the happy hour a great deal with a beautiful large outdoor patio, but the grounds offer a great wedding venue with one of the kindest wedding coordinators, Lindsey!

iErMekcRwKr-yYtaIgaNPg.text: When we heard this place had happy hour throughout the week, we thought we might actually be able to afford to go there!  We went on a Sat. at 4pm, we're gen-x'ers with sleep deprivation, so it works ;-) They had bbq pork, cheese, and veggies - free! However, this only lasted about 30 mins. - was good, but ran out fast. We also ordered 2 glasses of white wine - pretty good for house select. The staff is always friendly, and even though we ordered the buffalo burger the next time (eh, pass - too gamey/salty), service is always great.  Not sure we'd ever order many entrees besides apps off the menu again...We actually go because it's close and has great outdoor seating. Is nice when it's cool  out and you don't want to schlep around to find an easy going atmosphere.

0BuGNvEvcT_faI0dI8tKqg.text: Great service, atmosphere, and food. Good wine selection too. I like the outdoor seating with all the fireplaces. Great for a date or large party. I had the salmon for dinner and it was cooked to perfection. Don't leave without having a sticky bun.

u33uTtw02OjGNvvmcM29tQ.text: So much history in this place! When the long-time owner was retiring several years ago, it looked like the place was going to close. A local Paradise Valley resident stepped up to the plate, bought the place, did some reno, and the place is once again a local favorite, and a hit with tourists, too. The view from the bar or outside seating area can't be beat. Ambience inside is nice. Expect an older clientele. It is in ritzy PV, so don't expect low prices. I've only had dinner here once shortly after it re-opened, and it was for a group event. I thought the food was mediocre but maybe they've since worked out kitchen issues.  Anybody who has been to El Chorro raves about the sticky buns. Personally, I don't think they are that great. I've had them a couple of times, and they were just okay - dry and not overly flavorful. They certainly didn't live up to the high expectations. I'm probably the only one that feels that way!!  Been here a number of times for happy hour, which is pretty decent (Mon-Sat 4-6pm) - complimentary sliders, fruit and a variety of hors d'ouevres.  The happy hour menu also has a nice variety of small plates, but you aren't going to find potato skins or fried mozzarella sticks here - this place is high-brow. The grilled sausage trio is good as are the street tacos. The El Chorro margaritas are sooo good; my friend always tries one of the seasonal specialty cocktails and has never been disappointed.

vfRBeC3bDqRU99CmD8o9DA.text: Attended a friend's wedding here this past weekend and I cannot say enough great things about it.  I can't speak for the restaurant since we were in the back hall for special events, but for a wedding it was perfect!   Gorgeous atmosphere and scenery.  There was TONS of space for the ceremony, outdoor cocktail hour and the reception inside with a decent sized dance floor!  Also it felt very private so no restaurant patrons around or cutting through, which is a plus in my book.  I would highly recommend as a place to get hitched!  Now I just need to come back to AZ so I can test out the restaurant.

WS8LeB_6y9y6YQRL8HZS8A.text: Thank you for showing me How Great El Chorro can be! It's Great to know when management really cares about their company. I truly appreciate the contact.

5aRcGA1s7gwpDgjolWi3Mg.text: I like the atmosphere. I took my girlfriend here. She's from NYC and really loved it. The food was okay.

_vTp2BgpRWzW6A3mxF5DPw.text: We visit El Chorro every year when we come to Phoenix for Spring Training. It is always a lovely delicious restaurant. One thing that always strikes us is how professional, courteous and attentive the wait we I e is. They go above and beyond as a team working to give every table impeccable service! We always have the chicken liver appetizer which is unique and delicious. We really enjoyed the seafood pasta and free range chicken as well. Wish we had a restaurant like this in San Diego!

xPV_8M-7U5Sf8nYSymLcug.text: Stopped in with a group for brunch. What's not to love? There is such ambiance at EC. It's warm and inviting. The food was wonderful, and our server was an absolute doll. Thank you so much for a wonderful meal!

rwA5MrhT_nnH7NUU8GKDTA.text: Would have made 4 stars but my wife and always split a dinner, we spilt  the spinach salad, it was good. They split our filet for us, we asked for medium and we were very specific about it, we asked the server if it was pink in the middle, is said yes but we charge $7 to split it. I said no problem I understand, now $7 makes that steak a $40 filet, I'm thinking it's gonna be good. It was well done and flavorless, we choked it down.  The sticky buns were not out of this world either. The guest we went with enjoyed their meal, that is why I gave 3 stars. If you want the best steak....Ruths Chris rarely makes a mistake cooking  it right....

Av_Ygq854N1iJ03dmba32Q.text: This is perfect.  Really good.  One of the best fillets I've had.  Look how easy that is to cut.   Shut up!  Is that right?  Best steak I've ever had. lol. I'd definitely go here and buy steaks.
